description:
DESCRIPTION Accepting online applications only. Apply online 24 hours a day, beginning February 3, 2017 through 4:30 p.m., March 3, 2017.

EXAMPLES OF DUTIES Under supervision, performs increasingly complex and responsible petroleum engineering and/or geology work pertaining to oil field development, oil and gas production operations, enhanced recovery methods, and other related work; participates in project teams for economic and operational evaluation of field activities and reservoir surveillance; participates in evaluating procedures to ensure oil field environmental and safety regulatory compliance; prepares, reviews or assists in the preparation of petroleum engineering projects, studies, and programs pertaining to oil field development, oil and gas production operations, drilling, oil and gas reserves, field equipment, secondary recovery, enhanced oil recovery, abandonment operation; assists in the planning of oil field, community and industrial development to ensure oil operations compatibility with competitive land use areas; participates in developing operational plans to optimize economic oil recovery; evaluates contracts and regulations pertaining to the oil operations; assists in the development of oil fields budget; assists in the preparation and the making of formal oral presentations to City, Department, contractor, and regulatory personnel; may conduct physical and chemical tests concerning oil, gas and water; may perform in a lead capacity over subordinate personnel; and performs other related duties as required.

REQUIREMENTS TO FILE Candidates must meet requirement A or B:
A. Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in Petroleum Engineering or Chemical Engineering (proof required)*.
B. Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in a closely related field (proof required) *, and two years (full-time equivalent) of experience in petroleum engineering, petroleum geology, oil field operations, or other petroleum related operations.

Candidates must also meet the following requirements:
  • Knowledge and ability to operate computers using spreadsheets, word processing, and other business and technical software pertaining to petroleum engineering.
  • Willingness to work occasional weekends, holidays, and split shifts.
  • A valid driver's license is required by the hiring department.
*Proof of required documents must be uploaded to the application at the time of filing. Candidates who possess degrees from colleges or universities from outside the United States must attach proof of educational equivalence at the time of filing.

DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS: Wilmington Oil Field experience; water flood operations experience; Engineer-in-Training certificate issued by the State Board of Registration for Professional Engineers.

SELECTION PROCEDURE This is a continuous examination. All applicants meeting the requirements to file will be placed on the eligible list, with those receiving Veteran's credit first, and then in the order in which applications were filed.

If you have not received notification by January 27, 2017 contact the Civil Service Department at (562) 570-6202.

This information is available in an alternative format by request to (562) 570-6202.

If special accommodation is desired, please contact the Civil Service Department two (2) business days prior to the test at (562) 570-6202.
An Equal Employment Opportunity

title: PETROLEUM ENGINEERING ASSOCIATE

description:
Member of the Research Staff to drive research into new manufacturing processes for battery electrodes

About the Job

The Advancement Manufacturing and Deposition Systems group within the Hardware System Laboratory is looking for quality candidate to drive research into new manufacturing processes for battery electrodes. The ideal candidate will have a history developing new techniques for battery manufacturing and the ability to drive new research directions. PARC has a significant portfolio of innovative battery manufacturing technology and wants to continue to develop and explore new opportunities.

Requirements:
  • PhD in mechanical engineering, chemistry, chemical engineering, or another relevant field
  • Experience with printing processing, slot coating, roll-to-roll processing, or screen printing
  • Background in battery chemistry
  • Strong publication record
  • Research
Desired Qualifications:
  • Ability to direct research projects
  • Track record of successful project execution
  • Knowledge of fluid mechanics, mechanics, and fluid rheology
  • Experience in an industrial manufacturing environment
Benefits

We offer a very competitive salary package and full benefits (medical, dental, vision, life & disability insurance, 401K. PARC also strives for the best possible work-life balance, so employees benefit from maternity, paternity and adoption leave, as well as a variety of flexible working options. PARC employees enjoy the use of onsite health & fitness center and collegial dining at our onsite cafeteria. The PARC campus is in a spacious modern building in close proximity to the resources and opportunities of Silicon Valley and benefits from nearby leading universities such as Stanford and Berkeley. It is also close to many amenities, top schools, and outdoor activities (see http://www.parc.com/about/culture.html). PARC provides a highly diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer (see http://www.parc.com/about/careers/).

About PARC

PARC, a Xerox company, is in the Business of Breakthroughs®. Practicing open innovation, we provide custom R&D; services, technology, expertise, best practices, and intellectual property to Fortune 500 and Global 1000 companies, startups, and government agencies and partners. We create new business options, accelerate time to market, augment internal capabilities, and reduce risk for our clients.

Since its inception, PARC has pioneered many technology platforms – from the Ethernet and laser printing to the GUI and ubiquitous computing – and has enabled the creation of many industries. Incorporated as an independent, wholly owned subsidiary of Xerox in 2002, PARC today continues the research that enables breakthroughs for our clients' businesses.

PARC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. People with disabilities who need a reasonable accommodation to apply or compete for employment with PARC should contact PARC Human Resources.
title: Member of Research Staff

description:
At GenapSys we are working to change the world of healthcare and diagnostics. Our team brings together an incredibly diverse and multidisciplinary set of backgrounds and skills – from electrical and mechanical engineers, to physicists, chemists, microfluidic engineers, molecular biologists, bioinformaticians, mathematicians and more. Together we will advance scientific and medical knowledge and improve human health through cheaper, faster, and more accurate DNA sequencing technologies. We are working cross functionally to make a great impact in the world – join us on that mission!

We’re looking for a talented and organized team player to work at a fast-paced startup. This individual will be eager and enthusiastic, and someone who wants to take on many responsibilities. In essence, this position requires someone who is willing to roll up his/her sleeves and work hard to push product development forward. Formal educational background may include: molecular biology, organic chemistry, chemical engineering, biophysics, and bioengineering.

Responsibilities

  • Design, execute, document, and analyze molecular biology experiments
  • Data driven - critically evaluate new/optimized reagents for the GenapSys sample prep
  • Optimize the laboratory workflow associated with the GenapSys platform
  • Help drive productivity increases through technological insights, exceptional time management skills and a ‘can do’ approach to the challenges at hand
  • Collaborate well within a multidisciplinary organization
  • Follow and develop well-documented SOPs
Required Qualifications

  • Masters in a field such as biology, bioengineering, chemistry or chemical engineering
  • M.S. with 2+ years of experience preferred
  • Hand-on experience with molecular biology and biochemistry techniques, e.g. PCR and Isothermal amplification, NGS sample preparation, nucleic acid techniques etc.
  • Proven ability to solve scientific and engineering problems
  • Detail oriented, excellent organizational and communication skills and efficienct at getting task done
  • Ambitious and looking to take on additional responsibilities
Benefits & Perks

  • Competitive compensation and stock options
  • Anthem Blue Cross PPO and Kaiser Medical (including for dependents)
  • Excellent Dental and Vision through Guardian
  • Fully sponsored Life, Short and Long-term Disability insurance
  • FSA, 401(k) retirement plan
  • Stocked kitchen and beverages, daily catered gourmet lunches
  • Weekly Fancy High Tea and Happy Hours
  • Free complex onsite gym membership
  • Learning and growth opportunities
About GenapSys

At GenapSys, we are developing a DNA-sequencing technology that will revolutionize the world of healthcare. Our system will enable fast, accurate, and ultra-low cost genetic tests in order to better understand (and ultimately treat) genetic diseases such as Cancer, Parkinson’s, Diabetes, and Alzheimers, just to name a few. GenapSys was founded by Dr. Hesaam Esfandyarpour, and incubated over 6 years (2004-2010) at Stanford University. The company was incorporated in early 2010 and is funded by leading firms in both venture and institutional capital. We have built an incredible team of scientists, engineers, and business professionals – join our team and be part of the adventure!
title: Research Associate

description:
Covance Food Solutions, formerly National Food Lab is looking to add a Process Engineer to our Product Development Consulting Services team. This position is responsible for designing and leading complex process development projects consistent with strategic plans. They oversee the technical operations of the process development and pilot plant areas, and maintain and improve quality programs and capabilities of the process development group. This is an exciting time to join a company where you are able to cross train on a variety of projects. Additional responsibilities include:

• Plans and designs specific activities required by the projects and distributes activities to Process Technologist or Intern based on skill sets.
• Designs and leads complex process development projects in Covance development labs and pilot plants.
• Manages all aspects of projects from raw material procurement, equipment selection, production line set up, cleaning and sanitation, processing procedures, food safety/quality requirements, trial execution, and commercialization support.
• Client contact and sales support in support of Company financial objectives and strategies. This position has responsibility for communicating new opportunities, and working with Covance staff to set-up and make sales calls and participate in sales programs (e.g., IFT meetings, etc.).
• Interface with Clients to develop project plans for pilot plant trials, studies, projects, and to develop proposals based on those plans. Follow up on all proposals and cost estimates, and communicate results to the appropriate people within Covance.
• Support the ongoing project management efforts of the process development group to meet or exceed customer needs.
• Coordinate joint product and process development projects with the Product Development Technical Managers, including staffing, project costs, pilot plant schedules, and quality of output.
• Develop and maintain technical skills needed for the process development segment.
• Supervise staff affiliated with process development projects including project leaders, pilot plant supervisors, Technologists and Technicians. Develop and maintain a strong team.
• Manage the ongoing project priorities and workflow of the process development group. Identify scheduling conflicts and needs for temporary help and/or additional resources (e.g., staff, capital, etc.).
• Maintain and improve the ongoing quality of output from process development.
• Investigate new/existing technologies, which represent new capabilities/potential marketing opportunities.
• Coordinate pilot plant schedule and operations, including maintenance of the facility and equipment, and establishing and monitoring standard operating guidelines for the pilot plant operations to ensure high quality output.
• Coordinate with Covance Food Safety and QA teams to ensure compliance with applicable food processing regulations, good manufacturing procedures, good laboratory practices, and safety.
• Understand FDA, USDA, EPA, OSHA, and State of California requirements for Covance’s food processing facilities. File any required documentation for the pilot plant and/or food labs.
• Travel as required to support sales calls, project work, and or production scale up.

Education/Qualifications
Required:
• Masters or Bachelor’s Degree in Food or Chemical Engineering or closely related field, with 7-10+ years industry experience, or a combination of education and experience demonstrating an ability to perform the essential functions of the position.

Experience
Required:
• Masters or Bachelor’s Degree in Food or Chemical Engineering or closely related field, with 7-10+ years industry experience, or a combination of education and experience demonstrating an ability to perform the essential functions of the position.
• Knowledge of regulatory agency guidelines.
• Knowledge of: Process development of a wide variety of foods and beverages, food processing equipment and operations including understanding the chemical microbiological and engineering effects of operations, thermal processing, packaging materials, sanitation procedures, project management, and experimental design.
• Proficiency in project management skills.
• Ability to conduct review of related literature and references to obtain the required information and subsequently apply it.
• Skilled in data interpretation and report writing.
• Skilled in performing scientific presentations and preparing scientific publications.
• Excellent interpersonal skills.

EEO Employer
Covance is committed to diversity in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer (Minority/Female/Individual with Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity). Your confidentiality and privacy are important to us.
title: Process Engineer

description:
We are seeking an experienced, highly motivated Process Engineer in support of cell therapy manufacturing, equipment development and process flows. This position will also play a significant role in the technical support of the construction of our GMP facility.

Primary Responsibilities:
Providing equipment engineering support for process at NantKwest

Resolving technical issues with equipment as it pertains to the process requirements

Optimizing process equipment, identifying root cause for deviation, defining corrective/preventive action

Support FAT/SAT, commissioning, and validation from a process perspective, draft SOPâs equipmentâs and define user specifications

Provide technical support during cGMP audits

Train manufacturing personnel in equipment operations

Manage, analyze, and identify trends in data.

Draft documents including batch documentation, validation protocols, evaluation protocols/reports, investigation reports, and standard operating procedures (SOPs).

Support internal and external auditors and regulatory agencies, as needed, during inspections.

Support investigations relating to manufacturing issues, product release performance, and/or equipment issues

Ensure that appropriate procedures are established to support Design for Manufacturability and Process/Product Reliability

Perform other duties as required and assigned.

Education/Experience Requirements:
BS in Chemical Engineering or related fields, MS desired

6+ years of industrial experience in process engineering

Strong computer programming and software development experience

Experience using software tools for process simulation, design, and programming

NantKwest is an innovative clinical-stage immunotherapy company focused on harnessing the power of the innate immune system by using the natural killer cell to treat cancer, infectious diseases and inflammatory diseases.
title: Process Engineer

description:
Kerr Corporation,

one of the many successful companies owned by Danaher Corporation is a manufacturer of premiere dental consumables sold both domestically and internationally. Since 1891, Kerr has continued to build on its core competencies in developing innovative products for dental restorative procedures. With manufacturing, marketing and sales locations worldwide, Kerr is advancing esthetic dentistry through education and sustainable solutions for the clinician. Kerr's team spirited work environment encourages opportunities for personal and professional growth. Headquartered in Orange, CA., Kerr employs over 2,000 associates worldwide with manufacturing and administration offices located in the US, Switzerland, Czech Republic, and Italy.

Description

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Design and carry out experiments that scientifically confirm performance, reliability, and shelf life.

Independently conducts work in agreement with supervisor. Designs and carries out experimental work using appropriate methods and instrumentation.

Able to lead portions of NPD and Sustaining projects with minimal supervision; is accountable for achievement of parts of project plan for NPD and Sustaining projects. Can lead Sustaining projects of low to moderate complexity independently.

Suggest experimental approaches to complex problems and carry out investigations independently. Ability to prioritize.

Collaborate on plan for design verification studies, carry out design verification studies.

Independently plan schedule of research according to company’s timetable, and establish daily or weekly routines necessary to meet project timetable.

Develop research plan and design experiments of a complex nature.

Records experimental data according to established procedures, makes calculations, evaluates results, makes recommendations and maintains accurate records of work.

Prepare standard technical reports and memos. Summarizes and communicates data of a complex nature as required.

Identifies deficiencies and modifies/improves existing procedures. Authors operating procedures as needed.

Develops solutions to problems of intermediate and advanced scope. Skilled in problem solving and root cause analysis.

Independently conducts problem solving investigations, identified root causes. Can supervise corrective and preventive actions at basic and intermediate level.

Contributes to design of experiments at an intermediate and advanced level, can design simple to complex experiments.

Provides training to research associates.

Develop in-depth knowledge of new and existing products.

Evaluation of ideas, competition products and new technologies.

Perform other duties as responsibilities necessitate.

Ensure internal contract manufacturers manufacture according to specifications and work instructions, demonstrate capability to and ensure quality metrics are achieved by manufacturing partners.

Coordinate ongoing product stability studies.

Qualifications

Qualifications:
Minimally BS degree in chemical engineering, biomedical engineering, or related fields.

A minimum 5+ years of industrial laboratory experience are required.

Preferred Qualifications:
Alternatively, an MS in chemical engineering or related fields and minimum 2 years of experience.

The Candidate should:
Possess an understanding of good laboratory practices.

Be proficient with Microsoft Word and Excel.

Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Possess strong organizational/time management skills.

Physical Demands:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit. The employee is frequently required to walk. The employee is occasionally required to stand. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Kerr Corporation

is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Danaher Corporation Overview

Danaher is a global science & technology innovator committed to helping our customers solve complex challenges and improve quality of life worldwide. Our world class brands are leaders in some of the most demanding and attractive industries, including life sciences, medical diagnostics, dental, environmental and industrial solutions. Our globally diverse team of 59,000 associates is united by a common culture and operating system, the Danaher Business System, which serves as our competitive advantage. We generated $16.5B in revenue last year. We are ranked #133 on the Fortune 500 and our stock has outperformed the S&P; 500 by more than 2,000% over 20 years.

At Danaher, you can build a career in a way no other company can duplicate. Our brands allow us to offer dynamic careers across multiple industries. We’re innovative, fast-paced, results-oriented, and we win. We need talented people to keep winning. Here you’ll learn how DBS is used to shape strategy, focus execution, align our people, and create value for customers and shareholders. Come join our winning team.

:

Kerr

:

Primary Location

:

title: Research Scientist/Chemist/Engineer - ERC

description:
We currently are seeking a dynamic, strategic, and innovative Scientist, Research & Development . This key position will be based in our operations facility in Valencia, CA (So. CA).

For more than 40 years, Pharmavite has been a trusted leader in the wellness industry, recognized for providing quality vitamins, minerals and supplements and all natural snacks under our Nature Made® and SOYJOY® brand names.

Our mission: People creating new products for better health worldwide.

Our vision: Inspiring the healthiest you through more complete nutrition...Wherever you are in life.

As a member of the Pharmavite team, employees enjoy competitive salaries and an exceptional benefits package featuring medical, dental, vision, 401K, life insurance, and long term disability coverage. In addition, employees enjoy educational assistance, credit union membership, substantial discounts on our products, and 11 paid holidays per year.

Position Summary:

Responsible for all aspects of the product and process development from pre-formulation to commercialization for all dosage forms. Effectively utilizes standard best practices and procedures in product and process development. Explores and conducts research in relevant technologies. Provides and drives technology advancements in various dosages to drive innovation and point of difference for the brands. Interfaces effectively with marketing, manufacturing, technical operations and other cross functional areas to accomplish project goals.

Responsibilities:
  • Collaborates with inside & outside entities to develop and drive technology advancements.
  • Develops intellectual properties in supplement technology relating to composition, usage, and process that will result in viable patents and/or competitive advantages. Develops prototypes to demonstrate application of new technologies.
  • Independently designs and conducts well designed experiments to provide technology advancements for supplement applications. Presents relevant findings to R&D; management and appropriate technical groups.
  • Develops formulations and processes to support the development of new and novel products and/or optimization of existing products. Responsible for the coordination and execution of bench-top, pilot, manufacturing scale-up and verification batches with speed and robustness.
  • Effectively navigates through complex formulation & technical challenges. Able to trouble-shoot and provide workable solutions to highly complex formulations.
  • Maintains accurate records of all development projects. Prepares all relevant technical documents such as raw material and bulk specifications, SOP's, manufacturing batch records, technology transfer documents and any other relevant documents in the development and commercialization of the products.
  • Prepares stability, consumer and clinical samples. Prepares reviews and approves stability protocols. Works effectively with R&D; Analytical to monitor, evaluate, summarize and interpret results of stability studies.
  • Maintains awareness of current development in the functional discipline. Develops & maintains a vast network of vendors, consultants, and educators in order to leverage emerging and enabling technologies.
  • Provides scientific leadership to Marketing and other cross-functional disciplines to accomplish project goals.
  • Communicates and leads effectively in a cross functional team environment and serves as a scientific SME in solving complex formulation/process issues.
  • Trains and mentors others in developing new products; conducts appropriate experiments and instructs in the proper use of laboratory and manufacturing equipment.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.
Minimum Qualifications:

Education:

Requires a four-year college or university degree or its equivalent in Chemistry, Pharmacy, Food Science, Chemical Engineering or other relevant science degree. Masters or PHD preferred.

Certification:

None.

Experience:
  • Bachelor's degree requires at least 8 years of relevant experience in product development in the Nutraceutical or Pharmaceutical industry.
  • Master's degree requires 3 - 8 years' experience of relevant experience in product development in the Nutraceutical or Pharmaceutical industry.
  • PhD degree requires 2 - 5 years' experience of relevant experience in product development in the Nutraceutical or Pharmaceutical industry.
  • Practical experience in Design of Experiment is preferred.
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Requires:
  • Competent in interpreting and understanding scientific and technical literature and reporting findings in application oriented reports and presentations.
  • Demonstrated strong depth of research knowledge and skills with the ability to statistically analyze data.
  • Strong project, organizational and time management skills. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal are required.
  • Comprehensive knowledge and practical experience in product/process development, processing laboratory techniques and regulatory requirements and a firm foundation in chemistry, mathematics, pharmaceutical and/or food science.
Physical Requirements:

Manufacturing and general office environment, ability to sit for long periods of time.

Environment:

Moderate exposure to disagreeable elements. Frequent work in pilot plant and production facilities.

Safety:

The incumbent must be able to perform this job safely in accordance with standard operating procedures and good manufacturing practices, without endangering the health or safety of self or others.

Supervisory Responsibility:

The incumbent has no direct supervisory responsibility. May guide and assign the work of others.
title: Scientist, Research & Development

description:
The Scientist, Drug Delivery & Biomaterials plans, directs, and executes dermal research formulation and drug delivery system development to support nonclinical studies and clinical trials for dermatological and aesthetic indications. A key element of this position is the development of novel dosage forms for enhancing, targeting or sustaining dermal delivery of small and large drug molecules. This incumbent will provide scientific and technical leadership for the development of topical research formulations and the evaluation of dermal drug delivery technologies within Global Pharmaceutical Sciences.

Main Areas of Responsibilities

Demonstrates strong lab skills in preparing and characterizing topical formulations, designing and conducting skin permeation studies, and applying and developing various analytical methods.

Demonstrates scientific excellence through scientific reports, published articles in peer-reviewed journals, society participation, regulatory filings, and/ or patents.

Applies current CMC regulatory requirements and guidance to support global registration of new products.

Represents department at project team meetings and works closely with other research groups such as Pharmacology, Pharmacokinetics, and Toxicology as well as CMC related departments such as Pharmaceutical Sciences, Process Chemistry, Regulatory Affairs, Quality, Clinical Development and Marketing to meet project timelines and objectives.

Exhibits leadership skills that result in good performance and career development of junior staff.

Requirements

The following listed requirements need to be met at a minimum level to be considered for the job:

Hands-on experience with semi-solid/suspension dosage forms, e.g. topical formulations including gels, creams, and patches

Analytical method development and analysis using HPLC and ELISA

Ability to function as a CMC team leader and utilize knowledge of pharmaceutical science, chemical engineering, literature and experience to guide decisions in complex situations.

May require < 10% travel.
Preferred Skills/Qualifications

The below skills are attributes that may not be mandatory, but are definitely desired in the ideal candidate.

Experience with physical and chemical stability, including potency, rheological property, and particle size measurements

Patents in the area of specialization and scientific publications in areas of specialization

Knowledge of fundamental applications of statistics
Education

Ph.D. level education, preferably in the pharmaceutical sciences with 2 years specific related experience OR; M.S. with 4+ years of industrial experience.

  • LI-DM3

description:
Design Group is a leading engineering, systems integration, and technology consulting firm, capable of providing complete operating solutions for consumer products, life sciences, and other industrial sectors. Design Group provides engineering, project management, regulatory compliance, and other technology services to the world’s leading companies. Our organization is staffed by over 1,000 engineering and technical specialists, operating from over 35 offices in the U.S. and Puerto Rico. Design Group provides professional engineering, architectural and construction management services through our wholly owned and professionally licensed subsidiary, Design Group Facility Solutions, Inc.

We are focused on providing our professionals with opportunities for leadership and career advancement within a thriving work environment and a unique “people-centric” culture. We offer a robust, centralized learning and development program to improve the career experience for every professional.

title: Validation Engineer

description:
PROCESS ENGINEER

Zero Waste Energy (“ZWE”) , is an industry-leading development company that designs, builds, and operates integrated solid waste facilities. With extensive expertise and advanced technologies, ZWE offers innovative mixed solid waste processing and patented anaerobic digestion systems for conversion of organic waste into valuable renewable energy and clean compost.

We have an exciting opportunity for a Process Engineer working in our headquarters in Lafayette, CA. Reporting to the VP of Project Management, the Process Engineer is responsible for the design and analysis of gas and liquid process systems for organic waste treatment, including piping, ductwork, equipment, and vendor packages. The Process Engineer will perform detailed calculations and analysis of all system elements and prepare drawings of systems. The Process Engineer will specify materials, and create technical performance specifications for system equipment and instrumentation.

Specific Responsibilities:

  • Design and review process flow diagrams, schematics, and piping and instrumentation diagrams for major equipment and systems, and analyze/understand for overall facility integration.
  • Create, analyze, and optimize mass, energy, and water balances for anaerobic and aerobic digestion processes.
  • Size and estimate process piping and ductwork.
  • Analyze gas, air, and liquid systems for proper material application and complete specifications of system components to achieve process objectives.
  • Prepare equipment lists and specify major equipment for purchase. Supervise equipment vendors, including shop drawing review, for successful and complete fabrication of parts.
  • Create detailed design drawings and specifications using 2D or 3D plant modeling software based on mass and energy balance calculations and analysis. Specify system equipment for integration into the processes.
  • Prepare detailed facility general arrangement drawings to specify significant components of the facility. Coordinate with team members to design, lay out or detail components and systems and to resolve design or other problems. Modify and revise design to correct operating deficiencies or to reduce production problems.
  • Support installation and commissioning of new systems. Provide technical support to the operations team.
  • Work collaboratively with the Senior Controls Engineer, Project Engineer, and other internal and external stakeholders to ensure “Best-In-Class” Facility Design.

To be successful in this position, you must possess:

  • A Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical, Civil, Environmental or Chemical Engineering with a minimum of 5 years’ experience designing plant systems and/or major piping system designs.
  • Must be proficient in AutoCAD and have an excellent understanding of P&IDs; and PFDs. Proficiency with AutoDesk Plant required.
  • Must have solid understanding of process piping and fluid system design
  • Familiarity of fluid dynamics, thermodynamics of fluids and solids and material properties required.
  • Experience in anaerobic digestion a plus. Experience with organic waste treatment systems is a plus.
  • Ability to work autonomously combined with excellent problem solving skills to effectively research answers to conceptual questions utilizing internal and external resources
  • Excellent time management skills; thrives in a deadline driven environment juggling multiple priorities and projects
  • Upbeat, positive, high energy with a “can do” attitude; reacts well under pressure
  • Extremely reliable and dependable: Timely and complete deliverables are the norm. We are a results-oriented organization!

Zero Waste Energy offers our employees a wide variety of comprehensive rewards and benefits including:

  • Competitive pay
  • Medical
  • Vision
  • Dental, including Orthodontia
  • Short-Term and Long-Term Disability insurance
  • Life & Accidental Death and Dismemberment insurance
  • 401(k) with company match
  • Generous pay for time off, including vacation, holiday, sick, bereavement, jury duty
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Flexible Spending Account
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Targeted learning and development opportunities
  • Positive and friendly work environment

And so much more!

This is an exciting time to be a leader in a rapidly growing company on the verge of even greater success. If you think you have what it takes to be part of a company that strives to create a working environment that stimulates team spirit, passion, engagement and achievement, we want to hear from you!

Visit our website to learn more about Zero Waste Energy . Please click the Careers Link to apply (which will redirect you to our parent company’s career page, Bulk Handling Systems): zerowasteenergy.com

Zero Waste Energy values diversity in its work force and is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity, Affirmative Action, and compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act.

title: Process Engineer

description:
SpaceX was founded under the belief that a future where humanity is out exploring the stars is fundamentally more exciting than one where we are not. Today SpaceX is actively developing the technologies to make this possible, with the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.

Manufacturing Development Engineer (Launch Vehicle Integration)

Overview :

This engineer will be responsible for the final stage of the vehicle’s internal assembly. This involves constant improvement of the manufacturing and flushing process, development of walk down and documentation procedures, and validation that the vehicle meets acceptable standards of quality, workmanship, and cleanliness.

Responsibilities:
  • Develop process, procedures, systems and acceptance criteria for as-built hardware configuration validation and vehicle cleanliness.
  • Implement new designs and changes to flight hardware, rapidly developing and qualifying new processes to take products from prototype to high-volume production.
  • Resolve manufacturing discrepancies and interface with the quality team to implement efficient corrective actions.
  • Design for manufacturing during design development and improvement cycles.
  • Identify and eliminate process waste, streamline production processes and enable continuous improvement.
  • Identify, plan, and execute capital equipment, machine, and layout upgrades to the meet volume production demand.

Basic Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in mechanical/electrical/aerospace/chemical engineering OR Physics.
  • Minimum 1 year of metallic manufacturing experience such as: machining, welding, drilling, and automation.
  • 2+ years of collegiate extracurricular engineering project experience, such as Formula SAE, Baja SAE, Design Build Fly Team, OR 2+ years of industry Product design/development experience.

Preferred Skills and Experience:
  • 1+ years of experience in design and manufacturing of mechanical assemblies.
  • Mechanical component and/or tooling design and analysis (3D CAD-based).
  • Expertise in design for manufacturability and design for assembly: successfully taking products from prototype to high-volume production.
  • Knowledge of metallic manufacturing techniques, processes, and equipment related to: machining, welding, drilling, and automation.
Additional Requirements:
  • This is a hands-on position that requires one to be on their feet for up to 4+ hours a day.
  • Will sometimes be working directly with the hardware on the floor and will have to be comfortable stooping, bending, and standing.
  • Must be willing to work long hours and weekends as necessary.

ITAR Requirements:
  • To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, applicant must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about ITAR here .

SpaceX is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with SpaceX is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.

Applicants wishing to view a copy of SpaceX’s Affirmative Action Plan for veterans and individuals with disabilities, or applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application/interview process should notify the Human Resources Department at (310) 363-6000.

description:
The Honest Company is expanding our Product Development team! We’re looking for a Research Chemist to support research and innovation efforts for our hair care, household cleaning and skincare lines. In this role, you’ll be expected to formulate within the strict guidelines of The Honest Company to produce innovative and effective products in various categories to ensure sustainable growth and profitability.

What you’ll do:
  • Aid in batch upscale and production in both a technical and supervising role
  • Benchmark competitive products and reverse-engineer based off product standards
  • Respond to incoming manufacturing and customer questions by providing detailed technical research-based information and documentation
  • Provide toxicology analysis of materials, both on human and environmental health, for new and existing ingredients and materials
  • Work directly with raw material and manufacturing suppliers to identify, assess, and create communication strategy around chemical sourcing and manufacturing procedures
  • Research and recommend raw materials
  • Maintain accurate and complete records and report findings in the form of technical documents, presentations, and standard operating procedures
  • Provide technical guidance to the Product team through education and consultative assistance to professional staff
You’ll love this job if you’re:
  • A dynamite problem solver and project manager. You’re always thinking (at least) one step ahead
  • A strong communicator and collaborator. You work effectively with all members of the organization, from individual contributors to top execs
  • Adaptable and ambitious. You will enthusiastically take on other assignments as needed to support your team!
What you’ll need:
  • Bachelor’s degree in chemistry, biology, biochemistry, or related scientific field
  • 3-5 years experience in the cosmetic, skincare, personal care, and/or home cleaning industries
  • Passion for and knowledge of natural and organic ingredients
  • Strong development skills in ingredient functionality, material selection, and formulation
  • Strong working knowledge of both lab-scale and manufacturing scale formulating and chemical engineering
  • Strong knowledge of cGMP, QC, FDA, and EPA regulations as they relate to cosmetics, OTC drugs and household cleaners
  • Willingness to travel up to 20% as needed
Bonus points:
  • Master’s degree in chemistry, biology, biochemistry or related scientific field
title: Research Chemist

description:
Founded in 2013 and based in the San Francisco Bay Area, Zymergen is a technology company unlocking the power of biology. We deliver better economics for products made from biology that are used across industries, bring new products to market faster, and develop novel products. Our proprietary platform uses robots and machine learning to engineer microbes faster, more predictably, and to a level of performance previously unattainable. These microbes, and the products they produce, have broad applications across industries such as chemicals and materials, agriculture, and healthcare. For more information visit www.zymergen.com ( http://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url;=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.zymergen.com%2F&esheet;=51436625&newsitemid;=20161010006215&lan;=en-US&anchor;=www.zymergen.com&index;=1&md5;=eadf9f7cb8a0bdbfa22eb7b2688a7e09 ).

Currently, we are working with large industrial partners helping them improve their existing production microbes. We are in contract and advanced discussions with a variety of Fortune 100 companies. Over time we expect to develop a large portfolio of our own products, ranging from drop-in replacements for existing chemicals to advanced materials to life-saving therapeutics â all generated from green, renewable raw materials.

Growing our business requires technical development work: to establish new molecular biological techniques, to move existing protocols to robotics workstations, and to create workflows that enable high throughput microbe engineering and evaluation.

Job Description and Specific Responsibilities

Zymergen is hiring several Research Associates to drive bench-scale fermentation within the company. Immediate responsibilities include:

  • Weekly setup, running, and tear down of a bank of fermentors, including work in off hours
  • Prepare media and clean and sterilize equipment
  • Maintain and repair the fermentation systems and the supporting infrastructure as needed
  • Process samples in plate-based and HPLC assays in collaboration with the analytical chemistry team
  • Work with data capture systems to store data and metadata about the experiments
  • Use data analysis tools to understand process variations and manage process controls, and to identify microbes with improved performance
  • Collaborate with the microtiter plate based screening team to form the high throughput microbe screening pipeline
  • Collaborate with outside partners on transfer of technology between facilities
The fermentation capacity within the company is integral both for screening microbes in high throughput to identify those with improved performance as well as for transferring technologies between Zymergen and our partner organizations. We need members of our fermentation department to bring creativity and perseverance across a variety of large and small projects including installing equipment and establishing scalable processes. In addition, the Associate will be part of the foundational technical team and will have the opportunity to shape the scientific environment and establish best practices within a growing company.

Qualifications/Experience
-------------------------

We are hiring candidates with a range of experience levels from junior to mid and senior scientists, along with a mix of backgrounds from engineering to microbiology. We favor candidates with a degree and experience in relevant fields (chemical engineering, bioengineering, microbiology, biochemistry), and with a history of success within an industrial setting.

We prefer Associates with experience in some or all of the following areas.

Equipment and SOP development:
  • Familiarity with a variety of bench scale fermentation units including those from Sartorius, DASGIP, Applikon and New Brunswick (Eppendorf)
  • Experience installing the physical infrastructure and establishing the support processes required to build out a fermentation capability
  • Understanding the basics of statistics including JMP, and the use of manufacturing practices such as control charts, Lean, and 5S
  • Expertise writing and validating SOPs for fermentation and fermentation-related processes
Chemical engineering and microbiology:
  • Experience with a variety of microbes (bacteria, yeasts, filamentous fungi), a variety of fermentation processes (aerobic, microaerobic, and anaerobic), and a variety fermentation products (proteins, small molecules)
  • Familiarity breaking down processes and equipment to identify sources of contamination or variation
  • Attention to detail to execute complex fermentation processes with minimal deviations
  • Understanding of associated processes like analytical chemistry, microtiter plate-based growth and production, lab support services, LIMS, etc.
Previous experience in the field of synthetic biology is not essential.

Our facilities are located in the San Francisco Bay Area.

------

description:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.

With your technical expertise, you lead projects in multiple areas of expertise (i.e., engineering domains or systems) within a data center facility, including construction and equipment installation/troubleshooting/debugging with vendors.

The Failure Analysis and Materials lab within the Reliability Engineering department conducts investigations into failed materials, components, assemblies and products during development, production and use for multiple groups within Hardware. The lab uses its state of the art facilities and equipment to study the characteristics of materials and their failure mechanisms. Lab personnel work closely with product teams and other cross-functional teams to drive corrective actions within Hardware and within the supply chain.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Consumer Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Consumer Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.

Responsibilities
  • Investigate failures, identify root cause and work to drive corrective actions with product teams.
  • Develop novel methods for analysis using in-house equipment which reduce cost and improve turnaround time of investigations
  • Use materials expertise to help select materials and specify testing for materials qualification
  • Work with partners/vendors/internal teams to develop best-in-class materials for product teams
  • Take hands-on ownership of laboratory and analytical equipment

Qualifications Minimum qualifications:
  • PhD in Materials Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, with a focus on experimental work or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of industrial experience in one of the following industries: medical devices, consumer goods/products, aerospace/defense, consumer electronics, semiconductors, display/lighting, solar, chemicals, or oil and gas
  • Experience in a technical/engineering role which focused on materials engineering, design, design validation, product development, field testing, failure analysis, reliability, or equivalent.
  • Experience in 2 of the following scientific instruments and/or disciplines: Electron Microscopy, Fracture Mechanics/Fractography, Finite Element Analysis, Computed Tomography X-Ray, Scanning Probe Microscopy, Thermal Analysis, Analytical Chemistry

Preferred qualifications:
  • Programming experience in 2 or more of the following languages: MATLAB, Python, R, JavaScript, C/C++. Experience related to developing experimental automation, instrument control, data analysis tools, numerical simulations or statistical analyses.
  • Experience working in a production environment
  • Experience working at multiple stages in the product lifecycle
  • Capable of influencing teams indirectly through timely, accurate and powerful analysis
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Willing to travel up to 10% of the time, including international travel

description:
Research Associate – Pharmaceutical Development

We are seeking a highly motivated and talented individual to join our Pharmaceutical Development team to work collaboratively in the areas of physicochemical characterization, formulation development, and drug delivery.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Develop and apply analytical and physical methods (e.g., viscosity, osmolality, density, turbidity, particle size distribution, calorimetric behavior, force testing related to injectability, fluorescence spectroscopy, etc.) for the physicochemical characterization of antisense oligonucleotides (ASOs)
  • Using such methods and molecular modeling software, design and conduct experiments to study intermolecular interactions in aqueous solutions of ASOs without and with other constituents
  • Develop ASO formulations relevant to various dosage forms and routes of administration: e.g., parenteral, oral, inhalation, transdermal
  • Conduct analytical testing to evaluate the compatibility of such formulations with excipients, primary packaging, and dosing materials, including delivery devices
  • Work collaboratively with outside resources (e.g., contract labs, academic labs) on a portion of the above work
  • As they arise, troubleshoot issues related to ASO drug product manufacturing, stability, or delivery
  • As needed, directly assist with ASO drug product manufacturing and associated documentation
  • Summarize findings in reports and periodic oral presentations
REQUIREMENTS:
  • The successful candidate will possess the following:
  • A BS or MS degree in bioengineering, chemical engineering, chemistry, or related field
  • 2-4 years industry experience is preferred
  • Energetic, positive, self-motivated, hands-on professional with strong work ethic, able to work well both independently and in a matrixed team environment
  • Able to perform and think analytically and creatively to solve problems
  • Excellent communications skills – written, verbal, listening – manifested as a style that is clear, concise, and persuasive
  • Able to maintain productivity and effectiveness in an intense, data driven, interrogative environment
Excellent salary and benefits package offered.

title: Research Associate - Pharmaceutical Development

description:
How do you look for life on another planet when you bring your own? How do protect the Earth’s biosphere from potential extraterrestrial life from a sample return mission?

If your interest is sparked, we need a Spacecraft Biological Systems Engineer who is passionate about working in a challenging environment where you would be able to apply scientific technologies to deriving engineering solutions. This unique position is part of the JPL’s Spacecraft Mechanical Engineering Section , which is responsible for the architecture of mechanical engineering designs and solutions that enable unprecedented space missions and science acquisition. You will work with a highly collaborative team that leads the development of mission enabling technology and end-to-end mechanical systems for all JPL projects and missions.

Some Challenges You Will Tackle:
  • Prepare planetary protection implementation plans for spacecraft assembly.
  • Lead environmental and spacecraft sampling events and conduct microbiological and molecular biological assessments.
  • Interface with space science experts and project staff to establish and implement cleanliness requirements for spacecraft hardware under development.
  • Participate in all phases of spacecraft hardware assembly development.
  • Publish work at conferences and in peer reviewed papers

Qualifications: You Must Have:

  • Bachelor's degree in Microbiology, Biochemistry, Chemical Engineering, Systems Engineering, Biomedical Engineering or related technical discipline with a minimum of 6 years of related experience or Master's degree in a related technical discipline with a minimum of 4 year of experience or PhD in a related technical discipline with 2 years experience.
  • Extensive experience in culturing and characterization of spore forming bacteria and/or human flora.
  • Wide ranging experience with general microbiology techniques and knowledge in the standard techniques of general microbiology and molecular diagnostics.
  • Has advanced knowledge of industry and/or academic practices and standards across a range of applications related to microbiology and spacecraft flight hardware and systems (e.g. microbial reduction modalities)
  • Extensive experience in nucleic acid sample preparation, extraction, PCR amplification and sequencing.
  • Extensive experience in Chemical and Biochemistry analytical techniques.
  • Demonstrated ability to conduct independent research, prepare technical reports, summaries, protocols and data analyses.
  • Experience developing protocols and procedures for planetary protection requirements resulting in mission success
Got These? Even Better:
  • Computer programming
  • Familiarization of bioinformatics
  • Experience with systems engineering processes and practices
title: Spacecraft Biological System Engineer III

description:
We are seeking Associate Scientist/ Scientist to support drug discovery and development in the Small Molecule Pharmaceutics (SMP) at Genentech. The scope of the position extends from early clinical development to technology transfer to our late stage development group. This person will primarily be responsible for carrying out computational efforts related to developing the process modeling capability for SMPG in order to enable fast-entry into human and the definition of market-image formulation/process.

The development activities should focus on establishing a sound understanding of how material properties can be characterized and controlled to ensure robust formulation and process development for both clinical materials and commercial images. Depending on the breadth of experience, development opportunities and departmental needs, the candidate may also be involved in: physical form screening and characterization and investigate alternative drug delivery approaches. The candidate will also be responsible for laboratory experiments and be involved in GMP manufacturing, as well as writing technical reports and CMC sections of the regulatory dossiers (INDs, IMPDs, NDAs etc.).

Who You Are A candidate with Ph.D. in Pharmaceutical Sciences/Material sciences/Chemical Engineering, or related fields with 0 to 9 years experience in the Pharmaceutical Industry is desired. The candidate must have a good understanding of the drug development process, and a solid scientific knowledge in utilizing compaction simulator for material characterization. The candidate must have experience in applying one or more mathematical modeling techniques in pharmaceutical process understanding. The candidate also needs to have a good understanding and pre-formulation activities as it relates to solid form screening and bio-pharmaceutics.

The successful candidate will represent the Pharmaceutics function in multidisciplinary project teams; he/she will need to work closely with team members in a cooperative fashion to ensure project progression and to communicate formulation strategy and related challenges. The individual also needs to work effectively with CMOs and internal Operation Team by providing technical oversight to ensure delivery is met. Excellent communication skills (verbal and technical), interpersonal skills, and problem-solving skills are essential. Candidates must have a proven track record of publications in peer-reviewed journals.

*LI-gRED-EK

Who We Are A member of the Roche Group, Genentech has been at the forefront of the biotechnology industry for more than 40 years, using human genetic information to develop novel medicines for serious and life-threatening diseases. Genentech has multiple therapies on the market for cancer & other serious illnesses. Please take this opportunity to learn about Genentech where we believe that our employees are our most important asset & are dedicated to remaining a great place to work.

The next step is yours. To apply today, click on the "Apply online" button below.

Genentech is an equal opportunity employer & prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, disability, marital & veteran status. For more information about equal employment opportunity, visit our Genentech Careers page .
title: Associate Scientist / Scientist, Small Molecule Pharmaceutics, SMPS/gRED

description:
Founded in 2013 and based in the San Francisco Bay Area, Zymergen is a technology company unlocking the power of biology. We deliver better economics for bio-derived products across industries and research novel product opportunities. Our proprietary platform uses robots and machine learning to engineer microbes faster, more predictably, and to a level of performance previously unattainable. These microbes, and the products they produce, have broad applications across industries such as chemicals and materials, agriculture, and healthcare.

Job Description and Specific Responsibilities

Zymergen is hiring Research Associates into its Operations team to collect and analyze strain performance measurements at a scale of tens of thousands per month. Although the Associate must be able to get the right materials into the right places at the right times, they must also be tool builders who collaborate with our automation, molecular biology, software engineering and data analytics teams to make continuous improvements to measurement quality and efficiency. The Associate will be encouraged to build statistical models and to translate them into mechanistic insights to understand the interface between a microbe and its environment.

Immediate responsibilities include:
  • Managing parallel workflows that have been automated to varying degrees
  • Preparing biological samples and chemical standards for analysis
  • Loading and unloading shakers and automation decks
  • Working with data capture systems to store data and metadata about the experiments
  • Using data analysis tools to explain process variation to identify microbes with improved performance
The Operations team within the company is integral to the construction and screening of large libraries of microbes every week. We need members of the Operations team to be thoughtful, meticulous, well-organized, energetic, collaborative, and fully engaged in the execution of the workflows. In addition, we need team members to be fully committed to the improvement of the workflows through better techniques, more efficient processes, or entirely new approaches. Early hires to the team will shape the technical and cultural aspects of the team and establish best practices within a growing company.

Qualifications/Experience
-------------------------

We favor candidates with a background in chemical engineering, biophysics or other quantitative disciplines (BS/BA preferred). We welcome candidates who are energized by performing the hard work of getting the right materials into the right places at the right times.

We prefer Associates with experience in some or all of the following areas.

Protocols and Equipment:
  • Responsible for preparing chemical solutions and maintaining batch records
  • Responsible for cultivating microorganisms as shaking cultures and on agar plates
  • Experience using lab automation (Beckman, Tecan, etc.) to enable complicated or high-throughput protocols
Operations and Data Analysis:
  • Experience following complicated SOPs
  • Capability to manage multiple ongoing multi day workflows, including scheduling instrumentation, preparing reagents and materials, and managing implementation
  • Familiarity with statistical concepts, analytical software such as JMP, Spotfire or Tableau, and manufacturing principles such as 5S, Lean, GMP or GLP
  • Facility with Microsoft Excel a plus
Previous experience in the field of synthetic biology is not essential.

Our facility is located in Emeryville, CA in the San Francisco Bay Area.
title: Research Associate, Microbe Screening

description:
About the Role

In this role, you’ll be part of a team that is responsible for automating and scaling complex workflows and implementing processes for a state of the art sequencing lab. You will wear multiple hats and support the development of all parts of a state of the art robotics facility. Your customers will be licensed clinical operators; your goal is to use software and automation to help them focus on extensive screening. The Process Engineer will be involved in all aspects of assay automation development from concept, requirements definition, and manual assay development to adaptation, optimization, troubleshooting and validation. You will leverage an understanding of molecular biology and biochemistry to troubleshoot analytical and preparative processes. The successful candidate will apply scientific methods and engineering skills to improve the scalability of Guardant Health’s sample processing workflows.

As a Process Engineer , you must be collaborative and able to effectively participate in or lead cross functional teams working in a variety of projects. These cross functional teams will explore, develop, optimize, test, and implement robust, scalable solutions for Guardant Health’s sample processing workflows with attention to understanding business and user requirements and improving efficiency, throughput, and quality. You will be expected, after training, to understand, and to perform all laboratory procedures needed to process samples with our workflows to support process development and implementation activities. You will also contribute to protocol generation, report writing and presentation preparation.

Key Day to Day Activities:
  • Analyze workflows, identify bottlenecks, and develop solutions to improve efficiency, throughput, cost, and quality
  • Contribute to innovation of current and new assays workflows, technologies and processes
  • Program, optimize, verify and implement robotic liquid handling workstations and integrated robotic systems
About You:
You’re a scientist or engineer with a proven track record of working with and programming automated liquid handlers. You’re eager to participate in the development of a high growth, fast paced startup. An interdisciplinary background in molecular biology, lab automation and programming is required. The ideal candidate will have prior, demonstrated experience designing, developing, testing, implementing, and supporting automated sample-processing workflows using a requirements-driven approach in a clinical laboratory or other molecular biology-based laboratory setting. He or she will also leverage an understanding of molecular biology and biochemistry to troubleshoot analytical and preparative processes. The successful candidate will apply scientific methods and engineering skills to improve the scalability of Guardant Health’s sample processing workflows.

You also have:
  • A BS degree in engineering or science, preferably in molecular biology, genetics or biochemistry, bioengineering, chemical engineering or a closely-related discipline and a minimum of 3 years of related experience. An MS with 1+ years of related work experience will also be considered.
  • Familiarity with streamlining workflows and developing automated laboratory processes and instrumentation systems, including collecting and documenting requirements, developing concepts, design, testing/validation, implementing, and training
  • Experience with operating and programming liquid handling robotics platforms (Hamilton, TECAN, Beckman, Agilent)
  • Experience with standard molecular biology techniques such as nucleic acid isolation, purification and quantitation, bioanalyzer, DNA/RNA quantitation, qPCR or next generation sequencing
  • Experience communicating and collaborating with internal and external colleagues and customers from diverse scientific, engineering, operational, and regulatory disciplines
  • Familiarity with statistical data analysis, monitoring data quality and troubleshooting technical problems
About our Company

Guardant Health develops breakthrough diagnostic technologies to improve cancer management. With Guardant360, we offer real-time, biopsy-free tumor sequencing that tracks tumor genomics in real-time and identifies associated treatment options. The recent introduction of groundbreaking analytical tools, including our Tumor Response Map and a mobile-enabled physician portal, further advance Guardant Health's momentum. Guardant Health has raised more than $200M in capital from Sequoia Capital, Khosla Ventures, Lightspeed Ventures, OrbiMed Capital and other well-known investors, and is led by a seasoned management team of thought leaders and successful serial entrepreneurs in next generation sequencing and rare cell diagnostics. They are advised by an oncologist-led medical steering committee from leading cancer centers.
title: Process Engineer

title: Research Scientist, Computational

description:
We run one of the largest genome centers in the country and with that comes the necessity to maintain the quality of our testing. This Scientist role is part of our Laboratory Operations team and is responsible for transferring technologies from R&D; to production, and optimizing, validating, monitoring and troubleshooting assays.

What you'll do
    • Development Testing: work closely with our automation group to transfer technology to a production environment
    • Method validation: design analytical validation studies for clinical assays developed by R&D;
    • Production Assay Monitoring: help build out a responsive laboratory troubleshooting team
    • Process Optimization: develop new assay chemistries with the goal of minimizing cost and turnaround time while maintaining accuracy
About you
    • You have a PhD in Molecular Biology, Computational Biology, Biochemistry, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering (or similar field), and/or significant independent bench experience as demonstrated by publications or prior employment
    • You are quantitative-minded and know your way around a computer
    • Actual programming experience and/or training in statistics is highly preferred
    • You are familiar with next-gen sequencing protocols and operation of Illumina or Ion Torrent instruments, preferred
    • Most importantly, you do not rest until you’ve optimized your experiments, and want to see them used in the clinical care of millions of patients
Counsyl is a health technology company that offers DNA screening for diseases that can impact men, women and their children. The Counsyl philosophy is simple: screen for diseases where advanced knowledge makes a difference in health outcomes, whether it’s changing a behavior, pursuing preventative measures, or simply preparing for what lies ahead.

The Counsyl team includes an accomplished group of problem-solvers — top engineers, scientists, and designers — who are taking the lead on building the modern clinical laboratory. Scientific rigor, custom robotics, and software are at the heart of every Counsyl product, resulting in better, faster and more affordable screens that are broadly accessible. Beyond the laboratory, Counsyl offers doctors and patients a technology platform for results delivery in real time, with on-demand access to board-certified genetic counselors.

Counsyl has screened more than 400,000 patients and served more than 6,000 health care professionals in its CLIA-certified, CAP-accredited and NYS CLEP-permitted clinical laboratory. The company has raised a total of $102 million and is privately backed by RSTP, Goldman Sachs Asset Management, Founders Fund, Felicis Ventures, David Drummond, and other high profile investors.
title: Scientist (Development)

description:
We are looking for driven, talented Scientists and Product Engineers to join our growing Life Cycle Management (LCM) group. The LCM group works as an integral part of our Consumables Manufacturing process and is tasked with increasing quality and yield within our high volume production environments.

This Scientist 1 position is a hands-on, independent position where the incumbent uses expert knowledge of product characterization and GMP manufacturing processes for new product introduction initiatives of clinical/diagnostic products. This individual will provide technical expertise and leadership in the design and execution of experiments for product/process optimization, analytical method development, and verification activities ensuring the successful transfer of technology transfer into a GMP manufacturing environment. Specific focus areas include:

All About You

Responsibilities:
  • Collaborate and guide new product development teams throughout the stages of product development process (PDP) in order to:
    • Act as the liaison between development and manufacturing,
    • Construct and execute controlled experiments (including DOE's and gauge R&R; studies) to improve the production and processing of biological materials, utilizing mathematical techniques and scientific expertise to sort and analyze data and draw valid conclusions;
    • Provide technical support for the identification of critical materials and process controls;
    • Provide analytical test method development support during pre-formulation, formulation development and manufacture of prototype formulations, clinical trial materials and process scale ups.
    • Review analytical method validation, process validation, cleaning validation, stability studies and other product qualification requirements, including reviewing protocols, executed studies and associated reports.
    • Participate in phase gate reviews as defined per product development process (Design Control program)
    • Define, establish, and manage requirements for successful transfer of technical information into manufacturing, i.e. detailed transfer package deliverable(s).
  • Support product characterization activities and method development activities as needed, including recommending materials for reliable performance (material compatibility and availability) and manufacturing scalability.
  • Monitor, trend and analyze results from development and pilot lots during the NPI process; track off-targeted production outputs, troubleshoot/perform root cause analysis, and make technical and compliance related recommendations as required.
  • Design and execute controlled experiments to optimize processes, address technical failures and quality issues to drive implementation of solutions within the production environment.
  • Present clear and concise written and oral communications to colleagues and supervisors, lead and participate in technical meetings, and provide recommendations based on technical results

Requirements:
  • Work experience in production, pilot plant, and/or product development following GMP best work practices and techniques is required.
  • Work experience with NPI projects, design change control programs as well as having an understanding of product lifecycle management.
  • Experience with Design of Experiments techniques, statistical analysis, and statistical process controls.
  • Experience with at least several of the following techniques: HPLC, SEC, CE, GC, GC-MS, LC-MS, MALDI-TOF, SDS-PAGE, IEF
  • Experience with chemical processes (preferably organic) is required
  • Must understand the process of control requirements for production and process improvement as per QSR, FDA, ISO 90001/13485, and other regulatory requirements.
  • Highly desirable to have experience and knowledge of operations of IVDs, medical devices, and/or Pharmaceutical products.
  • Strong background in analytical characterization of enzymes, oligonucleotides, small molecules, and/or mixtures of the above is highly desired
  • Knowledge of material properties, compatibility studies and product performance testing.
  • Ability to work independently in a fast paced team environment, meet deadlines, and adapt to rapidly changing priorities across multiple projects in accordance with departmental and company objectives.
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills.

Education:
  • B.S. & 5+ yrs experience/M.S. & 3+ yrs experience/Ph.D. in: Materials Science or Physical Chemistry, Chemistry, Biochemistry, Chemical Engineering, or Biochemical/Biomedical/Biotechnical Engineering, Bioengineering
