title: Process Development Scientist 1

description:
We are looking for driven, talented Engineering Manager to join our growing Life Cycle Management (LCM) group. The LCM group works as an integral part of our Consumables Manufacturing process and is tasked with new product introduction and increasing quality and yield within our high volume production environments.

This individual will lead teams that provide technical leadership to new product introduction, production process development, improvement and sustaining efforts. Additionally, this person will partner cross-functionally with R & D, Quality, Finance, Production and other engineering groups to lead development of processes for new products and sustain and improve processes for existing products.

All About You

Responsibilities:
  • Participate in process sustaining, definition and improvement, design, development and quality test activities in the making of consumable products or support of processes/equipment used to sequence genomes.
  • Work on teams to develop and transfer new processes/products to production and enhance their robustness.
  • Troubleshoot production line issues related to yield, quality and throughput.
  • Construct and execute controlled experiments (including DOE's) to optimize processes, address yield and quality issues and drive implementation of solutions in a production environment to meet production goals.
  • Analyze process test results, issue reports and make technical recommendations.
  • Work cross functionally with R&D;, Manufacturing and Quality to develop processes for new products and improve processes of existing products.
  • Provide leadership and direction to the consumables Process Engineering team to accomplish all team goals and objectives.
  • Maintains staff by recruiting, selecting, and training employees; maintains a safe, secure, and legal work environment.
  • Manage team development through training, coaching and career mapping; develops personal growth opportunities.
  • Lead continuous improvement and sustaining efforts for products and processes in support of cost and performance objectives.
  • Lead, work on and guide teams to transfer manufacturing processes between manufacturing locations.
  • Responsible for productive cross-site and cross-functional relationship between manufacturing sites.

Requirements:
  • Work experience in the biotech or semiconductor industries is desirable.
  • Demonstrated ability to successfully lead, coach and mentor direct reports required.
  • Work experience in the biotech, pharmaceutical or semiconductor industries is desirable
  • Experience working in an ISO13485 or FDA certified environment is desirable.
  • Experience in high-volume production in a high-tech consumables industry is desirable.
  • Experience with chemical processes (preferably organic) preferred.
  • Experience in production support and/or process development is required.
  • Experience with statistics, Statistical Process Control and DOE techniques are required.
  • High level problem solving and reasoning skills required.
  • Experience with product development processes and project management skills is desirable.
  • Good interdepartmental communication, influence and documentation skills are required.
  • Demonstrated ability to accomplish goals while working across departments is required.

Education:
  • B.S./M.S./PhD in Chemical Engineering, Biochemical Engineering, Biotechnical Engineering, or MS/PhD in Materials Science or Physical Chemistry with at least 6 years of relevant experience in production support/sustaining and/or process definition and development, design, scale-up, improvement and validation. At least 2 year as a technical manager or 5 years as a production manager.

title: Research Associate, Next Generation Sequencing

description:
Position responsibilities:

Develops detailed chemical kinetics and transport models of heterogeneous catalytic reaction processes and implements using commercial FEM software
Validates models against experimental data from Pilot and Demonstration scales
Identifies additional experimental data required for validation, develops test plans, and works with pilot team to generate data
Contributes toward a reactor analysis framework that can be used as a tool to optimize reactor performance and further catalyst discovery
Extend model to simulate commercial reactor operation and support commercial reactor design. Run simulations to elucidate operation, upsets, start-up, and aging
Develops and maintains relevant documentation for kinetic networks, reactor design analysis, and regression test methods for parameter optimization
Designs and provides guidance for high-throughput bench-scale and pilot-scale reactor testing experiments to determine and verify model parameters
Demonstrated ability to conduct and perform collaborative research and effectively interact with a broad range of colleagues with tact
Visualizes and communicates model results in a clear and concise manner
Reviews academic and patent literature to update kinetic models for accuracy and simulation methods for efficiency
Position requirements:

MS/PhD (2-4 year experience) in Chemical Engineering, Applied Physics, or Chemistry
2-4 years of relevant industrial experience in process modeling and engineering
Extensive experience developing and validating phenomenological models and applying to engineering problems
Expertise in thermodynamics, kinetics, reaction engineering, reactor scale-up and process design
Experience with commercial FEM or CFD software (FLUENT, COMSOL or equivalent)
Laboratory experience a plus
Familiar with DOE methodology is a plus
Desire to succeed tempered by maturity and a good sense of humor
Must be flexible and organized, able to learn independently and communicate well with a cross-functional team
Be safety oriented
To apply:

Submit application via email.
Must indicate which position you are applying for in the subject of the email
Please consider sending voluntary disability and Veteran self-identification forms. YOu can download forms here.

Equal Employment Opportunity:
Siluria Technologies is an EEO employer - M/F/Vets/Disabled. Our Company provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetics, disability or protected veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, Siluria complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

About the Company:
Siluria Technologies is pioneering the commercial production of fuels and chemicals made from clean, abundant natural gas. Siluria’s break through Oxidative Coupling of Methane ("OCM") process technology is believed to be the first commercially viable process to directly convert methane to ethylene. Siluria’s second process technology can convert ethylene to liquid fuels such as gasoline, diesel or jet fuel. This enables natural gas to potentially supplement petroleum as the worldwide basis for transportation fuels and commodity chemicals. Siluria’s revolutionary catalyst and process technologies uniquely combine nanomaterials, templating and chemical engineering, to convert natural gas into higher value products using efficient processes that can be seamlessly integrated into existing industry infrastructure.

Siluria has assembled a world-class team that comprises industry-experienced experts in catalyst development, process engineering, scale-up, and commercialization. The team includes former executives and engineers from oil, gas and energy companies (LyondellBasell, BP, Shell, Anadarko, ExxonMobil, Dow), EPC firms and technology licensors (Fluor, Bechtel, Casale Group, Foster Wheeler) and other leading innovators.

title: Upstream Process Development Engineer II

description:
Post Doc to help accelerate the development of a novel battery manufacturing technology

About the Job

The Hardware Systems Laboratory is seeking an exceptional post-doc to help accelerate the development of a novel battery manufacturing technology. Utilizing a range of modeling and analytical techniques, the successful candidate will evaluate a wide range of battery electrode structures and chemistries and analyze their impacts on battery performance at a wide range of levels. The applicant will also be required to explore the interactions of ink composition, manufacturing techniques, processing conditions, and assembly conditions.

Requirements:
  • PhD candidate or PhD in mechanical engineering, chemistry, chemical engineering, or another relevant field
  • Background in battery chemistry
  • Experience in COMSOL or another commercial modeling package
Desired Qualifications:
  • Experience in battery manufacturing
  • Expertise in battery testing
  • Ability to work independently
  • Attention to detail
  • Understanding of fluid rheology and/or microfluidics
Benefits

We offer a very competitive salary package and full benefits (medical, dental, vision, life & disability insurance, 401K. PARC also strives for the best possible work-life balance, so employees benefit from maternity, paternity and adoption leave, as well as a variety of flexible working options. PARC employees enjoy the use of onsite health & fitness center and collegial dining at our onsite cafeteria. The PARC campus is in a spacious modern building in close proximity to the resources and opportunities of Silicon Valley and benefits from nearby leading universities such as Stanford and Berkeley. It is also close to many amenities, top schools, and outdoor activities (see http://www.parc.com/about/culture.html). PARC provides a highly diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer (see http://www.parc.com/about/careers/).

About PARC

PARC, a Xerox company, is in the Business of Breakthroughs®. Practicing open innovation, we provide custom R&D; services, technology, expertise, best practices, and intellectual property to Fortune 500 and Global 1000 companies, startups, and government agencies and partners. We create new business options, accelerate time to market, augment internal capabilities, and reduce risk for our clients.

Since its inception, PARC has pioneered many technology platforms – from the Ethernet and laser printing to the GUI and ubiquitous computing – and has enabled the creation of many industries. Incorporated as an independent, wholly owned subsidiary of Xerox in 2002, PARC today continues the research that enables breakthroughs for our clients' businesses.

PARC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. title: Post Doc Battery

description:
We are looking for a creative individual with critical thinking skills to develop solutions to complex problems in an evolving startup environment. The successful candidate will work as a skilled and detail-oriented Sensor Engineer in PROFUSAâs Chemistry Group. Working closely with a highly motivated team of scientists and engineers, the candidate will be responsible for carrying out the following duties:
  • Design and fabricate test fixtures (e.g. flow cells, reaction chambers) for testing sensor response continuously under various conditions (e.g. temperatures, flow rates, oxygen, pH).
  • Design, plan and perform test procedures to evaluate sensor performance.
  • Collect, organize, process, and analyze data from sensor performance studies using custom instrumentation and standard plate readers. Based on analysis of data, make recommendations for sensor improvements.
  • Design processing templates, and write scripts (using MatLab or similar) to help standardize and streamline data processing for routine analyses. Implement these tools within the Chemistry Group by training users and writing procedures.
  • Develop and implement calibration and correction algorithms for continuous analyte sensors.
  • Fabricate polymer-based sensor materials and improve manufacturing procedures to accommodate scale-up.
  • Support pre-clinical studies for in vivo senor evaluation (may require up to 30% travel).
  • Write and implement SOPs, Design Verification Studies, Test Protocols, and Test Reports.
  • Record all data and procedures in a well-maintained, detailed laboratory notebook, and summarize results in technical memos and in presentations.
Requirements:
Qualifications
  • Advanced degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Chemical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, or equivalent
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Highly Proficient in Microsoft Excel (macros), MATLAB programing, LabView
  • Exceptional organizational skills, attention to detail, and work quality
Experience
  • A minimum of 2 years industry experience with hands-on experience in a laboratory environment
  • Experience in a medical device startup environment, preferably working in the space of biometric sensing
  • Demonstrated ability to successfully plan out and complete projects
Supervisory Responsibilities
May supervise entry-level technicians

Benefits:
At Profusa, Inc., our most valuable resource is our employees. Every day, they bring their passion, talents, and dedication to a challenging environment where they are rewarded with opportunities to realize their potential and ultimately impact the lives of patients. Our total compensation package is designed to keep our employees healthy and engaged. Our comprehensive benefit programs include:
  • Medical, dental and vision benefits
  • Long Term Disability insurance
  • Life and AD&D; insurance
  • Competitive paid time off (PTO) on a prorated basis
  • 6 paid company holidays per year as well as the Friday after Thanksgiving and time off between Christmas and New Years
  • Voluntary Traditional/Roth 401(k) plan and wide array of investment options offered through Fidelity
title: Sensor Scientist/Engineer

description:
Led by a team with deep medical industry experience, Carrot Sense is on a mission to save lives by leveraging technology to bring the most effective methods of smoking cessation to the masses. Carrot Sense is seeking to add an R&D; Engineer to its team to support development of new sensor-enabled medical devices.

Requirements:
  • Design components, devices and systems for use in portable sensor-enabled medical devices, compliant with FDA and ISO standards and requirements.
  • Design and execute experiments to assess and compare the performance and reliability of components systems and devices.
  • Analyze data from experiments and other sources to produce actionable conclusions regarding the design, manufacturing, test methodology, and field of use for our devices.
  • Work with suppliers and contract manufacturers, to improve performance and reliability of the devices, or advance operational goals.
What youâve done
  • Applicants with varying levels of experience will be considered, however 8+ years of engineering experience in the medical device field is preferred.
  • Candidates should have experience working on regulated medical devices, and be familiar with engineering and quality practices necessary in medical device companies (such as design control, document and data control, change management).
  • Broad exposure/responsibility in all phases of the product development lifecycle, preferably as lead R&D; engineer on complex medical devices, from concept through market launch. Prior experience with sensor technology a plus.
  • Technically, candidates should be familiar and capable with fundamentals and practical aspects of sensor systems, design and execution of experiments, data collection and analysis, designing mechanical and electromechanical systems, and should be proficient with a wide variety of software tools.
  • Demonstrated design proficiency utilizing 3D modeling software.
EDUCATION
Minimum of BS or equivalent in a relevant engineering field such as mechanical, electrical, biomedical, or chemical engineering.

Benefits:
What we offer:
  • At Carrot Sense, we'll take care of you. In addition to competitive salaries, challenging work assignments, and developmental opportunities, we offer medical, dental and vision insurance, stock options and generous PTO.
  • Office location featuring Bay Trails access to the waterway, walking path, full service gym with pool, world class cafe on-site, Caltrain shuttle and close proximity to 101.
  • We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description:
Job Purpose

Responsible for the manufacturing definition and ME related activities with the value streams and throughout the program lifecycle. Represents ME at program/technical reviews and at meetings with customers/suppliers. Ensures the manufacturing definition meets stakeholder requirements. Ensures adherence to ME processes/standards. Drives concurrent engineering and participates in design reviews to meet business case targets including manufacturability. Sets requirements for the technology department and is a member of the Technology Readiness Assessment.

Principal Accountabilities:

  • Leads targeted teams of engineers supporting the value streams and the global manufacturing development. Responsible for manufacturing system definition that fulfills design requirements, producibility and business case.
  • Ensures that major projects are properly planned, executed and closed out in accordance with agreements.
  • Determines/develops process changes needed to meet quality/manufacturing efficiency goals. Identifies/requests methods/technology development.
  • Performs/leads root cause and failure analysis as required. Applies Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA).
  • Maintains a clean work environment (including assigned storage and cleaning duties) in full compliance with company standards, customer and government regulations.
  • Assists in the development and maintenance of a business culture, which supports the Company's overall business objectives and goals, by providing leadership in issues that involve âcost, quality, process, schedule and peopleâ.
  • Ensures the company's commitment to maintain a safe workplace and to protect the environment through the establishment and support of Company policy and adherence to various government regulations.
  • Performs other duties, tasks and responsibilities as assigned.

Education

Requires a 4-year degree in aerospace, manufacturing/mechanical engineering, chemical engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Experience & Qualifications

Requires 15 years manufacturing engineering and/or quality engineering experience, preferably in an aerospace environment. Demonstrated experience in Process Control Mapping and Variable control, Industrialization TRL 7-9 Gate Process, problem solving tools, Production Platform & Design Standards for Core Products application, Lean and CI qualifications and experience

Mental and Physical Demands

  • Ability to communicate clearly and concisely
  • Must display good interpersonal, leadership, organizational, and verbal/written skills.

title: Fluidics and Mechanical Engineer

description:
SCIENTIST: BIOCHEMISTRY/BIOSEPARATIONS

You have a strong theoretical understanding of protein chemistry, tempered with extensive experience purifying and characterizing proteins. You enjoy the challenge of devising or refining purification schemes, and you employ both careful observation and theoretical reasoning to suggest novel approaches. You routinely design and execute both fast exploratory experiments and information-rich follow-up experiments.
Bolt Threads is looking for a highly motivated and productive scientist to support the development of novel recombinant protein materials. You are an execution-oriented scientist with superb bench and analytical skills. You are excited by challenging problems, master new material quickly, and play nicely with others. You will be working closely with the strain engineering team to rapidly assess the potential of novel materials.

THE POSITION

• Improve existing bench-scale purification processes, and develop new bench-scale processes for existing and novel target proteins.
• Facilitate new material development and evaluation.
• Conceive, design, execute, analyze, document, and communicate experiments and processes
• Collaborate with strain engineering, fermentation, analytics, and materials development teams

• PhD in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Chemical Engineering, or related field
• Excellent written and verbal communication
• Hands-on experience with and mechanistic understanding of recombinant protein overproduction, purification, and characterization, including:
o Design and quantitative evaluation of streamlined multi-step purification protocols for the extraction, isolation and characterization of target proteins from complex mixtures of proteins, lipids, and carbohydrates.
o Separation of proteins based on diverse characteristics, such as size, charge, stability, phase partitioning, and binding affinity.
o Crude extractions and separations of proteins involving sonication, homogenization, precipitation, centrifugation, dialysis, salting out, and filtration.
o Understanding of the toolset for characterizing proteins and impurities, including mass spectrometry, analytical chromatography, electrophoresis, and excitation/emission spectra.
• Experience processing proteins into materials (crosslinking, spinning, melting, casting etc.) a plus.
• Experience with membrane, structural, amyloid-like, highly hydrophobic, or other tricky proteins a plus.
• Ability to lift and manipulate bottles of liquid up to 4L, and work standing up 60% of your workday
title: Scientist: Biochemistry/Bioseparations

title: Process Engineer, Technical Services

description:
We are looking for driven, talented Process and Product Engineers to join our growing Life Cycle Management (LCM) group. The LCM group works as an integral part of our Consumables Manufacturing process and is tasked with increasing quality and yield within our high volume production environments.

We are growing at a rapid rate and hiring engineers at all levels (I, II, Sr. and Staff) to support multiple groups within LCM (Flow Cells, Reagents, Microarrays & Microfluidics). These individuals will provide technical leadership to new product introduction, production process development, improvement and sustaining efforts. Additionally, these teams will partner cross-functionally with R & D, Quality, Production and other engineering groups to develop processes for new products and sustain and improve processes for existing products.

All About You
Responsibilities:

• Participate in process sustaining, definition and improvement, design, development and quality test activities in the making of consumable products or support of processes/equipment used to sequence genomes.
• Troubleshoot production line issues related to yield, quality and throughput.
• Construct and execute controlled experiments (including DOE's) to optimize processes, address yield and quality issues and drive implementation of solutions in a production environment to meet production goals.
• Analyze process test results, issue reports and make technical recommendations.
• Work cross functionally with R&D;, Manufacturing and Quality to develop processes for new products and improve processes of existing products.
• Represent Operations needs on development teams.
• Define technical requirements and write procedures for Production to process product.
• Work on teams to develop and transfer new processes/products to production and enhance their robustness.
Requirements:
• Work experience in the biotech, pharmaceutical or semiconductor industries is desirable.
• High level problem solving and reasoning skills required.
• Good interdepartmental communication skills and documentation skills are required.
• Demonstrated ability to accomplish goals while working across departments is required.
• High level computer skills are required. Intermediate level programming knowledge is strongly desired.
• Experience with sequencing technologies is a plus.
• Experience with chemical processes (preferably organic) is a plus.
• Experience with statistics, Statistical Process Control and DOE techniques is a plus.
• Experience with high volume production in a high tech, high volume consumables industry is a plus.
• Experience with product development processes and project management is a plus.

Education:
• B.S./M.S./ PhD in Chemical Engineering, Biochemical Engineering, Bioengineering, Biotechnical Engineering, Bioinformatics or MS/PhD in Materials Science or Physical Chemistry. Experience in production support/sustaining and/or process definition and development, design, scale-up, improvement and validation is strongly desired.
• Recent or near term college graduates are encouraged to apply.

Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.

Description

CooperVision, a unit of The Cooper Companies, Inc. (NYSE: COO), is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of soft contact lenses and related products and services. The Company produces a full array of monthly, two-week and daily disposable contact lenses, all featuring advanced materials and optics. CooperVision has a strong heritage of solving the toughest vision challenges such as astigmatism and presbyopia; and offers the most complete collection of spherical, toric and multifocal products available. Through a combination of innovative products and focused practitioner support, the company brings a refreshing perspective to the marketplace, creating real advantages for customers and wearers. title: Scientist II

description:
Senior R&D; process development position for metallization for advanced technology nodes for logic and memory applications. Job requirement includes project and program planning, development and investigation of new metallization schemes, testing deposition chemistry, development or modification of process formulations, definition of processing or handling equipment requirements and specifications, and reviewing processing techniques and methods applied in the manufacture, fabrication, and evaluation of products. Involvement may begin at any step from concept and feasibility, customer beta/evaluation, productization, to full-scale manufacturing. Coordinates cross-functional design requirement review with appropriate scientific/engineering personnel to ensure manufacturability and compatibility of processing methods. Compiles and evaluates test data to determine appropriate limits and variables for process or material specifications. May conceive and plan projects involving definition and selection of new concepts, equipment automation technology, and approaches in the processing or development of new or improved processes. Will need to work closely with product development teams, hardware and software teams to design, develop and test product modules.

Minimum of 8 years of related experience with MS degree in chemistry, chemical engineering, material science or physics; or 5 years with PhD; or equivalent work experience.

description:
Job Summary:

As a Research Associate in Consumables Product Development you will work in a dynamic, team-oriented environment to develop and build consumables in support of product development programs. Job duties could include but are not limited to:

  • Become proficient in surface chemistry processes (chemical vapor deposition, polishing, spray coating, micro-fluidics); use these processes in the prototyping and piloting of new products.
  • Work in cross-functional teams to develop manufacturing processes for consumables. Provide assistance with equipment selection and workstation design to meet product quality, throughput and cost requirements.
  • Conduct clear and concise communication with colleagues and supervisors through oral updates, written reports and technical meetings.
  • Use systematic problem-solving methods to troubleshoot issues related to product quality, stability and robustness.
  • Ability to work independently and within teams to make detailed observations, plan, conduct, analyze, interpret, and report recommendations.
  • Support the transfer of new processes and products to Production.
  • Support the testing and screening of new materials
  • Keep a laboratory notebook

RequirementsREQUIREMENTS: Preferred educational background:

  • B.S. or M.S. in chemistry, physics, materials science, chemical engineering, biomedical engineering or related field with 0 - 5 yrs experience.

Qualifications and Experience:

  • Experience with surface chemistry processes preferred.
  • Exposure to automation, robotics and process design.
  • Experience in mentorship or tutoring roles is a plus.
  • Detail-oriented, organized, with a demonstrated ability to implement complex protocols, able to keep good notes in a lab notebook.
  • Strong communication skills
  • Multidisciplinary approach to problem solving.
  • Demonstrated ability to understand and successfully work across multiple disciplines such as engineering, software and manufacturing is highly desired.
  • Motivated, enthusiastic, hard-working, positive individual who desires to be part of a fast-paced, dynamic development environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to analyze large data sets, interpret results, and troubleshoot experiments. Experience with data analysis packages such as JMP, Matlab, R, Python, Perl, and an understanding of statistics are preferred.

  • San Diego, CA 92121

  • Research: 3 years
  • automation, robotics and process design: 2 years
  • data analysis packages such as JMP, Matlab, R, Python, and Perl: 1 year

title: Associate Process Engineer

description:
DESCRIPTION THE COMMUNITY

Ideally located on the Pacific Ocean, the City of Long Beach, California (population 462,257) is frequently described as a series of strong, diverse interwoven small communities within a large city. Enjoying an ideal Southern California climate, Long Beach is home to an abundance of cultural and recreational options. The Long Beach Convention Center, Aquarium of the Pacific, Queen Mary and the annual Toyota Grand Prix of Long Beach, plus a wide variety of other attractions (two historic ranchos, three marinas, and five golf courses), serve to draw 6.5 million visitors a year. The City is also home to California State University, Long Beach and Long Beach City College. Cal State Long Beach is the second largest university in the state and has consistently ranked among the top best value of public colleges in the nation. Serving the K-12 student population, the Long Beach Unified School District consistently ranks among the top 10 urban school districts in the country. Covering approximately 50 square miles, Long Beach is supported by a wide mix of industries with education, health and social services, manufacturing, retail trade, and professional services. While it offers all the amenities of a large metropolis, many say Long Beach has the added benefit of having maintained a strong sense of community and cohesiveness despite its size. Long Beach is the seventh largest city in California, and celebrates its vibrant diversity. The City proudly promotes a healthy and connected community that supports active living where people of all ages enjoy a walkable, bikeable and livable environment The City has the following ethnic breakdown: 40.8 percent Hispanic, 29.4 percent White, 13.0 percent Black, 12.6 percent Asian, and 4.2 percent all other ethnicities. A superb climate, quality schools, a vibrant downtown, and a wide variety of neighborhoods help make Long Beach one of the most livable communities in the country.

CITY GOVERNMENT
Long Beach is a full-service Charter City governed by nine City Council members who are elected by district and a Mayor that is elected at-large. Elected officials also include the City Attorney, City Auditor, and City Prosecutor. The Council Members and the Mayor are subject to a two-term limit, which allows them to serve for a maximum of eight years. The City Council appoints a City Manager and a City Clerk. The City Manager is responsible for the efficient administration of all City departments, excluding those under the direction of a separately elected official, Board or Commission. Long Beach is a full service City providing all traditional public services. In addition to its traditional services, Long Beach also maintains one of the world's busiest seaports, which serves as a leading gateway for international trade. The City also has its own full-service commercial airport, a Gas & Oil Department and is one of only three cities in California with its own Health Department. Long Beach is supported by a total FY2017 budget of approximately $2.6 billion, with the General Fund budget totaling $470 million. More than 5,900 full and part-time employees support municipal operations with the majority being represented by nine employee associations.

THE DEPARTMENT
Long Beach Gas and Oil oversees operations related to major oil production operations, a waste-to-energy power plant, and one of the nation's largest municipal natural gas utilities with 150,000 customers. The Department's FY 2017 budget is $208 million with 232 budgeted staff.

SALARY AND BENEFITS
The salary range for this position is $108,800 to $163,200 annually. Placement in the range will depend on qualifications. The City's compensation package also encompasses an attractive benefits package that includes:
  • Retirement – City offers CalPERS with a benefit of 2.5% @ 55 for Classic members or 2% at 62 for new members as defined by PEPRA, subject to the limitations set by PERS. Employee pays the employee portion. The City also participates in Social Security.
  • Vacation – Twelve (12) days after one year of service; 15 days after four years, six months of service; 20 days after 19.5 years of service.
  • Executive Leave – Forty (40) hours per year.
  • Sick Leave – One day earned per month; unlimited accumulation; conversion upon retirement to cash credit toward health and/or dental insurance premiums, or to pension credits.
  • Holidays – Nine designated holidays per year, plus four personal holidays to be used at the employee's discretion.
  • Transportation Allowance
  • Health and Dental Insurance – The City offers an HMO and PPO option for health and dental insurance coverage. The City pays major portion of the premium for employee and dependents depending on the health/dental plan selected.
  • Life Insurance – City-paid term life insurance policy equal to three times annual salary to a maximum of $500,000.
  • Disability – City-paid short-term and long-term disability insurance.
  • Flexible Spending Account – Optional election for employees to reduce taxable income for payment of allowable childcare or medical expenses.
  • Management Physical – Annual City-paid physical examination.
  • Deferred Compensation 457(b) Plan – Optional for employee contribution to a supplementary retirement savings program available through ICMA Retirement Corporation.
  • Technology Allowance – Monthly stipend.

EXAMPLES OF DUTIES

Reporting to the Oil Operations Bureau Manager, the Division Engineer is an unclassified management position that is responsible for the oil production operations, including the production of over ten million barrels of oil per year in the Wilmington Oil Field.

The Division Engineer assures oil facilities are properly maintained and follow best oil field practices. The position supervises the custody transfer of crude oil to local buyers and oversees procurement procedures of equipment and contract labor. It manages and reviews emergency spill response plans and represents the Department at spill drills and emergency response incidents. The position coordinates inspections with all pertinent regulatory agencies, including DOGGR, SLC, and AQMD. It reviews and makes recommendations for mechanical integrity programs, inspection plans, and capital investments. The Division Engineer is responsible for selecting, training, evaluating, and directing subordinate staff, and maintaining a highly motivated staff to carry out the City's oil field operations.

The Division Engineer represents the Department on various citywide committees. The position establishes and maintains strong working relationships with internal and external stakeholders. It works closely with local oil operations in which the City has financial interest, such as Signal Hill East and West Units, Recreation Park, and Marine Stadium. In addition, the Division Engineer ensures the protection of the environment and makes sure no adverse conditions are caused by ongoing oil operations.

REQUIREMENTS TO FILE

The Oil Operations Bureau is seeking an innovative leader. The ideal candidate for the Division Engineer position will be an experienced manager/team leader, who is creative, collaborative, and customer service oriented. He/she should have petroleum industry experience with pipeline mechanical integrity quality assurance, injection water quality optimization, high volume fluid shipment and processing, subsea line management, and basic production rig work over operations. In addition, the ideal candidate will have strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively communicate verbally and in writing.

Minimum qualifications for this position include having ten years of progressively challenging oil field experience managing complex projects, including 5 years experience managing staff, and graduation from an accredited university or college with a Bachelor's Degree in Petroleum Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Geology or a closely related field. Applicants must possess a valid driver license and satisfactory driving record. A California Professional Petroleum Engineer or Geologist license is desirable. Experience working in the Wilmington Oil Field is desirable.

SELECTION PROCEDURE

This recruitment will close at 4:30 p.m. on Monday, March 27, 2017. To be considered for this opportunity, applicants must submit a cover letter and an online application that reflects the scope and level of their current/most recent positions and responsibilities.

Candidates must also submit their responses to the supplemental questions.

Online applications can be filed at http://agency.governmentjobs.com/longbeach/default.cfm

Following the close of filing, applications will be reviewed and those candidates determined to be the best qualified will be invited to participate in the selection process which will include an oral interview by a selection panel. Incomplete applications or candidates who clearly do not meet the minimum requirements of the position will not be considered.

This information is available in an alternative format by request to the Long Beach Gas and Oil, Personnel Services Division at (562) 570-2063. If you require an accommodation because of a disability in order to participate in any phase of the application process, please request when submitting your application.

The City of Long Beach is an Equal Opportunity Employer and values diversity at all levels of the organization.
title: DIVISION ENGINEER

description:
ZymoChem is a synthetic biology start-up that is genetically engineering microbes to produce chemicals. Our mission is to reshape the chemical industry by developing eco-friendly processes for producing chemicals that go into making every day products such as plastics, fragrances, and fabrics. By engineering biosynthetic pathways not found in nature, ZymoChem is re-imagining the microbe, one that minimizes/eliminates carbon loss as CO2 during fermentation. ZymoChem’s “carbon conserving” microbes direct all carbon to chemical production, delivering up to a 50% increase in fermentation yields over state-of-the-art technologies. This improvement in efficiency gives ZymoChem’s bioprocesses a breakthrough cost-advantage over petroleum-based production of these chemicals, even at today’s oil prices.

Powering ZymoChem’s mission is a world-class team of scientists & engineers along with funding from the US Department of Energy, the US Department of Agriculture, IndieBio, and Breakout Labs. We are looking for highly motivated and productive researchers to join us in Berkeley, California to develop ZymoChem’s technology for transforming the renewable chemicals industry.

Position Summary

ZymoChem is seeking a Research Associate to immediately join and contribute to our company’s enzyme characterization, metabolic engineering, and strain development endeavors. As a member of our dynamic & cohesive team, you will have an opportunity to build a game-changing platform technology from the ground up. This position requires a strong work ethic with the capability to effectively multi-task on a daily basis and readily acquire new skills & techniques. An adept ability to communicate and work both independently and with a team in a fast-paced environment is crucial.

Specific research-based responsibilities for this position include DNA construction, cloning, strain engineering, protein expression & purification, in vitro enzyme activity assays, and cell culture studies. The Research Associate will also assist with designing experiments, creating & optimizing protocols, and collecting & processing data. Additional duties will involve building & maintaining ZymoChem’s registries of chemical and biological materials as well as performing routine tasks such as preparing reagents and maintaining an organized lab environment.

This position is for a full-time appointment with benefits including medical, dental, and vision.

Requirements

  • BS or MS in bioengineering, molecular biology, biochemistry, chemical engineering, or a related discipline, with a minimum of 1 year research experience with an academic lab and/or industrial research group
  • Experience working with coli and/or S. cerevisiae is strongly preferred; additional experience with other industrially-relevant microorganisms is a plus
  • Hands-on expertise with synthetic biology & strain engineering-related techniques such as PCR, Gibson Isothermal Assembly, Golden Gate cloning, and homologous recombination

Other Relevant Qualifications

Technical experiences and in-depth knowledge with the following:

  • Heterologous protein expression & purification
  • In vitro activity assays for characterizing enzyme functionality; experience with microtiter plate-based screens and spectrophotometers is a plus
  • Analytics such as HPLC and LC/MS for detecting and quantifying small molecules
  • Preparing & maintaining collections of chemical solutions & standards as well as biological samples such as enzymes and glycerol stocks of strains

Other desired qualities & experiences include:

  • Ability to maintain a well-organized laboratory notebook, prepare technical reports, and make scientific presentations
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Past work in an industrial setting or startup research setting is a plus

If this position aligns with your career aspirations, please include your resume/CV and a cover letter with your application. ZymoChem is an equal opportunity employer.

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • research: 1 year
title: Research Associate, Metabolic Engineering

description:
Skyworks Solutions, Inc. is empowering the wireless networking revolution. Our highly innovative analog semiconductors are connecting people, places and things spanning a number of new and previously unimagined applications. We possess broad technology capabilities and one of the most complete product portfolios in the industry. Our customers are global industry leaders who are driving innovative platforms that are changing the way we all live, work and play. Our global team collaborates daily to create the semiconductors the world relies on. If you're looking for a challenging and exciting career in a fast-paced environment, Skyworks offers a variety of roles in an environment that promotes prompt decision making, uninhibited sharing of best practices and individual ownership. Here, you'll find minimal layers of management, open communication and mutual trust and respect.
Requisition ID: 16041
Skyworks designs, develops, and packages premier semiconductor solutions for the RF and wireless markets. The company utilizes leading edge packaging technology to achieve maximum RF performance, and superior quality/reliability at a competitive cost. We are currently seeking an engineering candidate to manage package/process development and new product introduction.

Candidate will work with circuit designers, material suppliers, internal and external manufacturing facilities, and reliability engineering to define and develop PCB and assembly technology for high volume MCM products to meet critical objectives for cost, reliability, and manufacturability. Travel to domestic facilities, North American production facility, and international suppliers required.

Job Requirements:
BS Material Science, Mechanical, or Chemical engineering
4 years minimum experience in semiconductor packaging development
Experience PCB development for very high volume RF MCMs
Experience in MCM assembly process development; SMT, die attach, wire bond, and mold
Strong understanding of SPC techniques, FMEA, Six Sigma, and Reliability Standards
Strong driver who is assertive and results/goal oriented. Team player with good interpersonal skills, and able to work efficiently with a multi-functional group
Must have excellent communication skills - verbal, written and presentation

Skyworks is proud to be an equal opportunity employer supporting diversity in the workplace.
title: Semiconductor Electronic Packaging Engineer

description:
Position Summary

Catalent Biologics-West (formerly Redwood
Bioscience) has developed a protein-chemical engineering technology to produce
the next-generation of antibody- drug conjugates (“ADCs”) and other
semi-synthetic biotherapeutics. The Company’s proprietary SMARTag

TM

site-specific
protein modification technology, novel conjugation chemistry and proprietary
cytotoxin-linkers enable the generation of homogenous bioconjugates engineered
to enhance potency, safety and stability. The technology employs natural
post-translational modifications found in human cells to site-specifically
create one or more aldehyde tags on protein molecules. These chemical handles
are then stably conjugated to cytotoxic payloads to prevent their systemic
release. The SMARTag

TM

platform
provides precise payload positioning and defined stoichiometry of
payload–protein ratios. The control afforded by the technology also enables
identification of superior drugs from libraries of differentially designed
conjugates.

Catalent is seeking a Scientist who will
be responsible for the development and execution of cell- and antibody-based
assays related to analysis of antibody-drug conjugates.

The Company:
Catalent Pharma Solutions is the leading provider
of pharmaceutical development services, drug delivery technologies,
manufacturing, packaging, and product commercialization services to the
global pharmaceutical and biotechnology industry. We employ over
8,000 people in more than 25 facilities worldwide with
reported annual revenues of approximately $1.8 billion. At Catalent, we
take pride in providing a shared commitment to build employee capability, and
foster a culture of inclusion, where talent and potential are unleashed, and
where employees are committed and engaged to achieve results.

Catalent is a current portfolio company
holding of The Blackstone Group.

Key Responsibilities

Perform in vitro cytotoxicity studies to test the
potency of ADCs and cytotoxic payloads.

Test antibody binding characteristics through
ELISA and flow cytometry-based binding and internalization assays.

Work independently to develop new and optimize
existing analytical assays.

Function as a key contributing member of the bioconjugation
and analytics team and communicate results across in-house teams.

Generate data to support strategic partner
relationships, platform development, patents, and publications.

Qualifications

Requirements

BS in cell biology, biochemistry, or a
related discipline with 7 years of experience in pharma or biotech industry OR MS

in cell biology, biochemistry, or a
related discipline with 5 years of experience in pharma or biotech industry

.

The candidate must have significant ELISA, cell biology and cell culture experience in the biopharmaceutical industry.

Applicants with experience in and a proven track record with flow cytometry and

in vitro cytotoxicity assays

will be favorably considered.

Candidates should have a track record of problem solving, strong
organization, data management and

communication skills,

and the ability to collaborate between multidisciplinary teams.

Track record of establishing and meeting
production goals that consistently meet quality requirements is essential.

Competencies

A high degree of personal and professional
integrity

Strong interpersonal, leadership, and
communication skills

Ability to deliver high quality results in a
resource-constrained environment

Consensus builder

Thrives in a fast-paced environment

Self-motivated and driven towards excellence

About Catalent

Catalent Pharma Solutions is the leading global
provider of advanced delivery technologies and development solutions for drugs,
biologics and consumer health products.
With over 80 years serving the industry, Catalent has proven expertise
in bringing more customer products to market faster, enhancing product
performance and ensuring reliable clinical and commercial product supply.
Catalent is headquartered in Somerset, N.J. For more information, visit
www.catalent.com

More products. Better treatments. Reliably
supplied.™

Catalent is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative
Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for
employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin,
disability, or protected veteran status.

If you require reasonable accommodation for any part
of the application or hiring process due to a disability, you may submit your
request by sending an email along with the job number and title to
Jobs@catalent.com. This option is reserved for individuals who require
accommodation due to a disability. Information received will be routed to a
recruiter who will provide assistance to ensure appropriate consideration in
the application or hiring process.

Notice to Agency and Search Firm

Representatives:
Catalent Pharma Solutions (Catalent) is not
accepting unsolicited resumes

from agencies and/or search firms for this job
posting. Resumes submitted to any
Catalent employee by a third party agency and/or search firm without a valid
written & signed search agreement, will become the sole property of
Catalent. No fee will be paid if a
candidate is hired for this position as a result of an unsolicited agency or
search firm referral. Thank you.

description:
As a member of the Membrane Research and Development team, the Process Engineer will work closely with internal stakeholders and apply sound engineering principles to aid the development of scalable material solutions and coating processes.

The Process Engineer will work under the direction of a Sr. Scientist or manager level, lead the process development effort for new materials and process equipment, summarize the findings, and communicate to the cross functional team and support staff.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Assess the processing characteristics of new materials/formulations and develop solutions to mitigate coating application risks.
  • Identify critical formulation and coating process parameters and develop optimum processing windows and boundary specs.
  • Design, develop, and validate new or improved membrane processes to meet the targeted product performance and business objectives.
  • Aid in the development and transfer of new materials or fabrication processes into manufacturing.
  • Analyze experimental data, make conclusions and recommendations based on findings.
  • Act as liaison between material development, process development and scale up.
  • Maintain laboratory notebook, documenting observations and critical details during experiments.
  • Draft and edit formal documents related to formulations and application procedures.
  • This position assumes and performs other duties as assigned.
  • Perform all work in conformance with DexComâs quality control process and standard operating procedures.
  • Maintains a safe and clean working environment.

Required Qualifications:
  • Typically requires a BS degree or MS degree in Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Bioengineering, or equivalent.
  • 1-3 years of industrial experience with an emphasis on coating process development preferred.
  • Adept at data analysis methods and analysis software, strong analytical and experimental skills.
  • Must be organized and detail oriented.
  • Excellent communication (written and verbal) and personal interaction skills.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Proven ability to work hands-on in a fast-paced environment.
  • Proficiency with material process-performance relationship, instrumentation, design of experiment (DOE), and statistical analysis.
  • Ability to evaluate and apply design tradeoffs and constraints for design optimization.
  • Ability to run self-directed projects, manage timelines, transfer technology and execute projects in an R&D; environment.
  • Proactive and creative in achieving goals with strong conflict resolution skills.
  • Aptitude to contribute to intellectual property development.

Travel Required:
  • 0 â 24%

Language Skills: Must be able to communicate effectively in English. Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization.

Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. May be required to perform the following Physical Activity: Standing, walking, sitting, using hands, handle or feel, reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl, talk or hear, taste or smell. May be required to lift 0 lbs. to over 100 lbs.

Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. May be exposed to the following environmental conditions: Wet or humid conditions, work near moving parts, work in high - precarious places, fumes or airborne particles, toxic or caustic chemicals, outdoor weather conditions, extreme heat (non-weather), extreme cold (non-weather), risk of electric shock, work with explosives, risk of radiation, vibration. The noise level in this work environment can range from quiet to very loud.

Please note: The information contained herein is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job, nor are they intended to be an all-inclusive list of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Management may, at its discretion, assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. The duties and responsibilities in this job description may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons.

Masimo (NASDAQ: MASI) headquartered in Irvine, California, is a fast-growing and award-winning international medical technology and device company with operations spanning the globe. These revolutionary technologies are helping to solve "unsolvable" problems that have plagued the healthcare industry, while taking the pain and discomfort out of blood monitoring. Job Summary This Adhesive Formulation Chemist is responsible for pressure sensitive adhesive (PSA) formulation and will also possess knowledge of the manufacturing process, equipment required, and production controls and metrics used to assure final product quality. The Adhesive Formulation Chemist will formulate and bring to manufacturing new, effective formulations and, if necessary, processes for pressure sensitive adhesives for use on the company’s devices. The role will also participate in projects that support the company’s long term objective to develop and manufacture these adhesives in-house.

Duties & Responsibilities
  • Formulate pressure sensitive adhesives for use in patient contacting applications, as well as adhesives used in the internal construction of the products;
  • Work closely with the product development team and customers, ensuring that new formulations meet customer expectations in addition to specified performance characteristics;
  • Evaluate raw materials and raw material suppliers to assure new adhesive formulations meet expectations for quality, repeatability between lots, ease of manufacture and cost;
  • Prepare production formulas and the necessary process instructions for manufacturing;
  • Provide direction and supervision to lab technician(s);

Minimum Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in chemistry or chemical engineering;
  • Prior experience in the development, formulation, and/or coating processes for pressure sensitive adhesives;
  • Experience transitioning adhesives from the laboratory to the production floor, including the development of process capability and tracking metrics;
Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience in quality improvement and cost reduction activities;
  • Experience in PSA formulation for the medical device industry;
Education

Bachelor’s degree in chemistry or chemical engineering required;
Knowledge of rheology and polymers is desirable;

Physical requirements/Work Environment The candidate must have the ability to work in a laboratory environment. This position requires frequent sitting, standing and walking. Daily use of a computer and other computing and digital devices is required. May stand for extended periods of time. Some local or long distance travel may be necessary. A valid driver’s license is required.

The physical demands of the position described herein are essential functions of the job and employees must be able to successfully perform these tasks for extended periods. Reasonable accommodations may be made for those individuals with real or perceived disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job described.

We are proud to offer if eligible a highly competitive compensation plan with an excellent benefits package including 3 weeks vacation, stock options, 401k match, medical, dental, vision plans and much more!

Masimo is an Equal Employment Opportunity Commission / Affirmative Action employer, We encourage Minorities, Females, Disabled and Veterans to apply.

***NO AGENCIES PLEASE*** Thank you!

description:
Responsible for establishing, maintaining and monitoring of environmental, health & safety programs to protect human health, the environment and control related Jabil business risk. This job requires an incumbent to independently coordinate programs, often managing issues at the Division level and working senior staff.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
- Assist and counsel managers, safety council members and area coordinators.
- Evaluate work environment from the stand point of ergonomics, machine guarding, and any other applicable regulations.
- Conduct audits, accident investigations, and trend analysis.
- Lead in cross functional teams for EHS issue resolution or for new equipment/process approval.
- Consult and assists with initiatives related to EHS projects and programs.
- Supports corporate and insurance carrier studies.
- Assists in development of chemically safe work practices, institutes and revises lockout/tag-out procedures, confined space/permit program and, process safety rule procedures.
- Meets requirements for emergency medical response for blood borne pathogens.
- Conducts safety audits, supports inspections & maintains OSHA or equivalent local regulatory required documentation.
- Provides consultation and oversight for the site hazardous waste management system including but not limited to establishing training on proper labeling, handling, documentation and overall guidance to facilitate compliance with all applicable laws and regulations
- Assists in finding dispositions for off-spec or recyclable, and reporting of hazardous materials. Follows "Approved Vendor List" for e-scrap disposition service providers and may perform e-scrap contractor site audit.
- Manage development, implementation and maintenance of environmental and safety programs such as: management systems requirements (ISO/EICC/OSHAS…etc), hazard communication, control of change, hazardous waste management, reporting site key performance factors, Green House Gas data, chemical management systems and programs, personal protective equipment, dangerous goods – hazardous materials management, emergency preparedness, regulatory reporting and data collection.
- Maintains site environmental permits and complies with all reporting and permit application requirements under all related local and regional laws and regulations.
- Inspects manufacturing operations, office, and shipping areas as well as the facility's grounds. Ensures compliance with EHS policies for implementation of Global and Regional EHS initiatives.
- Coordinates with process engineering departments and operations management to review and revise process procedures, chemicals and equipment. Works with process engineering to identify lower risk chemical and process alternatives to high risk materials and processes. Evaluates site chemical management systems to assure all required elements required for robust controls are in place to comply with regulations and mitigate to the best extent possible risk to employees, the environment and the business.
- Develops employee's safety/environmental training and awareness programs.
- Performs gap analysis and internal audits against global EHS Policy as well as international standards (ISO14001, OSHAS18001, EICC EHS Code Conformance…etc). .
- Provide environmental, safety and industrial hygiene consulting services to facilities to help assure compliance with federal (for instance applicable NOM-005-STPS-1998, Brazil SUS Article 205 Sections II and VIII, OSHA, SEMARNAT, EPA…etc.), state and local regulations.
Education & Experience Requirements
- Bachelor's Degree required in chemistry / biology, engineering / mechanical or chemical engineering or related field.
- 3 years of related Health/Safety Engineering experience.
- Or an equivalent combination of education, training or experience.

Jabil is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law.
title: EHS Engineer

description:
Do you want to change the world? We do, too.

The energy market is roughly $4 trillion globally, and solar penetration is less than 1%. But just one hour of sunlight, if harnessed, could power the entire world for a year. We have the opportunity to completely change the way energy is produced, distributed and consumed on a global scale, and we’re looking for talented, committed people to help us drive our growth and achieve our goals.

SunPower is a global solar energy solutions company with a rich heritage of pioneering the best energy technologies in the world. Our solutions are unrivaled in terms of long-term reliability, efficiency and guaranteed performance, and our company is unmatched in terms of global reach and scale. Through design, manufacturing, installation and ongoing maintenance and monitoring, SunPower provides its proprietary, world-record efficient solar technology to residential, commercial and utility customers worldwide.

SunPower is changing the way our world is powered every day with a brilliant, passionate and driven team of more than 7,000 in North America, Europe, Africa, Asia and Australia. In an industry that is reshaping the world’s energy future, there’s no better place to be than SunPower.

We believe that our employees create our brand – with each project, each communication, each task completed and each interaction. Experience is critical to SunPower in regards to not only our customers but also our employees and dealer partners. As such, we strive to hire candidates that are service focused. The experience we would expect the ideal person to deliver is:

Cell R&D; Staff - Wet Process Engineer

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

As a Wet Etch Process Development Engineer within the Sunpower RnD team, you will be responsible for innovating and improving wet etch and wet cleans processing for current and next generation technologies. You will work in all facets of the photovoltaic device processing and integration including process development and optimization. You will team with Equipment Engineering to assess and develop necessary toolsets to achieve this objective. The team will be challenged by new materials, applications and device architectures. You will be responsible for establishing robust wet processes and chemistries through rigorous characterization and statistical validation before ramping them into high volume manufacturing.
  • Primary responsibility is the development and assessment of novel wet processing techniques to meet SunPower solar cell development goals.
  • Investigating and assessing new chemistries for performance and cost of operation.
  • Integration of these new processes to upstream and downstream processing and product requirements.
  • Designing experiments (DOE)
  • Coordinating/executing experiments in the laboratory, at production sites and at vendor sites
  • Analyzing and presenting data with recommendations
  • Communicating within a development team and with internal project customers
Qualifications and Experience
  • Minimum of Bachelor’s in Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics, Chemistry, or related fields. If a candidate has a B.S. or M.S. only, 4/2+ years (respectively) of industrial experience is required.
  • Demonstrated failure analysis work in which the candidate was responsible for choosing the best samples and metrology to quickly identify root cause.
  • Significant experience with semiconductor materials and equipment development
  • 2+ years’ experience in semiconductor research and development environment preferred
  • Experience with solar processes and integration a plus
  • Solar cell device physics background or equivalent (i.e. semiconductor physics) a plus
  • Self-starter, comfortable with owning a development project
  • Flexible, creative problem solver, willing to adapt to unexpected situations to get results
  • Team player, good at working with diverse groups
  • Excellent communicator, both in presentations and written reports
  • Willing to travel 10% of the time
Equal Employment Opportunity

Employment decisions are based on an individual’s qualifications as they relate to the job under consideration. The Company’s policy prohibits unlawful discrimination based on sex (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions, the actual sex of the individual, or the gender identity or gender expression), race, color, religion, including religious dress practices and religious grooming practices, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, familial status, age, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, protected veteran or military status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state or local laws, ordinances, or regulations. description:
Founded in 2013 and based in the San Francisco Bay Area, Zymergen is a technology company unlocking the power of biology. We deliver better economics for products made from biology that are used across industries, bring new products to market faster, and develop novel products. Our proprietary platform uses robots and machine learning to engineer microbes faster, more predictably, and to a level of performance previously unattainable. These microbes, and the products they produce, have broad applications across industries such as chemicals and materials, agriculture, and healthcare. For more information visit www.zymergen.com ( http://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url;=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.zymergen.com%2F&esheet;=51436625&newsitemid;=20161010006215&lan;=en-US&anchor;=www.zymergen.com&index;=1&md5;=eadf9f7cb8a0bdbfa22eb7b2688a7e09 ).

1. Job Description and Specific Responsibilities

Zymergen is hiring a Scientist with experience in fermentation to advance bench-scale and microtiter-plate based fermentation within the company. The Scientist will identify areas of need and address them through developing new technologies or bringing outside technologies into the company.

Immediate responsibilities involve:
  • Scale-down of fermentation processes to microtiter-plate scale for a variety of microbes
  • Strain characterization at bench scale and microtiter-plate scale
  • Working with colleagues in Operations for ongoing troubleshooting and process improvements
  • Improving the quality of measurements made in plates and fermenters
  • Building automated solutions to improve fermentation operations workflows
  • Developing new high throughput plate-based assays to use across a variety of microbes
  • Internal and external technology transfer projects
The Fermentation team at Zymergen is essential for screening microbes in high throughput to identify those with improved performance and transferring technologies between Zymergen and our partner organizations. Scientists must bring creativity and perseverance across a variety of large and small projects that contribute to installing, validating, and improving the equipment and processes used by the operations team. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to shape the scientific environment and establish best practices within a growing company.

2. Qualifications and Experience

We favor candidates with formal training (PhD, MS, or equivalent) in chemical engineering or microbiology and several years of industry experience. We prefer candidates who are familiar with a variety of bench scale fermentation units and who have experience working with or alongside small scale (microtiter plates) and manufacturing scale fermentation processes. We look for candidates with a track record of developing and running highly accurate and precise fermentation processes for evaluating microbes.

We favor a Scientist with experience in some or all of the following areas:

  • Experience working with a variety of microbes, fermentation processes, and product types
  • Strong understanding of the connection between microbial physiology and process performance
  • Hands-on experience with bench-scale fermentation and/or plate-based culture methods
  • Familiarity with analytical chemistry/assay methods, automation systems, and LIMS
  • Strong data analysis skills, including the use of statistics (JMP or similar software) and control charts to monitor and analyze results
title: Scientist, Fermentation

description:
MouthSense LLC is an innovative Health and Wellness Diagnostics company that has the ability to read a variety of biomarkers in human saliva. MouthSense home care, point-of-exercise, and testing allows safer and quicker results with the same quality and accuracy as a blood-based laboratory test. We are seeking a Scientist to join our R&D; team. This is a great opportunity to join our rapidly growing biotech firm.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Provide in depth and hands on technical expertise to aggressively progress the company’s portfolio
  • Participate and contribute to experiment and experimental result evaluation
  • Provide knowledge and support for electrochemical biosensor development
  • Perform daily as well as necessary weekly routines to meet project deadlines.
  • Prepares reports and papers for participating projects.
  • Identify and provide training to subordinate personnel to carry out research.
  • Write study plan, protocol and related procedure for product development & transfer; and communicate with vendors for the project needs on equipment and supplies.
  • Prepare production samples and evaluate product design and integrity
  • Working closely with chemists and engineers, he or she will be responsible for the implementation and further development of the technology with the ultimate goal of detecting a range of each biomarkers
  • Be able to conduct multidisciplinary communication with R&D; team

Requirements of the position:

  • Master’s or Ph.D. in biology, electrochemistry, chemical engineering, bioengineering, electrical engineering or related discipline.
  • At least 3 years’ experience inform the industry involving in the in vitro/in vivo diagnostic device
  • Experience on product development on immunoassay and ELISA based biosensor development is highly desired .
  • Develop, execute, and trouble-shoot immunoassays, including in vitro antibody/antigen ELISA, and receptor binding assays
  • Demonstrated experience on the stability optimization of immuno or ELISA based sensor is highly preferred
  • Previous experience in the field of diagnostics, biosensor development, microfluidics, handling of biological samples, assay design, development and validation will be greatly appreciated.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in design of experiments & able to analyze data statistically.
  • Knowledge of chemistry surface modification, bioassay development (e.g. antibody, or enzyme based), microfluidics, in-vitro electrochemical sensing (e.g. amperometry, potentiometry, impedance) or related areas.
  • Knowledge of Strip design, algorithm and manufacturing processes is a plus.
  • Knowledge of material science, immunology, microbiology and other related field is a plus.

Job Type: Full-time

Required experience:

description:
Bio-Rad is looking for a Summer Intern-R&D; Process Development Engineer

What you'll be doing:
This position is in the Digital Biology Group, located in Pleasanton, CA. You will be working as part of an innovative and multidisciplinary team to develop the most advanced droplet microfluidics-based products on the market. You will help develop new tools that are fundamentally changing the way biologists address questions in broad areas of research and medicine.

As an intern, you will work with a supervising R&D; Engineer, and you will also interact with a broader cross functional team, to develop and test new biological analysis instruments and consumables by planning and executing experiments on prototype devices and analyzing and interpreting the results. You will be working "hands-on" in the laboratory to operate and test a variety of novel instruments as well as performing data analysis. Through this experience, you will gain valuable knowledge and work experience with droplet microfluidics, biological assays, and general R&D; activities for product development.

What you need for this role:
Undergraduate (heading into Senior year preferred) or MS degree candidate, majoring in chemical engineering, biomedical engineering, or mechanical engineering (preferably with emphasis in fluid mechanics), or equivalent.

You must have plans to return to school in the following term (you are not eligible for this program if you have already graduated)

Have an interest or desire to perform "hands-on" work in the laboratory.

Experience with biochemical assays, molecular biology, PCR and/or analytical chemistry, is a plus.

Have a grade point average of 3.0 or better (on a 4.0 scale)

Eligible to work in the United States

Be willing to make a full-time commitment of 40 hours a week for 10 weeks from mid June to mid August in SF Bay Area.

About Bio-Rad:
Bio-Rad is a global leader providing a broad array of clinical diagnostics and life science research products. With a team of more than 7,800 employees and a global network of operations serving our customers, we help people live longer, healthier lives.

Bio-Rad was founded over six decades ago and has continued to provide the healthcare industry with innovative and useful products that help life science researchers accelerate the discovery process and medical diagnostic labs obtain faster, better results.
