description:
Summary:
World Oil Refining has an exciting opportunity for a Petroleum Chemical / Process Engineer at its South Gate, CA facility. The successful candidate must have qualifications in Chemical Engineering, Process Engineering or Petroleum Engineering (Downstream), and have a minimum work experience of 3-5 years, preferably with exposure to oil refineries, process plants and other downstream operations. The ideal candidate is team-oriented, self-starter responsible for providing support to Operations and assisting on the quality assurance and refining economics functions to achieve maximum refinery safety, efficiency and economy. While a strong operational background is preferred, additional experience in consulting or professional services is favorable.

Job Duties:
 Optimization and troubleshooting of daily refinery operations based on review of process data and evaluation of laboratory results
 Identify, monitor, and report on key performance indicators for process units
 Provide technical support needed to ensure facility compliance with environmental operating limits, participation in HAZOP studies, inspection and verification of process equipment during large scale unit maintenance events (includes work at heights and confined spaces), and participation & leadership of incident investigations
 Developing refinery improvement projects, from conception through start-up, to ensure viability of the refinery
 Support process control and compliance data systems from field device level to distributed control system and hardware components
 Utilize computer programs, such as HYSYS and heat exchanger rating programs, to identify inefficiencies, design new projects, and optimize unit operations
 Management of catalyst operating process conditions, selection and yield optimization.

Key Accountabilities:
 Assess any recommendations with the Director of Operations to reduce product quality give-away and optimize energy performance.
 Monitoring and compiling process and analyzer data packages for process improvements and required environmental reporting
 Follow up with the Director of Operations to ensure recommendations are made to optimize product volume, yield and quality, minimize operating costs and maximize unit reliability at planned throughput.
 Participate in daily operations review and follow upon the operations targets when/ as required by type of feed stock; chemical additives type/doses, water treatments, operations troubleshooting, etc.
 Identify unit and equipment operating limits (short and long term), assess equipment performance capabilities together with the Operations and Process managers.
 Utilize, maintain and develop monitoring tools of refinery process and equipment to aid process monitoring, troubleshooting and design.
 Seek opportunities to increase unit performance by developing engineering projects as required, develop field changes.
 Document plant tests and define optimum operation parameters based on results.
 Point of contact between process and laboratory needs.
 Review the design of the refinery upgrade projects and provide recommendations for improvements/ compliance.
 Monitor units efficiency and performance and recommend means of improvements.

Basic Qualifications  B.S. Chemical Engineering or equivalent
 3-5 years of experience in a chemical process environment (refinery, chemical process plant, etc.)
 Excellent communication, time management and interpersonal skills
 Demonstrated ability to interact well within a multidisciplinary team
 Willingness to spend time in the field is expected
 Demonstrated experience with engineering software applications
 Proficiency required with data acquisition systems, process control design and algorithms, and CEMS units
 Strong analytical and problem solving skills

Preferred Qualifications:
 Refinery experience with direct experience in refinery unit operations
 Basic understanding of refining processes and economics
 Working knowledge with HYSIS, Pro2, PI or other software programs

title: IMO SC Senior Process Engineer

description:
MS in processing engineering or BS in Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering or related field with 5-10 years hands-on, experimental experience in a research and development environment working with materials processing methods and equipment. The advanced manufacturing and deposition systems group is currently working a number of exciting and transformational technologies for additive manufacturing, manufacturing of batteries, composites manufacturing, and spray processing.

About the Job

In this position you will be responsible for leading process optimization and experimental design for complex systems. This includes working with Mechanical Engineers to ensure experimental setups include necessary controls from inception, planning experimental campaigns to meet research goals, setting and documenting experimental procedures, performing metrology, and analyzing results. The ideal candidate will have experience working with polymer processing, ceramic slurry processing, coating, or printing systems.

Requirements

  • MS in Process Engineering or BS in related field with 5-10 years Process Engineering Experience
  • Familiarity with control and operation of common processing equipment (pumps, valves, dispensers, ovens, curing and drying equipment, simple mechanical motion systems).
  • Familiarity with metrology equipment at multiple length scales (SEM, optical microscoscopy, confocal microscopes, profilometers, film measurement, etc…)
  • Ability to formulate efficient experimental campaigns and then execute on them
  • Strong desire to learn new systems
  • Strong communication, teamwork, and leadership skills
Benefits

We offer a very competitive salary package and full benefits (medical, dental, vision, life & disability insurance, 401K). PARC employees enjoy the use of onsite health & fitness center and collegial dining at our onsite cafeteria. The PARC campus is in a spacious modern building in close proximity to the resources and opportunities of Silicon Valley and benefits from nearby leading universities such as Stanford and Berkeley. It is also close to many amenities, top schools, and outdoor activities (see http://www.parc.com/about/culture.html). PARC provides a highly diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer (see http://www.parc.com/about/careers/).

About PARC

PARC, a Xerox company, is in the Business of Breakthroughs®. Practicing open innovation, we provide custom R&D; services, technology, expertise, best practices, and intellectual property to Fortune 500 and Global 1000 companies, startups, and government agencies and partners. We create new business options, accelerate time to market, augment internal capabilities, and reduce risk for our clients.

Since its inception, PARC has pioneered many technology platforms – from the Ethernet and laser printing to the GUI and ubiquitous computing – and has enabled the creation of many industries. Incorporated as an independent, wholly owned subsidiary of Xerox in 2002, PARC today continues the research that enables breakthroughs for our clients' businesses.

PARC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. People with disabilities who need a reasonable accommodation to apply or compete for employment with PARC should contact PARC Human Resources.

description:
Eurofins is the world leader in the food, bio/pharmaceutical product testing. It is also number one in the field of environmental laboratory services and one of the global market leaders in agroscience, genomics, discovery pharmacology, and central laboratory services. With over $2 billion in annual revenues and 25,000 employees across 250 sites in 39 countries, Eurofins is a leading international group of laboratories providing an unparalleled range of testing and support services to the pharmaceutical, biopharmaceutical, food, environmental, and consumer products industries and to governments.

Eurofins Lancaster Laboratories PSS is searching for a Scientist – Protein Analytical Chemistry in Thousand Oaks, CA.

Scientist – Protein Analytical Chemistry responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following :
  • Design and execute experiments for analytical support of biotherapeutic proteins using HPLC, LCMS, and capillary electrophoresis
  • Troubleshoot and maintain analytical equipment in good working order
  • Develop and optimize analytical methods
  • Analyze and clearly document experiments in Electronic Lab Notebook (ELN) and Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS)
  • Use phase appropriate GxP documentation and scientific report writing
The ideal candidate would possess :
  • Experience analyzing proteins using HPLC, LCMS, and electrophoretic methods
  • Experience developing, qualifying, and testing analytical methods to characterize proteins
  • Strong analytical lab skills and technical knowledge of proteins and peptides
  • Excellent documentation skills, including an understanding of GxP requirements
  • Excellent communication (oral and written) skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent pipetting skills
  • Strong computer and organizational skills
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a larger analytical team
  • Desire to learn new techniques and multi-task with clients
  • Experience with protein therapeutic process development
  • Biotech/pharmaceutical industry experience preferred.
Basic Minimum Qualifications :
  • B.S. with 1-4 years of experience, with degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Chemical Engineering, Molecular Biology or related field
  • Authorization to work in the United States indefinitely without restriction or sponsorship
Position is full-time, Monday-Friday, 8 a.m.-5 p.m., with overtime as needed. Candidates currently living within a commutable distance of Thousand Oaks, CA are encouraged to apply.

As a Eurofins Lancaster Labs employee, you will become part of a company that has received national recognition as a great place to work. We offer excellent full-time benefits including comprehensive medical coverage, life and disability insurance, 401(k) with company match, paid holidays and paid time-off, and dental and vision options.

To learn more about Eurofins, please explore our website www.eurofinsus.com . Eurofins is a M/F, Disabled, and Veteran Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.

title: Biologics Engineer, Process Development Scientist

description:
ZymoChem is a synthetic biology start-up that is genetically engineering microbes to produce chemicals. Our mission is to reshape the chemical industry by developing eco-friendly processes for producing chemicals that go into making every day products such as plastics, fragrances, and fabrics. By engineering biosynthetic pathways not found in nature, ZymoChem is re-imagining the microbe, one that minimizes/eliminates carbon loss as CO2 during fermentation. ZymoChem’s “carbon conserving” microbes direct all carbon to chemical production, delivering up to a 50% increase in fermentation yields over state-of-the-art technologies. This improvement in efficiency gives ZymoChem’s bioprocesses a breakthrough cost-advantage over petroleum-based production of these chemicals, even at today’s oil prices.

Powering ZymoChem’s mission is a world-class team of scientists & engineers along with funding from the US Department of Energy, the US Department of Agriculture, IndieBio, and Breakout Labs. We are looking for highly motivated and productive researchers to join us in Berkeley, California to develop ZymoChem’s technology for transforming the renewable chemicals industry.

Position Summary

ZymoChem is seeking a highly-motivated Scientist / Senior Scientist to immediately join and lead our company’s strain construction and pathway engineering efforts. As a member of our dynamic & cohesive team, you will have an opportunity to build a game-changing platform technology from the ground up. This scientist position requires an entrepreneurial-level initiative, the ability to demonstrate scientific leadership, and a strong work ethic with the capability to prioritize & efficiently multi-task on a daily basis. An adept ability to effectively communicate and work with a team in a fast-paced environment is crucial, and the desire & skills to manage other researchers is also a prerequisite.

Primary responsibilities for this position will include [1] designing, building, and executing high-throughput strain construction workflows with knock-out, knock-in, and mutagenesis capabilities; and [2] characterizing and optimizing non-native biosynthetic pathways. Additional tasks will involve DNA design & construction, lab-scale cell culture studies, and working with analytics such as HPLC and LC/MS.

This position is for a full-time appointment with benefits including medical, dental, and vision.

Requirements

  • PhD in bioengineering, chemical engineering, biochemistry, molecular biology, or a related discipline; previous work in an industrial setting or startup environment is preferred
  • Proven expertise with engineering coli is strongly preferred; additional experience with other industrially-relevant prokaryotes and/or eukaryotes is a plus
  • Excellence in state-of-the-art genome engineering & strain construction techniques such as – CRISPR/Cas9, MAGE and homologous recombination
  • Experience with building, testing, and optimizing heterologous metabolic pathways for the production of chemicals

Other Relevant Qualifications

Technical experiences and in-depth knowledge with the following:

  • Bioinformatics & other computational tools related to strain engineering, metabolic modeling, and pathway design & construction
  • Designing and establishing successful high-throughput systems & methodologies
  • -Omics techniques for analyzing/optimizing metabolic pathway flux
  • Microbial physiology, anaerobic growth, central metabolism, small molecule transport, and product toxicity
  • Bench-scale fermentations and analytics for detecting & quantifying small molecules

Other desired qualities & experiences include:

  • Track record of supervising other scientists and/or research associates
  • Experience with writing successful grant proposals
  • Relevant publication record and achievements

If this position aligns with your career aspirations, please upload your resume/CV and a cover letter with your application. ZymoChem is an equal opportunity employer.

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Doctorate

Required experience:

  • post-doctoral: 1 year
title: Scientist, Strain Development

description:
The
Cardiovascular & Specialty Solutions (CSS) Group, part of the Medical
Devices sector within Johnson & Johnson, is recruiting for a Staff Engineer aligned to Pulsar Vascular located in Los Gatos, CA.

The
CSS Group consists of six diverse businesses including Acclarent, Advanced
Sterilization Products (ASP), Biosense Webster (BWI), Codman Neuro, Mentor, and
Sterilmed. The CSS Group serves a diverse base of customers in Ear, Nose and
Throat (ENT), Infection Prevention, Electrophysiology (EP), Neurovascular and
Neurosurgery, Surgical and Non-Surgical Aesthetics, and Reprocessing.

Codman
Neuro is a global neurosurgery and neurovascular company that offers a
broad portfolio of devices for hydrocephalus management, neuro intensive care
and cranial surgery, as well as aneurysm coils, vascular reconstruction devices
and other technologies used in the endovascular treatment of cerebral aneurysms
and stroke. Learn more about Codman Neuro at www.codman.com for more information. Pulsar Vascular is a leading developer of
breakthrough platform technology for the neurovascular treatment of complex
aneurysms, including the PulseRider system, a minimally-invasive,
self-expanding nitinol implant.

Responsibilities

The Staff Engineer will be responsible for aspects of the product
design and development of a project with a focus on innovative implantable
medical devices that address the customer needs for a complete procedural
solution.
The successful candidate will be working within a cross-functional
project team through all phases of the product development process, planning
and executing projects through the product launch.
The candidate will work closely with members of the project core
team (marketing, manufacturing, quality, etc.) and surgeons to define user
needs, generate design concepts and prototypes, perform design evaluations
(such as tolerance analysis, FEA, DOE's, simulated use testing, etc.), and
support development of product and process validation plans and testing.
Plans, develops, coordinates, and directs a large important
engineering project or a number of small complex projects and carries out
complex or novel assignments requiring the development of new or improved
techniques or procedures.
The candidate will apply a diversified knowledge of engineering
principles and practices in broad areas of assignments and makes decisions
independently on engineering problems and methods.
The candidate demonstrates a full understanding in the application
of design controls and development processes, and has the ability to prioritize
tasks and manage a varied workload, exhibit strong written and verbal
communication skills and interface effectively with others in the project team.

The individual will also be expected to develop an expert
knowledge of our product lines and detailed knowledge of various anatomies and
pathologies.
Qualifications
Qualifications

A minimum of eight years of related engineering experience is
required.
A Bachelor Degree in Mechanical, Biomedical, Industrial, or
Chemical Engineering or Ph.D. in relevant discipline and four or more years of
related engineering experience is preferred.
New product development experience in medical devices is
preferred.
Must have significant complex level engineering experience.
Experienced in product design, process development, device testing
or prototyping is an asset.
Must possess a good mastery of theoretical and practical
fundamentals and experimental engineering techniques.
Must be able to work independently on assigned project activities
in a cross functional team environment.
This position will be
located in Los Gatos, CA and requires up to 10% travel domestically with the
potential of international travel.

Instructor, Chemistry

Posting #: 16-065

Campus: Foothill College

Number of Working Months: 10 Months

Starting Salary: $57,066.00 - $93,722.00 annually*

Close Date:
Open Until Filled: Open Until Filled

Employment Duration: Full-Time

Description:
Initial Review Date: 2/13/17*
  • Any complete applications received after the review date will only be forwarded to the hiring committee at their request.
The Foothill-De Anza Community College District is currently accepting applications for the faculty position of Chemistry Instructor, Foothill College.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE POSITION INCLUDE:
Under the direction of the Dean of the Physical Sciences, Mathematics and Engineering Division, instruct community college lecture and laboratory chemistry courses to a diverse student population. Teach Organic Chemistry along with the full range of lower division chemistry courses taught at Foothill College as needed. Plan, organize, and oversee curriculum development with special attention to the laboratory. Set-up and perform light maintenance of laboratory instrumentation such as GC, GC-MS, IR, NMR, and UV-VIS spectroscopy. Prepare laboratory schedules and participate in collaborative efforts to establish protocols that promote safety in the handling of hazardous chemicals. Participate in mentoring of part-time faculty. Assist in the growth and success of students through careful preparation of instructional materials, application of effective teaching methodologies, and timely communication of critical feedback on assignments and discussions.
Standard duties expected of all faculty include development and evaluation of curricula, maintaining scheduled office hours, attending department and division meetings, pursuing professional growth activities, service on district and/or college committees, developing goals and metrics for student learning outcomes, evaluating mastery of course content and laboratory performance, and performing other duties consistent with the role of an instructor. Instructors also have the opportunity to participate in campus extra-curricular activities.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Understanding of, sensitivity to, and respect for the diverse academic, socio-economic, ethnic, religious, and cultural backgrounds, disability, and sexual orientation of community college students, faculty and staff.
Master's degree in chemistry OR bachelor's degree in chemistry or biochemistry AND master's degree in biochemistry, chemical engineering, chemical physics, physics, molecular biology, or geochemistry OR the equivalent.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Demonstrated academic scholarship in the theoretical foundations of physical and organic chemistry.
Teaching experience in majors' organic chemistry lecture and laboratory courses.
Extensive experience working and/or teaching in the chemistry laboratory, including the following:
Hands-on experience with the maintenance and operation of instruments used in community college and research laboratories, specifically IR, GC, GC-MS, NMR, and UV-VIS spectroscopy.
Skill with common wet laboratory techniques.
Experience with and knowledge of current hazardous waste handling in a chemistry laboratory.
Experience maintaining a safe laboratory environment in compliance with safety rules and regulations.
Familiarity and facility in use of technology as a teaching aid in the classroom.
Demonstrated collaboration and leadership skills.

In addition, successful candidates will demonstrate:
Enthusiasm for chemistry.
The ability to engage students and to promote their self-reliance.
The ability to motivate and develop students' critical thinking.
Ability to communicate articulately and effectively with individuals of diverse age, gender, ethnicity, educational and economic backgrounds.
To apply for this position, submit all required application materials (listed below) to http://www.fhdajobs.net .

APPLICATION PACKET:
A District application to be completed at http://hr.fhda.edu/careers/
In the application you will provide information which demonstrates your understanding of, sensitivity to and respect for the diverse academic, socioeconomic, ethnic, religious, cultural backgrounds, disability and sexual orientation of community college students, faculty and staff. You will be asked to explain how your life experiences, studies, or work have influenced your commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion.
A cover letter, not to exceed two pages, detailing: 1) your qualifications, skills and abilities as they relate to the preferred qualifications and 2) any additional qualifications you feel the committee should consider.
A current resume of all work experience, formal education and training.
A list of all relevant chemistry courses you have completed along with a brief course description. Applicants invited to interview will be requested to submit transcripts verifying all chemistry courses taken and completed.
NOTE: Official Transcripts verifying qualifications will be REQUIRED prior to an offer of employment. Applicants who have international transcripts must obtain transcripts that are evaluated by an independent educational-equivalency evaluation company and obtain an English translation (if necessary). These services are to be done at the applicant's expense. Both Foothill De Anza CCD employees and external candidates must submit transcripts.
If any required application materials are omitted, the committee will not review your application materials.
Application materials not required (including reference letters) for this position will not be accepted.
HIRING RANGE: $57,066.00 - $93,722.00 annually* plus benefits; actual placement is based on applicant's verified education and experience*.
For the complete Faculty Salary Schedule, go to: http://hr.fhda.edu/_downloads/All%20Faculty%20Schedules_16-17.pdf
Excellent benefits package that includes medical coverage for employee and eligible dependents, dental, vision care, employee assistance program, long-term disability, retirement benefits and basic life insurance. Faculty are also eligible for paid sabbatical leaves and stipends for educational and professional development.
For information on our benefits package that includes medical for employees and dependents, visit our web site: http://hr.fhda.edu/benefits
WORKING CONDITIONS
Skill in routine safe handling of hazardous chemicals and chemical waste.
Endurance within a classroom setting, teaching students while standing, sitting, or walking throughout the classroom.
Use of aids such as whiteboards, posters, bulletin boards, overhead projector, computers, and other technology.
Retrieval, use, storage, and light lifting of teaching material, including books, equipment, assignments, etc.
Vision sufficient to read various materials and to monitor student safety in the laboratory
Hearing and speaking to exchange information in person.
Adaptive to differing learning styles and responsive to behaviors (i.e. monitoring, evaluating, and managing both appropriate and inappropriate student behaviors.)
Address stressful events, created by hostile students by (a) maintaining emotional control, (b) listening without judgment or retaliation, (c) reasoning objectively and consistently, (d) keeping at the forefront the best interests of the student, and (e) maintaining professionalism and due process.
TERMS OF EMPLOYMENT: Full-time, Tenure-track position; 10 months per year.
STARTING DATE: Fall 2017
Persons with disabilities who require reasonable accommodation to complete the employment process must notify Employment Services no later than the closing date of the announcement.
The successful applicant will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the U.S.

The Foothill-De Anza Community College District does not reimburse applicants for travel, lodging or any other costs incurred by applicant to attend interviews. All interviewing costs incurred will be the responsibility of the applicant.

description:
Seeo is seeking a Process Engineer who has accomplished skills in the development of mixing and coating processes for Li ion cells. The position will be responsible for developing, optimizing and validating economical processes to make Seeo-unique Li batteries. The position will be responsible for preparing and maintaining all process documentation such as Process Flow Diagram, SWI, etc.

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Monitoring, improving, and troubleshooting existing processes and equipment to make a product according to the product specification;
  • Designing, installing and running new equipment and implementing the new processes;
  • Making observations and taking measurements directly, as well as collecting, interpreting data and preparing the reports;
  • Assisting in the preparation of feasibility-level capital and operating costs for the processes;
  • Assessing the safety and environmental impact of the equipment;
  • Ensuring that all aspects of an operation or processes meet specified regulations;
  • Preparing and maintaining the process documentation, such as process flow diagram, PFMEA, Standard Work Instruction, etc.;
This position will require:
  • Technical Degree – BS or Masters in Chemical engineering, Chemistry or similar field.
  • 3+ years of experience on mixing / coating processes
  • Commitment to developing and supporting a cohesive team as well as an effective and healthy work environment
  • Commitment to honesty, excellence, and continuous improvement
Desired Skills & Experience
  • Hands-on Engineer with stamina, able to thrive in a fast-paced, multi-tasking environment
  • Structured problem-solving and analytical skills. e.g., design of experiment (DOE),
  • Attention to detail and quality, as well as excellent work discipline
  • Self-starter – ability to work independently
  • Strong interpersonal skills – a team player
Work Environment

Employee will be working a large part of the day in a dry room or laboratory. While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly exposed to moving mechanical parts, fumes or airborne particles, toxic and/or caustic chemicals, high voltage, and vibration. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Seeo provides engineering controls and PPE to mitigate these risks.

description:
The R&D; Lab Technician Intern will join the Honest lab to support overall lab maintenance and batching, and will establish and implement a methodology for initiating batches, tracking samples, and processing stability.

The Honest Internship Program takes place at our headquarters in Playa Vista. The program will run for 10 weeks from the beginning of June to mid-August, and is a paid, full-time, 40 hours/week program. Interns must be available for the full duration of the internship.

The application deadline for our R&D; Lab Technician Internship is March 15, 2017. Our team reviews applications on a rolling basis, so it’s in your best interest to apply as soon as possible. We look forward to speaking with you!

What you’ll do:
  • Execute laboratory batches in accordance with procedures established by supervising chemists
  • Catalogue samples and maintain accurate records indicating batch process, experimental outcomes, and stability readings
You’ll love this internship if you’re:
  • Passionate about R&D.; You have a scientific background and a strong interest in product development!
  • Adaptable and ambitious. You will enthusiastically take on other assignments as needed to support your team!
What you’ll need:
  • Must be currently enrolled in, or ar recent graduate of, an undergraduate program in chemistry, biology, chemical engineering, or other relevant scientific field
  • Strong laboratory skills and familiarity with experimental design
Bonus points for:
  • Familiarity with the cosmetic industry, chemical nomenclature, and prior experience in a formulating lab

• With minimal supervision, exercise technical discretion in the design, execution and interpretation of experiments that contribute to the advancement of development programs.

description:
Ripple is looking for an Associate Scientist to create sustainable food formulations and design processes for full scale food manufacturing.

QUALIFICATIONS

This position requires a candidate with experience working in both a research lab and a pilot plant or manufacturing enviroment. The candidate will have great scientific and personal skills, including:

Bachelors or Masters degree in chemical engineering, food process engineering, food science or a related field

Good laboratory practices including organized data documentation and presentation, attention to detail and ability to follow batch protocols

Ability to apply engineering principles to design robust processes for full scale food manufacturing of new products

Innate curiosity for understanding complex food systems from a physical and chemical perspective

Drive to present your work to a diverse team of scientists, engineers and business partners

Ability to conduct bench work independently

Proven teamwork and collaboration in small groups

Bonus points if you have experience with:
Food emulsions

Sensory science

Fermentation

Finally, you need to be ready to roll-up your sleeves and help get things done at a small, early-stage startup company.

AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY

The Associate Scientist will be an integral member of the Product Development R&D; team. Specific tasks include:

Develop food formulations from bench to full scale manufacturing

Design robust processes for new products and support manufacturing trials

Present results regularly at R&D; meeting

Contribute to the Ripple culture

Play the role of janitor, receptionist, IT-person, printer-jam-clearer, and general pitcher-inner alongside everyone else at Ripple!
title: Associate Scientist

description:
Job Descriptions:
We are seeking a Senior Process Engineer to join the laser process engineering team in our Fremont fab. Successful candidates will have a strong understanding of compound semiconductor wafer processes and tools, be self-motivated, hands-on, and resourceful problem-solvers with the capacity to quickly grasp and resolve a wide range of technical issues.
You will design, develop, integrate, and refine various aspects of the diode laser process that may include thin film deposition, dry and wet etch, wafer thinning and dicing and optical coating. You will work within the SoraaLaser Process Engineering team and in cooperation with the Manufacturing team to transition newly developed processes into production:
  • Design and develop improved and robust processes within the integrated laser process flow.
  • Specify, procure and bring up new wafer fab capital equipment.
  • Tool and process owner for key processes in the fab flow.
  • Transition processes into qualified product with the SoraaLaser Process Engineering and Manufacturing team.
  • Continuously improve metrology and SPC for fabrication of semiconductor laser products.
  • Work with the laser R&D; team to develop creative processes to enable advances in the teamsâ fundamental understanding of the novel material system.
  • Support the laser R&D; team by facilitating rapid turn short-loop feedback cycles.
  • Hands-on process implementation and tool optimization - significant time on the fab floor.
Required Experience:
Experience:Required:
  • MS or PhD in Materials Science, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Applied Physics, Mechanical Engineering or other relevant Physical Science
  • 3+ years experience in the semiconductor industry
  • Experience with several of the following processes and tools: metal liftoff, dry and wet etch, dielectric deposition, contact metal deposition, cleaving, singulation, lap and polish and optical coatings.
  • Ability to work with minimal guidance
  • Strong data analysis ability and experience with SPC
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Willing to work outside the scope of normal job duties and past experience
Preferred:
  • 7+ years wafer fab process engineering experience in a high-volume semiconductor fab
  • III-V compound semiconductor process experience
  • Optoelectronic device experience, specifically laser diodes
  • Experience qualifying new tools and technologies for production
  • Familiarity with Access and JMP

description:
Arcadis is searching for a Water/Wastewater Design Engineer with 5 to 10 years of experience, to join our Water Division team in one of our southern California offices, including: Los Angeles, Irvine, or San Diego. This is an exciting opportunity for a self-motivated design engineer to join our team locally. The Water/Wastewater Design Engineer will use their expertise and knowledge of water/wastewater/recycled water projects, design and construction engineering, and client service to successfully execute projects within the Southern California municipal water/wastewater market.

Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:
Provide technical expertise to our team of engineers in Southern California.

Design and construction support for water/wastewater treatment plants, storm water systems, distribution/collection systems, and pump/lift stations. Create construction documents and specifications.

Meet established budgets and delivery schedules for each assignment; for project/task scope, schedule and budget.

Work with clients to determine needs and provide solutions; may lead teams in various design tasks.

Coordinate execution of projects with other engineering disciplines and office personnel.

Develop design projects from inception to completion.

Prepare construction packages (including all deliverables) for the engineering, procurement, and construction of water/wastewater systems for clients.

Create cost estimates and project schedules.

Perform detailed engineering calculations and analysis, and use design software to solve complex challenges.

Interact with and oversee the work of CAD staff.

Use Arcadis standards and specifications for water/wastewater design and construction projects.

Perform other duties, as assigned.

Arcadis will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring

Bachelor's degree in Civil, Environmental, Mechanical, Chemical Engineering or related field of study.

5-10 years of experience in water/wastewater/recycled water facilities design and construction support.

Excellent technical engineering skills in the water/wastewater practice area.

Strong, clear and concise written and oral communication skills.

Excellent technical writing skills.

Experience preparing and reviewing project drawings, specifications, schedules and cost estimates.

Client relationship skills are a plus.

Functional experience with MS Office applications.

As a global top five player in water services, we focus on the entire water cycle – from source to tap and back again – while also managing rivers and coastal zones, urban and rural water, and issues related to climate change and rising sea levels. description:
Align Technology is the industry leader and innovator in medical devices which focuses on revolutionizing the digital dental and orthodontics’ practice. Align Technology is looking for a Materials Engineer for our San Jose, CA office. This exciting new role would be part of a culture that is helping to improve lives every day through digital dentistry.

The Materials Engineer candidate will have exceptional skills with different materials like polymers or ceramics . This role will be part of the Align Technology goal to deliver our clear aligners (Invisalign®) 3D scanners (iTero®) to our customer.

Job Description:

The Materials Engineer will be a key member of the R&D; Materials Engineering team. He/she will be responsible for planning and executing projects that focus on new product development, as well as improving Align's existing products. The ideal candidate will have a background in new material development especially in the area of thermoplastics, coating and adhesive, and/or thermoset materials.

Responsibilities:
  • Develop and guide new product development from "start" to "finish."
  • Visit outside manufacturing vendors (e.g., 3rd party vendors, etc.) to guide process development activities related to new product development, process improvements or new equipment evaluation.
  • Work cross-functionally with the following organizations: Manufacturing, Clinical Research, Marketing, Operations, Regulatory and Legal.
  • Design products based on the following materials: polymers, composites, plastics, ceramic, metals and adhesives.
  • Work independently at the laboratory bench to develop and evaluate new products or to adapt and improve existing ones.
  • Select, design and evaluate a variety of materials (e.g., thermoplastics, elastomers, composites, adhesives, etc.) to determine the best combination of materials for specific application.
  • Direct lab bench work for product development and physical property testing duties.
  • Must demonstrate ability to work safely in a team environment.
  • Interface with a variety of internal stakeholders, external suppliers, and technical collaborators to deliver technical solutions.
  • Support product development teams working toward the development of new products.
  • Prioritize and meet deadlines and construct project timetables.
  • Prepare written reports summarizing key findings.
  • Identify and implement effective courses of action.
  • Coach, motivate, and mentor Jr. engineer and lab technicians when needed.
  • Experience of physical-chemical processes and methods of materials characterization.
  • Familiarity with polymer characterization methods (mechanical testing, thermal analysis, rheology, spectroscopy and the underlying theory).
  • Must have the ability to apply results to product performance metrics.
  • Ability to work on several projects simultaneously as well as participate on cross functional teams.
  • Ability to work on projects that vary from routine to very complex.
  • Ability to deal tactfully with others. Must be a strong team player.
Requirements:
  • M.S, or Ph.D. degree or equivalent in Polymer Science or Materials Science or Chemical Engineering or related field.
  • 5+ years working experience in material research and development, depending on level of education.
Nice to Have:
  • Experience with medical device development life cycle and regulatory requirements
  • Photochemistry, Lasers or UV curing processes and resin materials development
Travel:

Up to 10% including international and US-based

title: Materials Engineer

description:
The semiconductor process integration engineer is responsible for development of compound semiconductor detectors at SBF's state-of-the-art detector and focal plane array manufacturing lines. Functions include both new process development and the transitioning of new technology to production. Data-driven yield analysis working side-by-side with process owners is also required. Areas of responsibility include: wafer fabrication, starting from incoming material characterization through photolithography, etching, deposition, and die singulation. Must have the ability to obtain a security clearance and therefore must be a U.S. Citizen.

Relocation: Relocation assistance is possible for this exciting position.
The Locale: Goleta is a city in southern Santa Barbara County, California. Goleta is part of the central coast region of California and offers lots of great scenery and is a great place to live and to raise a family. The region is known primarily for agriculture and tourism. Major crops include wine grapes, lettuce, strawberries, and artichokes. Goleta is near the University of California, Santa Barbara campus. Much of Goleta is considered to be a quiet suburban community while Santa Barbara tends to attract most of the tourists and the area's residents. Goleta is about 8 miles west of the city of Santa Barbara, along the coast (the coast runs east to west in this portion of southern California). Where can you drive to from Goleta? Goleta is 2 hours northwest of Los Angeles. San Francisco is about 5 hours to the north of Goleta. Las Vegas, NV is about 5 hours to the northeast.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelors degree. The position requires working knowledge of semiconductor device processing including photolithography, thin film deposition, wet etching, and dry etching. General understanding of semiconductor device theory is required. Minimum 3 years experience in semiconductor processing, either in industry or a university environment. Must be proficient in MS Office (Word, Powerpoint, Excel), familiar with DOE analysis, and have excellent engineering documentation skills and communication skills. Must have the ability to obtain a security clearance and therefore must be a U.S. Citizen.

Desired skills
Masters degree in Materials Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or Physics. Experience with automated semiconductor processing equipment for processes such as: automated optical inspection, wet etching, dry etching, lift-off, thin film deposition, dicing, & electroplating. Beneficial to have SPC Knowledge. Experience with MATLAB and JMP or other data analysis software. Demonstrated ability to manage and lead teams on projects of moderate complexity. Ability to interface effectively from the technician level to senior management.

As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s team of 113,000 people works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Headquartered in Bethesda, Maryland, Lockheed Martin has employees based in all 50 states and more than 570 facilities that span 70 countries.

Join us at Lockheed Martin, where we’re engineering a better tomorrow.

Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

description:
Kite Pharma is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company focused on the development and commercialization of novel cancer immunotherapy products designed to harness the power of a patient’s own immune system to selectively target and kill cancer cells. Our core technology involves the genetic engineering of T cells, or white blood cells, to express either chimeric antigen receptors (CARs) or T cell receptors (TCRs) for the treatment of advanced solid and hematological malignancies. We are on a rapid growth trajectory and have a highly energized and accomplished team. Kite is publicly traded (NASDAQ: KITE) with a current market well over $2 Billion.

Kite is seeking a highly motivated individual with cell culture experience to work on innovative T cell therapy for cancer treatment. As the Sr. Engineer you will provide process development and engineering support for technology transfer, process validation and GMP manufacturing for Kite’s engineered autologous T cell therapy products. Primary responsibility will be to engage in technology transfer activities between Kite facilities, including in Asia. Additionally, you will draft and review protocols, production procedures, and provide technical assessment and approval for engineering and process changes as well as documentation pertaining to process development, qualification, and validation to meet regulatory requirements. You will work with the Product Sciences team to design and scale-out cell therapy processes, and support process validation, as well as draft documentation for regulatory filings to advance Kite’s product portfolio.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • Manage technology transfer and oversee GMP manufacturing operations
  • Act as technical expert to train and supervise process technicians
  • Write and review technical documentation (technology transfer protocols & reports, comparability protocols & reports, process validation reports, etc.)
  • Participate and report to a cross-functional development team to advance production activities
  • Develop manufacturing processes for cell therapy products and develop process improvements and efficiencies
  • Ensure successful manufacturing production runs by assessing risk, setting preventative measures in place, investigating, and troubleshooting equipment and process issues
  • Design and execute process development studies to develop a thorough understanding of operating and performance parameters
  • Other duties as assigned
Requirements:
  • Degree in Biochemical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Biotechnology or related discipline with at least 5 years of pharmaceutical manufacturing, technology transfer & process development experience required
  • Fluency with cGMP manufacturing and regulatory regulations and requirements for pharmaceuticals and devices
  • Working knowledge of scientific and engineering principles
  • Experience in statistical analysis using JMP or Minitab
  • Practical experience in GMP operations
  • Demonstrated knowledge of pharmaceutical manufacturing of biotechnology products, aseptic processing, cell therapy products, and process development
  • Ability to think critically, and demonstrated troubleshooting and problem solving skills
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to function efficiently and independently in a changing environment
  • Self-motivated and willing to accept temporary responsibilities outside of initial job description
  • Well-developed computer skills
  • Pharmaceutical products GMP manufacturing experience is a must
  • Cell culture or aseptic processing experience is a plus
  • Previous experience with cell therapy products is a plus
  • Equipment qualification experience in a cGMP environment (IQ, OQ, PQ) is preferred; process validation experience is a plus
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills are essential in this collaborative work environment
  • Comfortable in a fast-paced small company environment with minimal direction and able to adjust workload based upon changing priorities
  • Flexibility for international travel, including to Asia
Kite Pharma, an equal opportunity employer, is located in beautiful Santa Monica, CA just steps from Santa Monica Blvd and right off the 10. We are able to offer the opportunity to be part of the first 500 employees in this successful, fast growing company. A place everyone knows your name and respects your opinion while at the same time offering benefits and time off packages commensurate to any large corporation. Did we forget to mention the stock options? To learn more about us, please visit our website at www.kitepharma.com.

title: Senior Engineer, Process Engineering

description:
R&D; process development position for metallization for advanced technology nodes for logic and memory applications. Job requirement includes investigation of new metallization schemes, testing deposition chemistry, development or modification of process formulations, definition of processing or handling equipment requirements and specifications, and reviewing processing techniques and methods applied in the manufacture, fabrication, and evaluation of products. Involvement may begin at any step from concept and feasibility, customer beta/evaluation, productization, to full-scale manufacturing. Coordinates cross-functional design requirement review with appropriate scientific/engineering personnel to ensure manufacturability and compatibility of processing methods. Compiles and evaluates test data to determine appropriate limits and variables for process or material specifications. May conceive and plan projects involving definition and selection of new concepts, equipment automation technology, and approaches in the processing or development of new or improved processes.

Minimum of 5 years of related experience with BS degree in chemistry, chemical engineering, material science or physics; or 3 years with MS degree; or PhD without experience; or equivalent work experience.

description:
Job Description
Job Title : Staff Engineer, Manufacturing
Requisition ID : 25676BR

When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals

Responsibilities:
  • This position shall perform process engineering activities to ensure manufacturability of products in Thermo Fisher facilities. Position scope includes supporting new product introductions, continuous improvement efforts, and process sustaining/ troubleshooting for Manufacturing.
  • This position will have responsibilities for the evaluating existing processes and facility layouts and assist in generating the future strategy to maximize operating efficiency, sustainability, and growth.
  • Provide technical leadership on cross functional teams for high throughput oligonucleotide operations, business development and planning, and R&D; activities.
  • Lead equipment/process validation activities, process optimization, technology transfer, and new product scale-up.
  • Perform project management functions
  • Develop, implement, and qualify robust, high quality, and cost effective processes for manufacturing new and/or existing world class products in an ISO 13485 environment. Successfully troubleshoot equipment and process problems in Manufacturing.
  • Establish equipment requirements and specifications.
  • Interface with other functions and departments to solve problems and perform equipment/facility commissioning activities.
  • Generate process documentation such as process flow diagrams, P&IDs;, mass and energy balances, as well as supporting procedures, and software and equipment validation protocols.
  • Perform design and process risk assessments, such as FMEA.
  • Conduct design reviews.
  • May be required to perform other related duties as required and/or assigned
  • Exercise knowledge of Lean/Six Sigma principles in manufacturing.

Minimum Qualifications :
  • Requires a bachelor’s degree or higher in Chemical Engineering or related discipline.
  • Requires a minimum of eight years of relevant experience in successfully performing process engineering activities.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Must have manufacturing experience, with strong understanding of ISO and cGMP quality requirements.
  • Excellent project management and interpersonal skills are required, providing the ability to inspire, motivate, and collaborate with others.
  • Excellent organizational skills, including the ability to efficiently evaluate, prioritize and handle multiple and changing projects and priorities.
  • Six Sigma Certification
  • Works in an office environment, with periods in the manufacturing plant and/or laboratory
  • Frequent traveling required for support of other manufacturing sites.
  • Must be able to work safely with hazardous materials and chemicals.

At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 50,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Apply today http://jobs.thermofisher.com

title: Assistant Engineer (Environmental) (Environmental Engineering)

description:
Zymergen is hiring a Scientist to work on analytical chemistry tech transfers with partner companies for a wide variety of compounds produced through bench-scale and microtiter plate-based fermentation processes. The incumbent will develop new assays as well as identify and implement assays described in the literature to support these fermentation processes. These assay development projects include working alongside equipment providers to build out the facilities to run the assays in high throughput (HTP).

An ideal candidate for this position will handle the following responsibilities:

Assay Development

  • Develop HTP assays to measure titer of a variety of target molecules including new bio-derived compounds generated through plate-based fermentation
  • Provide theoretical and practical expertise in HPLC, GC, and spectroscopic (absorbance, fluorescence, FTIR, Raman, etc.) methods to develop improved HTP assays for target compounds
  • Make use of enzyme-coupled assay expertise to develop HTP methods for measuring titer of target molecules
  • Test new analytical techniques to be used in the context of high throughput screening
Assay Operationalization

  • Convert and further improve protocols from partner companies to protocols for operations within highly automated workflows
  • Work with automation and fermentation teams to ready assays for the operations team
  • Improve existing detection techniques to increase the quality of data acquired and to decrease the associated costs and timelines
  • Perform ongoing monitoring and support for analytical work in operations
Equipment, Data and Team Management

  • Purchase and maintain separations and detection equipment
  • Upgrade systems through third party vendors and by adding peripheral components, and improve systems through custom upgrades and custom workflows
  • Maintain relationships with vendors, repair support staff, and consumables and parts providers
  • Interact with software engineers for the capture, storage, and processing of measurement and process data
Qualifications/Experience

  • PhD and 1-2+ years working in a relevant field (biochemistry, chemistry, chemical engineering, or related).
  • Track record of both excellence in operations and creativity in assay development
  • Familiarity with the tools of statistical process control, including use of control charts and software such as JMP.
Based in the San Francisco Bay Area, Zymergen is a technology-driven company applying radical new methods to design and improve microbes by rewriting their DNA. This capability allows us to generate novel chemicals, advanced materials, and pharmaceuticals far faster and at lower costs than competing technology. Our approach combines biology, robotic automation, and proprietary computational and analytic methods to industrialize what is otherwise a slow, risky process.
title: Scientist, Analytical Chemistry

description:
Job Description

A Personal Care Products Manufacturer is currently seeking a Quality Control (QC) Chemist to work in the Fullerton/Anaheim area. The QC Chemist performs daily analytical functions within the Quality Department including but not limited to raw material control, product evaluation, analytical assays, validation implementation and analysis, microbial analysis and special projects as assigned by manager. Contributes to improvements in the Q.A. Laboratory through participation in continuous improvement process. Ideal position for a recent graduate.

Job duties for this position include, but are not limited to the following:

  • Perform routine evaluation, analysis, and release of raw materials, in-process bulk product, and finished goods with minimal supervision via instrumental and wet chemical analyses.
  • Perform laboratory batch adjustments for nonconforming in-process bulk product, including batch calculation and documentation from Lab Batch to Production scale.
  • Responsible for documentation control related to evaluation, analysis, and release of raw materials, bulk product, and finished goods.
  • Responsible for formula change control including submission to Document Control to change Master Formula when needed.
  • Coordinate and maintain internal control of standards, retains, samples, and documentation as required.
  • Responsible for daily sampling and analysis of DI Water.
  • Perform, coordinate, and oversee sampling, analysis, and documentation for process and equipment validation.
  • Conduct routine microbiology control programs within plant environment.
  • Review and interpret analytical and microbiological test results; follow through with non-conforming results.
  • Implement and/or coordinate vendor validation program per standard operating procedures.
  • Assist in the development and implementation of protocols for validation systems.
  • Maintain and troubleshoot analytical laboratory equipment and instrumentation.
  • Maintain calibration program for all laboratory equipment.
  • Recommend, plan, and coordinate control programs in the laboratory.
  • Responsible for creating new raw material specifications based on internal, customer, or formulary specifications.
  • Assist with research and resolution of customer complaints where applicable.
  • Responsible for preparing samples and documentation submissions to customers and outside test laboratories.
  • Communicate with suppliers and/or contractors on evaluation issues concerning raw materials, customer supplied bulk product, and instrument maintenance.
  • Participates in internal cGMP and regulatory compliance audits as necessary.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

Bachelors of Science (BS) in chemistry, microbiology, chemical engineering or related field from a four-year college or university. Minimum of five years laboratory experience in a quality capacity or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Quality Control: 1 year
  • laboratory: 5 years
title: Quality Control Chemist

description:
Hazardous Materials Inspector I positions perform increasingly responsible professional hazardous materials management work; conduct inspections of City facilities, property and work sites which have hazardous materials or waste management activities; perform inspections at the Miramar Landfill to divert unacceptable waste; identify existing or potential hazardous materials, waste or other environmental contaminants; determine and perform appropriate waste sampling protocols; diagram field sites; draft permits; conduct hazardous material training classes; test, identify, categorize, manifest and package waste received through household hazardous waste or load check programs; and perform other duties as assigned.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

You must meet the following requirements on the date you apply, unless otherwise indicated.

EDUCATION : A Bachelor's Degree in Chemistry, Industrial Hygiene, Chemical Engineering, Environmental Engineering, or a closely related degree. Individuals applying with a closely related degree MUST have completed at least 18 semester/27 quarter units of college-level chemistry course work which MUST include lecture and laboratory classes in both organic and inorganic chemistry.

NOTE:
  • Additional qualifying experience may be substituted for education lacked on a year-for-year basis. One year of full-time experience = 30 semester/45 quarter college-level units.
EXPERIENCE : One year of full-time experience in ONE of the following areas:
  • Investigative/inspection experience including inspecting and investigating hazardous materials and waste management practices for conformance with laws and regulations. Job experience should include hazardous waste sampling, storage, testing, packaging, and manifesting of hazardous waste; knowledge of regulations contained in CCR Title 22, 40 CFR, 49 CFR, and Health and Safety Code Division 20, Chapter 6.5; site inspections and report preparation; and/or conducting hazardous material training activities.
  • Management of household hazardous waste experience including coordinating and managing community collection events or permanent centers; testing materials collected through a household hazardous waste or load check program; identifying, confirming, and categorizing chemical waste, and packaging and manifesting waste materials received; and knowledge of regulations contained in CCR Title 22, 40 CFR, 49 CFR, and Health and Safety Code Division 20, Chapter 6.5.
  • Environmental control experience including storm water, pesticide site assessment and/or air pollution control management with job duties including inspection and sampling, reporting, process design, knowledge of regulations, training, and program implementation.
    • LICENSE : A valid California Class C Driver License is required at the time of hire.

    HIGHLY DESIRABLE :
    • Registered Environmental Health Specialist.
    • HAZWOPER Certification.
    • DOT HM-181 Certification.
    • Extensive experience creating/working with complicated and interlinked Excel spreadsheets.
    REQUIRED DOCUMENTS (MUST SUBMIT WITH APPLICATION):
    • Proof of degree/transcripts, if utilized to meet the minimum requirements.
    • Proof of degree/transcripts showing completion of the required course work, if utilized to meet the minimum requirements.

If you are unable to attach at the time of application submittal, you must submit them as soon as possible via fax: (619) 533-3337; or to the Employment Information Center: City of San Diego Personnel Department, 1200 Third Avenue - Suite 300, San Diego, CA 92101. Include your name and the title of the position for which you are applying.

    SCREENING PROCESS:

    Please ensure all information is complete and accurate as the responses you provide on the supplemental questions will be reviewed using an automated evaluation system. If you are successful in this initial screening process, your application will be reviewed for applicable education, experience, and/or training to ensure all minimum requirements have been met. Successful candidates will be placed on a list which will be used to fill position vacancies during the next six months (180 days). For each vacancy, only those candidates with the most appropriate qualifications will be contacted by the hiring department for an interview.

    SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION:

    PRE-EMPLOYMENT REQUIREMENTS : Employment offers are conditional pending the results of all screening processes that are applicable to this job, which may include but are not limited to the following: Confirmation of citizenship/legal right to work in the United States; completion of a pre-employment medical review/exam (which may include drug/alcohol testing); reference checks; and a fingerprint check. The fingerprints will be submitted to the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the California Department of Justice for a conviction record report. Certain positions may require additional screening processes which may include a polygraph examination and/or background investigation. All of these processes must be successfully completed before employment begins. A positive test for alcohol, illegal drugs, including marijuana, or inadequately explained prescription drugs, misrepresentation, falsification, or omission of pertinent facts in any step of the screening/selection process may be cause for disqualification and/or termination of employment. Nothing in this job posting constitutes an expressed or implied contract for employment with the City of San Diego. Applicants must notify the Personnel Department of any changes in their name, address (home, email), or phone number or they may miss employment opportunities.

title: Staff Engineer, Process Engineering Job

description:
Production engineers monitor, evaluate, and lead the improvement of OEE of assigned lines and/or improve assigned processes. Responsible for the actual equipment operation related to production of a product on both glass lines and bag-in-box lines, or other assigned processes. Responsible for ensuring that production demands are met by identifying and resolving any equipment or process issue that contributes to equipment downtime or inefficiency. Production Engineer will make sure that the manufacturing line is able to meet its demands and deadlines presented by operations. Safety, quality, efficiency (OEE), and cost effectiveness are key metrics by which job performance is measured. Production engineers must work with Technical Operations leadership to identify and execute lean concept of profitable manufacturing which are rooted in the 5M’s of Efficiency: Manpower, Methods, Machines, Materials, and Money. Leading effective line change-overs and start-ups are examples of common tasks, success should be measured with change-over times and first hour efficiencies. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, trouble-shooting skills, and an aptitude for working with production equipment, hardware and software are all must have’s. Hours typical of a production engineer can vary as facility operates a 3-shift, 5 day production schedule.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
  • Provide training and Mentor peers, Maintenance Techs, Tech Ops, and others to improve knowledge, skills, and abilities to drive performance improvements.
  • Evaluate manufacturing systems, equipment, components, and have the ability to systematically troubleshoot to determine root cause.
  • Develop specific manufacturing system knowledge across multiple bottling lines by studying facility, manufacturing and process equipment requirements.
  • Will train and guide Technical Operators during equipment operation, maintenance or repair issues including in-depth troubleshooting methodology. Will function as Quality Control for repairs prior to resuming line operation.
  • Evaluate and improve PM processes and systems to increase equipment reliability.
  • Spent up to 70-80% of time on manufacturing floor.
QUALIFICATIONS
  • Must be a self-starter with an innate curiosity toward mechanical process, automation, and controls with an ability to identify opportunities for process improvement.
  • Must have Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical, Industrial, Manufacturing or Chemical Engineering, mechanical aptitude is a must.
  • Ideal candidate should have at least two to five years of relevant work experience in a production setting.
  • Must be self-directed and able to determine priorities in a fast paced environment.
  • Knowledge of AutoCAD, SolidWorks, and MSOffice.
  • Must be able to read technical drawings, specifications of electrical systems to ensure that installation and operations conform to standards. Assist in capital project execution for new equipment and major repairs.
  • Must have excellent communication skills in written/​verbal English.
  • Support and model all company procedures and policies.
  • Embrace and demonstrate The Wine Group’s Values: Long-Term Sustainable Value Creation, Relentlessly Entrepreneurial, Empowered People, and Responsible & Trustworthy.

description:
Hazardous Material/Pretreatment Trainee is the entry-level classification for the Hazardous Materials Inspector and Wastewater Pretreatment Inspector Series.

Hazardous Materials Inspector positions monitor and manage environmental areas/issues such as hazardous materials, storm water, household hazardous waste, underground tanks and hazardous waste haulers and processing facilities; conduct or oversee site assessment and mitigation activities; perform internal inspections at City-operated facilities and work sites; attend, facilitate and document facility inspections performed by outside regulatory agencies; identify non-compliance issues and prepare/execute a plan for compliance; determine appropriate waste sampling protocols; diagram sites; prepare permits, plans or other related documents; conduct training classes; test, identify, categorize, manifest and package waste; work at household hazardous waste collection events and facilities; perform inspections at the Miramar Landfill to divert unacceptable wastes from landfill; investigate illegal disposal of hazardous waste and conduct appropriate enforcement actions, including issuing notices of violation to landfill customers; manage vendor and service contracts; and perform other duties as assigned.

Wastewater Pretreatment Inspector positions inspect, classify and evaluate industrial and commercial processes, wastewater pretreatment systems and source control methods to determine compliance with federal, state and local sewer discharge standards; determine appropriate waste management protocols; diagram field sites; write inspection reports, develop fact sheets and process wastewater and treatment flow diagrams; draft discharge permits, Notices of Violation, Compliance Orders and Penalty Orders; serve as a witness; research and interpret environmental regulations; provide outreach and education to regulated industries; perform water use audits; determine facility-specific industrial and commercial sewer billing rates; and perform other duties as assigned.

NOTES:
  • The Hazardous Material/Pretreatment Trainee eligible list will be used to fill future vacancies in the Hazardous Materials Inspector and the Wastewater Pretreatment Inspector series. After gaining the requisite experience, Hazardous Material/Pretreatment Trainee employees may be eligible for career advancement to higher-level classifications.
  • Hazardous Material/Pretreatment Trainee employees perform increasingly responsible professional industrial waste inspection and/or hazardous materials management activities to verify and ensure compliance with local, state and federal laws and regulations in their respective areas of responsibility. Duties may include any or all as noted above.
  • Hazardous Material/Pretreatment Trainee employees may be required to maneuver above, under and around equipment during inspections; safely move across wet or uneven surfaces; ascend/descend ladders, stairs, elevated catwalks; and lift items weighing up to 50 pounds.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

You must meet the following requirements on the date you apply, unless otherwise indicated.

EDUCATION : Bachelor's Degree in Chemistry, Industrial Hygiene, Chemical Engineering, Environmental Engineering, Biology, or a closely related degree. Individuals applying with a closely related degree MUST have completed at least 18 semester/27 quarter units of college-level chemistry course work that MUST include lecture and laboratory classes in both organic and general chemistry.

NOTES:
  • Additional qualifying professional experience may be substituted for education lacked on a year-for-year basis. One year of full-time experience = 30 semester/45 quarter college-level units.
  • Qualifying professional experience includes hazardous materials inspection, industrial waste inspection, or storm water inspection.
LICENSE : A valid California Class C Driver License is required at the time of hire.

HIGHLY DESIRABLE :
  • Experience writing technical reports, making presentations, and using personal computers, spreadsheets and word processing software.
  • Certification as a California UST System Operator and/or possession of a valid 40-hour Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response (HAZWOPER) certification.
REQUIRED DOCUMENTS (MUST SUBMIT WITH APPLICATION) :
  • Proof of degree/transcripts, if utilized to meet the minimum requirements.
  • Proof of transcripts showing completion of the required course work, if utilized to meet the minimum requirements.
Required documents should be attached electronically to your application. If you are unable to attach at the time of application submittal, you must submit them as soon as possible via fax: (619) 533-3337; or to the Employment Information Center: City of San Diego Personnel Department, 1200 Third Avenue - Suite 300, San Diego, CA 92101.
