description:
SUMMARY

The Analytics Engineer is responsible for developing software and hardware applications that enhance the evaluation of performance of EUV source products. Typical responsibilities include creating software tooling that automates an analysis concept for use by a broader population. The Analytics Engineer will also perform root-cause analyses of system level performance issues, identifying areas of performance and technical improvement required to meet the source performance roadmap. Provide technical feedback to design teams, and supporting the teams at customer sites to ensure the highest performance and availability of EUV sources for the customers. The role requires a willingness to develop a hands-on mastery of complex experimentation of significant technical depth to deepen understanding of EUV generation, and the discipline to systematically drive the performance of present and future EUV source products. Candidates are expected to possess strong numerical analysis skills such as Matlab and Python processing large data set, and lab skills such as familiarities with optical and electrical metrology instruments. In addition, in order to be effective in the role, candidates must possess interpersonal skills needed to cross functional boundaries and build constructive and effective relationships throughout the whole organization.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Develop analytic software applications for use by the Development and Engineering community, typically in Matlab.

Ability to translate the design and test requirements into comprehensive analytic tools, test plan documents, and procedures.

Ability to reduce large amounts of data into a concise summary, and make a high quality presentation.

Hands on evaluation of complex hardware and software prototype designs being developed using sophisticated experimental protocols to validate, maximize, document and communicate the performance of EUV source products.

Serve as an expert in System Level performance of key sub-systems related to laser light generation, amplification, and controls. Be willing to apply theoretical models, concepts, methods, and novel experimental techniques to quantitatively interpret performance of EUV source systems across a wide range of issues and multiple technical disciplines.

Works closely with and lead cross-functional groups (systems engineering, development engineering, scientists, global customer support personnel, manufacturing personnel, senior management, marketing, external customers) to set clear technical direction.

Work with global customer support organization in response to escalations from customer sites, by providing technical support; including remote and on-site troubleshooting and data analysis, developing action plans, and performing system recovery actions.

Prepare and/or review system and sub-system functional test plans and create traceability from system functional requirements.

Utilize test data to assess performance capabilities and assist in the documentation of procedures and the validation of system, operations and service.

Use company technical documentation, provide feedback for improvement and assist in creating technical documents.

Provide feedback to the design engineers on performance, serviceability, and reliability improvements.

Produce clear, concise documentation in defined ASML formats.

Use sophisticated computer programs and diagnostic equipment to test and characterize source performance.

Collect and analyze data, summarize results, and prepare presentation of results for review.

Travel as required for the purposes of performing troubleshooting and system performance recovery.

Interact with cross-functional groups (engineers and scientists, worldwide customer support personnel, manufacturing personnel, upper management, marketing, external customers).

Provide technical training to engineers in the factory and at customer sites.

Complete service, expense reports, and other administrative responsibilities in accordance with ASML’s procedures.

Responsible for safe operation in factory and customer sites.

Perform other duties as assigned.

Understanding of the concept of large complex system integration and practices.

Understanding of the concept of optics and lasers

Understanding of the concept of plasma generation.

Understanding of the concept of system controls.

Proficient in use of data analysis tools such as Matlab and/or Python.

Excellent analytical skills and trouble shooting skills.

Ability to setup and use the test and analytical equipment commonly used for the optics, laser and plasma research.

Ability to translate the knowledge and hand-on experiences into technical instructions and procedures.

Ability to define and execute tasks based on project descriptions with minimum or no supervision.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Excellent inter-personal skills, with an understanding of customer relationship building in highly multi-cultural environment.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

MS in Electrical Engineering, Engineering Physics, Applied Physics, Chemical Engineering, Material Science or other Physical Science. A M.S. in above disciplines is preferred.

Knowledge and experiences in optics, laser-induced plasma, optical metrology, and/or controls of such

Experiences in semiconductor equipment development a plus.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT

The employee may occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.

Will require travel dependent on business needs.

Travel to overseas and domestic customer sites for > 30 % of time may be required.

May be required to climb or balance.

Work schedule may vary and include evenings and weekends as well as long hours based on business needs.

May be assigned an “on call” type work schedule and may be required to respond to customers with little or no advance notice.

description:

Your strong writing skills combined with your understanding of chemistry will allow you to develop value-based messages & unique comparative benefits for new and existing products. Using your business-minded approach, you will contribute to overall sales growth by enhancing product information to the market via digital and print marketing materials.

Regular tasks include:

  • Support and participate in scientific conferences

title: Technical Marketing Specialist

description:
As a Metrology Scientist, you will provide technical leadership in new product introduction and production process development, improvement and sustaining efforts in a high volume biotech manufacturing environment. You will work with R&D;, Quality, Manufacturing and other engineering groups to develop and implement test methods and metrology for new and existing products.

All About You

Responsibilities:
• Identify, select, develop, qualify, implement, and validate test methods and/or measurement systems for use in consumables manufacturing.
• Construct and execute controlled experiments (including DOE's and gauge R&R; studies) to optimize test methods/equipment, and resolve quality issues.
• Analyze test results, issue reports and make technical recommendations.
• Work cross functionally with R&D;, Manufacturing and Quality to develop metrology processes for new products and improve processes of existing products.
• Provide technical leadership to ensure optimal performance of production test methods and equipment.
• Define technical requirements and write procedures for inspection processes.
• Support development and transfer new processes/products to production and enhance their robustness.
• Drive implementation of solutions in a production environment to meet production goals.

Education & Experience Requirements:
• B.S. & 5+ yrs experience/M.S. & 3+ yrs experience/Ph.D. in: Materials Science or Physical Chemistry, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Biochemical/Biomedical/Biotechnical Engineering, Bioengineering
• Experience with developing analytical methods and tests for surface/materials characterization
• Experience with chromatographic, rheometric, and chemical material characterization techniques
• Strong background in surface characterization using complex measurement systems such as SEM, XPS, TOF-SIMS, AFM, tensiometry, FTIR, Raman spectroscopy, fluorescence/optical microscopy, profilometry, and vision systems
• Work experience in the biotech, pharmaceutical or semiconductor industries is desirable
• High level problem solving and reasoning skills required.

• High-level experience with complex statistical analyses, Statistical Process Control and DOE techniques required.
• High level computer and analysis software platform(s) experience/skills are required. Intermediate level programming knowledge is strongly desired. Software communication and application programming interface/wrapper knowledge strongly desired. Experience with turnkey solutions, integration, and custom applications desired.
• Experience with large volume manufacturing in a high tech consumables industry is required.
• Experience with product development processes and project management is a plus.
• Experience with physical and chemical processes, microfluidics, and complex assemblies a plus
• Good interdepartmental communication skills and documentation skills are required.
• Demonstrated ability to prioritize and accomplish goals while working across departments is essential.

Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.

title: Process Engineering Intern (Intern)

description:
The person is responsible to provide high level applications support of complex measurement systems used in manufacture semiconductor devices/integrated circuits. The Engineer will work in Nanometricsâ HQ in Milpitas, CA and support customers worldwide. Travel to domestic and international customer sites is required.
The selected applicant will have the opportunity to work closely with process engineers in Semiconductor Fab to provide Metrology solutions for complex multi-layer thin film measurements and Optical Critical Dimension measurements for most advanced technology nodes. Duties will include characterization of cutting edge measurement technologies, technical paper publications, making technology / product presentations and technical training for customers.
Ph.D. in Materials Science, Physics, Chemistry, Electrical or Chemical Engineering
  • Experience with statistics/data analysis/fitting concept software
  • Ability to systemically troubleshoot problems to root cause and identify and thoroughly test solutions
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Possess good interpersonal skills and willing to work in a team environment.
  • Excellent Project and Time management skills.
  • Ph.D Materials Science/Elect Eng/Applied Physics/Chemical Eng
  • Ability to travel up to 50% of the time
  • The Applications Scientist is the primary technical contact for Nanometrics customers and provides technical support and application development for customers as well as working with the Nanometrics engineering team in product development.
  • The position involves working with customers and customer samples to develop novel metrology strategies on our UniFire interferometer platform for the customersâ leading edge process technologies.
  • The selected applicant will have the opportunity to work closely with Process Engineers in semiconductor and data storage fabs to develop innovative metrology solutions for complex materials and structures.
  • There will be approximately 25% travel required, both domestic and international.
  • The successful applicant will have strong technical skills, and be self-motivated and energetic.
  • Establish and maintain a strong technical knowledge of Nanometrics UniFire products and their applications.
  • Support customers in adopting Nanometrics UniFire products through effective demonstration and recipe development in customer facilities.
  • Work with internal Nanometrics experts to troubleshoot and resolve any and all field product performance issues where feasible.
  • Develop and maintain an in-depth understanding of customer application requirements for the UniFire product line.
  • Provide technical support to customers, develop and maintain a positive relationship with customers.
  • Support customer sustaining engineering activities, including qualification requirements.
  • Assist and consult with customers on creating and optimizing applications.
  • Coordinate with Engineering and Marketing on customer requirements and product development.
  • Help to maintain and increase product usage, and supports sales efforts through technical presentations and demonstrations.
  • Initiate, develop, and test new metrology applications.
  • Other duties as required.
  • Good data analysis, signal processing, and some programming skills. Knowledge of ellipsometry, optics, optical properties of materials, and/or thin films preferred. Experience developing mathematical models a plus. Ability to write technical publications and make technology/product presentations. Good organization and solid communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Ph.D. or equivalent in Physics, Materials Science, Engineering, or a related field.
title: Application Scientist

description:
Amgen’s 10 – 12 week internship program offers meaningful project experiences that impact patient’s lives. This internship provides the opportunity for executive and social networking events and to participate in community volunteer projects while providing a competitive compensation.

Relocation in the form of a transportation allowance will be provided for eligible candidates.

A major focus of the Bioassay Technology group is the differentiation of induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) to various cell types that can then be implemented as sources of human cells to drive drug discovery efforts. Our group is currently focused on methods to stimulate maturation of iPSC-derived cardiomyocytes. A successful intern will assist in executing experiments to promote cardiomyocyte maturation; he/she will also be responsible for learning and running various assays to characterize cardiomyocyte maturation and function.

Basic Qualifications
Amgen requires that all individuals applying for a grad internship or a co-op assignment at Amgen must meet the following criteria:

18 years or older

Graduated with a Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university with a 3.0 minimum GPA or equivalent

Completion as a first year graduate student before internship starts and currently enrolled in a MBA program for a MBA internship OR a Master’s program for a Masters internship OR a PharmD program for a PharmD internship OR PhD for a PhD internship from an accredited college or university

Enrolled in an accredited college or university following the potential internship or co-op assignment

Must not be employed at the time the internship starts

Preferred Qualifications
Currently enrolled in a graduate-level program in Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Biology, Immunology/Microbiology, Life Sciences, Biomedical/Biochemical/Chemical Engineering, or related discipline
Strong knowledge of cell biology; familiarity with iPSC and/or cardiomyocyte biology preferred
Experience in mammalian tissue culture and cellular imaging techniques
Computer programming skills
High attention to detail; ability to comply with written experimental procedures
Strong written and oral communication skills in English
Excellent organizational skills
Functions effectively within a team

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Only candidates who apply via http://careers.amgen.com/ will be considered. Please search for Keyword 34096.

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Amgen will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
title: Grad Intern - R&D (Genome Analysis Unit, Bioassay Technology Group)

description:
Eichleay, Inc. provides engineering services in both industrial and biotech facilities. Eichleay provides full service design, engineering, consulting, project management, procurement, system integration, and construction management services . Currently we are seeking a Process Engineer with petrochemical experience to join our team. This position will be located at our client site in Benicia, CA.

The Process Engineer is responsible for working closely with engineering staff and our clients to successfully achieve project goals and customer satisfaction. This individual is responsible for planning, scheduling, conducting and coordinating the technical and management aspects of projects. Example of typical duties include: conceptual designs and process development reports; Block Flow Diagrams (BFD) and Process Flow Diagrams (PFD); Process and Instrumentation Diagrams (P&ID;); User Requirement Specifications (URS); process engineering calculations; size and select equipment, materials, and process systems; assist in the preparation of engineering project proposals.

Requirements/Skills:
  • BS Chemical Engineering
  • 2+ years experience and knowledge of refinery, chemical plant or biotech equipment and processes
  • Knowledge of downstream processing or chemical synthesis is required
  • Familiarity with API, ISA, and ANSI standards a plus
  • Knowledge of hazardous area requirements and certifications related to instrument installation
  • Experience with facility design and/or industrial design and construction
  • Proficient in Microsoft office
  • Excellent written and verbal skills.
title: Process Engineer

description:
At HP, we believe in the power of ideas. We use ideas to put technology to work for everyone. And we believe that ideas thrive best in a culture of teamwork. That is why everyone – at every level, in every function – is encouraged to have original ideas, to express them and to share them. We trust anything can be achieved if you really believe in it, and we invest in our employees’ ideas to change lives and the way people work. Everyone is valued for the unique skills, experiences and perspectives they bring. With Multi Jet Fusion, we're launching a unique technology that will disrupt the market and open a new world in the 3D printing industry, and we have an exciting opportunity to become part of this effort.

Job Description

Works as part of the fluid formulation team to develop, build and test innovative chemistries to support HP Multi Jet Fusion. Works closely with system engineers to ensure fluid/material/hardware systems interact seamlessly to deliver high quality 3D printed parts. Applies advanced subject matter knowledge to help solve complex technology issues. May act as a team or project leader providing direction to team activities and facilitates information validation and team decision making process.

Responsibilities:
  • Designs engineering solutions for chemical- based processes, technologies, and formulations for product design and manufacturing based on established chemistry and engineering principles and in accordance with development technology practices and guidelines.
  • Develops and implements chemical process and operating equipment specifications, chemical formulations, and test plans for new and existing products; assists manufacturing partners with issue diagnosis and problem-solving.
  • Collaborates and communicates with management, internal, and outsourced research and development partners regarding design status, project progress, and issue resolution.
Education Required:
  • PhD degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, with a specialization in polymer chemistry, physical chemistry, or materials science
Knowledge and Skills:
  • Strong command of general principles of chemistry/physics/material science
  • Ability to connect general principles to practice
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
  • Structure-property relationships, optimization of complex mixtures
  • Ability to present data and results clearly and concisely in multiple forms (oral presentation, technical reports, internal publications) Experience working or researching in multi- or cross-disciplinary teams is a plus
title: 3D Fluids Chemist

description:
Banks Integration Group is seeking an experienced Automation Engineer to join its team. In this role you will develop process control system applications, utilizing Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC’s), Human Machine Interfaces (HMI’s), and Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) Systems, as well as, develop detailed specifications, program industrial control systems, and develop and execute test packages.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Experience with Allen-Bradley products required (ControlLogix, PLC5, SLC500, RSView, PanelView Plus, RSBizWare RSBatch, etc.)

Experience programming various other control systems desired (i.e., GE Fanuc Series 90, Siemens S7, DeltaV, ABB 800xA, Honeywell DCS, Intellution iFix, and Wonderware)

Experience implementing control system electrical design packages required

Instrumentation experience preferred

GMP and validation experience preferred

Must be available for regional travel

Must hold a valid driver’s license

Outgoing personality, strong leadership skills, as well as, excellent written and verbal communication skills are required

Education & Experience:
BS in Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or related Engineering fields plus three years of directly related experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered

Proficiency in troubleshooting control systems and an understanding of process controls a must

Control system validation experience of pharmaceutical/biotech systems is a plus

Experience in a lead role preferred

Joining the Banks Integration team is to become a member of our extended family. Our goal is to maintain an environment that will bring out the best in your individual strengths and talents, that allow us to provide our customers with solutions that exceed expectations. As a full time member of our team you will receive a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits. Interested in learning more? Check us out, www.banksintegration.com
title: Automation Engineer

description:
Amgen discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics. A biotechnology pioneer since 1980, Amgen was one of the first companies to realize the new science’s promise by bringing safe, effective medicines from lab, to manufacturing plant, to patient. Amgen therapeutics have changed the practice of medicine, helping millions of people around the world in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis, and other serious illnesses. With a deep and broad pipeline of potential new medicines, Amgen remains committed to advancing science to dramatically improve people’s lives.

Operations is one of the three foundational functions at Amgen with a mission to be consistent and efficient in delivering safe and effective medicines around the world. Operations manufactures and delivers Amgen therapeutics to our patients. Made up of five functions: Global Supply Chain, Operations Technology, Quality, Manufacturing and Engineering, and spread across nine sites, Operations’ aspiration is simple: Ensure patients have access to the Amgen products they need. Every patient, every time.

Amgen’s 10-12 week internship program offers meaningful project experiences that impact patient’s lives. This internship provides the opportunity for executive and social networking events and to participate in community volunteer projects while providing a competitive compensation.

Limited relocation housing and/or transportation allowance may be available for eligible candidates.

The successful candidate will be working as part of the TAO (Technology & Automation for Operations) group at Amgen’s Thousand Oaks facility. The group develops custom hardware and software solutions to support Amgen’s product manufacturing, with a specific focus on automated inspection.

Automated inspection, primarily through the use of industrial cameras and machine vision, is an increasingly important aspect of contemporary industrial manufacturing. Correct implementation can be surprisingly subtle and real world applications throw up a variety of very interesting scientific and technical challenges.

As part of this team the successful candidate will be exposed to robotics, optics, imaging, software development, CAD and mechanical design, computational modelling and formal scientific research. A primary goal of the program will be to further develop the candidate’s existing skills while also exposing them to new areas, all within the context of important, valuable industrial applications.

The candidate will help the team conduct fundamental research into key technical challenges associated with industrial automated inspection and product quality control. The team will provide guidance, but the candidate will be responsible for driving the direction and execution of the research. They will have the full support of experts in all of the aforementioned disciplines.

Basic Qualifications

Amgen requires that all individuals applying for a grad internship or a co-op assignment at Amgen must meet the following criteria:

18 years or older

Graduated with a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with a 3.0 minimum GPA or equivalent

Completion as a first year graduate student before internship starts and currently enrolled in a MBA program for a MBA internship OR a Master’s program for a Masters internship OR a PharmD program for a PharmD internship OR PhD for a PhD internship from an accredited college or university

Enrolled in an accredited college or university following the potential internship or co-op assignment

Must not be employed at the time the internship starts

Preferred Qualifications
Degree concentration(s) in mechanical engineering, electrical engineering and computer sciences, physics or chemical engineering.

The candidate should have some experience in designing and constructing experimental equipment and running their own experiments.

Some degree of software programming experience would be beneficial. In particular demonstrable experience with some of the following programming languages and software packages would be ideal: SolidWorks, MATLAB, Visual Studio (C# / .NET), COMSOL, LabVIEW.

In addition to formal coursework and qualifications, hobbyist experience with products like Arduino, Raspberry Pi and 3D printing would also be highly relevant to this position.

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Only candidates who apply via http://careers.amgen.com/ will be considered, 34738.

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.
title: Grad Intern - OPS (DPT Industrial Automated Inspection)

description:
Currently, we are seeking an experienced Senior Process Engineer to drive product and process advancements in tissue technologies as part of our Asset Optimization team at our Fullerton, CA location.

Position Summary:
Process Engineers at Kimberly-Clark initiate design, develop optimize and problem solve manufacturing processes in a manner that meets safety, quality, and operational performance expectations. The Process Engineer for this role will provide leadership and creativity in design, development, optimization and problem solving of tissue products. Candidates must have expertise across multiple technologies and will have a demonstrated ability to effectively provide specific project work direction to a broad range of team members. The incumbent reports to an Engineering Team leader and receives direction in the form of general project objectives.

This position will also be a technical group leader and coach for the process engineering team members on the Tissue manufacturing Asset Optimization team.

Key customers:
Sector Management, Project Sponsors, Staff Engineering, Portfolio Leaders, Mill Leadership, and Mill Asset Teams

Responsibilities:
- Lead single or multiple product or process improvement projects with a financial scope of up to $30 million from conception through commercialization.

- Provide functional leadership and creativity in the initiation of design, development, and optimization of Tissue manufacturing and converting equipment processes to meet unit objectives.

- Develop knowledge and skills so as to be recognized for expertise and functional leadership in application of engineering principles, scientific analysis and project management while providing advice and counsel to others.

- Carry out all job responsibilities in a safe manner. Develop equipment and processes that meet safety codes, policies and guidelines. Provide for the safety and well-being of operators, maintenance, and other personnel.

- Seek, recognize, define and solve problems to achieve unit objectives. Identify complex technical issues to determine root cause.

- Develop others within the areas of expertise.

Principal Accountabilities
- Ensure assets are maintained in a “Safe to operate” condition at all times, while promoting safe working practices and “design for safety” to meet all EHS objectives of the plant. This includes adherence to Statutory and Regulatory requirements.

- Project management: Plan, organize and successfully execute Process Projects in time and within budget.

- Provide Engineering solutions through modifications/upgrades to resolve operational / process problems to continuously improve the manufacturing process robustness

- Manage changes in process and equipment required by changes in product specifications and productivity requirements.

- Train, develop and up-skill personnel by means of on the job as well as technical and generic training.

- Communications - provide relevant and timely communications at all levels.

Qualifications
title: Senior Engineer Process

description:
Headquartered in Davis, CA, Marrone Bio Innovations (MBI) (NASDAQ: MBII) is a global provider of bio-based pest management and plant health products for the agriculture, turf and ornamental, and water treatment markets. The company’s effective and environmentally responsible biopesticides help customers around the world operate more sustainably while controlling pests, improving plant health, and increasing crop yields. Industry pioneers and experts in the field of natural products, MBI is dedicated to discovering, developing, and marketing better biopesticides that support a better tomorrow.
We currently seek an Associate Research Scientist to join the Bioprocess Technology team.

Responsibilities Include
  • Identify and implement bioprocessing materials, operating parameters, control schemes, and technologies to improve the performance of MBI’s proprietary production processes.
  • Connect process data to the underlying physical, biochemical and physiological phenomena by applying expertise in metabolism and quantitative analysis.
  • Transfer process technology to contract manufacturing facilities, including site visits
  • Produce new cell banks for R&D; and production
  • Design, perform, analyze, and report on microbial fermentation experiments, using bioreactors at various scales.
  • Maintain and/or calibrate process equipment and instrumentation, including tracking and traceability for GLP studies and preventive maintenance and calibration
  • Prepare laboratory notebooks, technical reports, summaries, protocols, and methods for characterization of microbial production strains and manufacturing processes.
  • Interact with Chemistry, Microbiology, and Formulation groups to promote seamless collaboration
  • Maintain personal and shared work areas in clean and organized condition
  • Set an energetic and enthusiastic tone to raise the group to a high-performance mentality
  • Role may include management of junior personnel in the department.
  • Other duties as assigned
Qualifications Education
Degree in (Bio) Chemical Engineering or related field with relevant work experience as follows: MS degree with 1+ years of relevant work experience, or a combination of academic training and relevant work experience that would be, at minimum, equivalent to these.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
  • Expertise in bioprocess development, including fermentation and separations
  • Fluency with instrumentation systems used in the life sciences
  • Highly organized, extraordinary work ethic, disciplined, and punctual
  • Outstanding communication skills: ability to maintain strong communication in all directions.
  • Quantitative orientation – able to apply statistical measures to test hypotheses effectively.
  • Knowledge of microbial physiology of Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria, including filamentous bacteria, and fungi.
  • Strong, hands-on mechanical skills – ability to diagnose a wide variety of equipment malfunctions and make repairs
  • Experience writing standard operating procedures (SOP) concerning biotechnology equipment.
  • Hands-on experience operating lab fermentors and scale-up of production from shake flask culture to fermenter culture.
  • Experience in technical transfer of manufacturing process to contract manufacturing facilities a plus.
  • Energetic and self-motivated individual able to work in a fast-paced team environment with an ambitious schedule
  • Capable of delivering high quality scientific presentations to both internal and external conferences. Experience managing a team of junior scientific personnel a plus.
  • Knowledge of design of experiments (DOE) methodology for optimizing performance.
  • Excellent analytical, organizational and multi-tasking skills.
  • Proficiency in good record keeping, writing technical reports and SOPs.
  • Excellent technical software skills, including Office (VBA automation a plus), database software, and SCADA software.
The individual should appreciate our entrepreneurial, fast-paced, agile, and dynamic work setting. He/she should be enthusiastic and energetic, goal-driven, and highly motivated to complete tasks in a timely, efficient manner. The candidate should also thrive in a strong team environment, be a self-starter and comfortable speaking up in company meetings. An individual who is positive, interactive, resourceful and creative in problem solving by thinking “out of the box” will be highly valued in this role.

Compensation The salary range is competitive. MBI offers a comprehensive benefits package including stock options, a 401(k) plan with employer match, and a health plan including medical and dental coverage, life insurance coverage, long term disability, and a flexible spending account for dependent care and/or medical expenses. In addition, this position is eligible for an annual bonus plan.

The above is a list of essential duties and responsibilities for this position. This list is not all-inclusive. This job description may be modified as needed.

MBI is an equal-opportunity employer. A pre-employment drug screen will be required.

Please submit cover letter and CV to jobs@marronebio.com referencing the job above.
title: Associate Research Scientist – Bioprocess Technology

description:
Pacific Biosciences is looking for a highly energetic Semiconductor Packaging Engineer ready to work on our exciting next generation biologically integrated semiconductor chip sequencing technology. This position will involve working in a fast moving cross-discipline and highly creative environment. Daily job activities will include overseeing foundry assembly and packaging of integrated CMOS devices utilizing die level and die to wafer level bonding, bonding of injection molded plastic parts and ceramic substrates, wafer dicing, and wire bonding, all while having the unique opportunity of interfacing with a broad range of advanced scientists and engineers,

The ideal candidate is a highly mobile and adaptive forward thinking person able to take ownership of complex long range projects while executing on immediate short term deliverables. Key skills will include complex problem solving, team management, statistical design and analysis, superb documentation skills, and excellent team interaction. Hands on experience with CMOS packaging design, UV and thermal adhesives, die and wire bonding will make for a highly successful candidate.

Responsibilities:
This person will be responsible for ensuring high quality electrical packaging of integrated CMOS and fluidics products utilizing external foundry partners and for the improvement and ramp into high volume of said processes, tools, designs, and materials.

Key areas of focus are:
• Strong foundry/external manufacturing management experience.
• Pro-active assessment of risks/failure modes and crisp ownership of excursions
• Roadmapping and implementation of CIP projects to effect positive change in cost/quality/cycle time/functional performance
• Strong documentation skills including qualification plan, work instructions, technician training
• Integration of a standard CMOS component with injection molded plastics utilizing both standard and custom packaging techniques
• UV, thermal adhesive and encapsulant material evaluation, selection, and dispense/cure process development and improvement
• Wafer to wafer bonding, die attach with component tracking and traceability
• Wedge wirebonding experience
• Design and implementation of manufacturing systems and documentation for clean transfer into production environment
• Application of SPC/FMEA based approach to production line/data and system development to insure highly effective but low overhead approach to process capability monitoring
• Detail oriented data collection and analysis to enable tool and process validations
• Ability to interface with and lead integrated teams involving manufacturing and R&D;
• Development of experiments and methods to identify key relationships between inline parametric data and product functional performance.

This person will work very closely with external manufacturing partners and will represent the company for specific product lines.

Position Requirements:
• Bachelors’s degree or equivalent experience in Materials Science, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering or Physics.
• 4+ years of industry experience in custom and volume manufacturing environments
• Proficiency with JMP, Excel, Project, SolidWorks
• Familiarity with ISO 9001 & 13485
• Experience with MES/manufacturing automation systems
• Strong ownership and drive for success
• Ability and willingness to travel up to 20% of the time
title: Semiconductor Packaging Engineer

description:
Job Description
Job Description:
This position falls within Chemistry R&D;, part of the CSD organization of Thermo fisher Scientific, located at South San Francisco. The selected individual will be part of a high performance, cross-disciplinary team at the cutting edge of sequencing technology.
Key responsibilities:
  • Perform bioconjugations on hydrogel particles
  • Write scripts and develop workflows on automated liquid handling platforms
  • Assist in the development of new analytical methods and assays as needed
  • Analyze data, derive conclusions, document findings, write SOPs and prepare reports for sharing within and between R&D; groups
  • Support EHS duties, hazardous waste management and lab organization
  • Maintain a detailed and organized lab notebook
Minimum requirements:
  • BS or MS in chemistry, chemical engineering, bioengineering or equivalent
  • Minimum 2-3 years of hands-on experience in a lab setting. Experience working with lab automation platforms is desirable
  • Working knowledge of bioconjugation & particle science
  • Proficiency in basic programming (Matlab, JMP, etc.) and scripting
  • Proficiency in fluorescence microscopy & other imaging methods
  • Moderate to intensive pipetting and long continuous periods in the lab doing experiments

Desired qualities:
  • Fast learner and a self-starter
  • Anticipates needs and problems while creating solutions. Not always instruction-based
  • Demonstrates a sense of urgency, contagious optimism and a âcan doâ attitude
  • Is curious, inquisitive, innovative, never satisfied with the status quo
  • Greets challenge and change as opportunity

description:
MWH, a global leader in wet-infrastructure engineering, construction, and technology is currently seeking an Associate Level Instrumentation and Controls Engineer in our San Francisco, CA or Walnut Creek, CA office locations.

Successful applicants will work with a multidiscipline group of engineers and designers providing technical services to public and private sector clients. Primary duties, as applicable to water and wastewater treatment facilities and pumping stations, will include:

  • Producing construction drawings, schedules and datasheets using computer-aided engineering production tools
  • Assist in the development of specifications
  • Assist in the review of contractor submittals
  • Supporting engineering services during construction
  • Active participation in field data-gathering and equipment assessment assignments
  • Working in a manner to ensure personal safety and that of fellow employees by following company health and safety guidelines and policies.
Duties will be generally performed under the guidance of a senior level or higher I&C; engineer.
  • Bachelors of Science in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Chemical Engineering is required, MS preferred, with 0 - 3 years of experience in instrumentation and controls.

  • Willing and able to travel. Occasional international travel may be required.
At MWH, we believe growing a great engineering, consulting and construction services company happens from the inside out. We look for people who are drawn to use every talent they possess, plus imagination, determination and a drive to do the extraordinary. We believe that building a great career is as important as Building a Better World . If working on the best water and natural resources projects around the world, building on your talents through a premier knowledge-sharing culture, and connecting across borders with some of the world’s top talent appeals to you, join us. description:
We are seeking candidates to join a team of engineers developing new leading-edge products. Pattern Fidelity Control, or PFC, uses computational lithography methods to identify patterns within a chip layout, which are most sensitive to process variability, and enables defect prediction, defect reduction, and yield improvement. The successful candidate will report to ASML/Brion’s PFC Group manager and work with the team to solve the challenges associated with the shrinking in critical dimensions at the 10-nm node and below.
Job Description The product engineers’ function is to develop and to support customer applications. As such, product engineers own the functional specifications of new products, their functional and integration testing, as well as the development of best practices for standard or customized applications. They also provide 2nd line support for established products. Responsibilities of the successful candidate will include: (i) Interacting with customers to gain understanding of their technical requirements and effectively translating these requirements onto new product specifications; (ii) Helping conduct feasibility studies; (iii) Determining best practices for new products; (iv) Responsibility for new product introductions; (v) Performing acceptance tests; and (vi) Conducting customer engagement projects to demonstrate the performance of our products.
Education M.Sc. and above in Electrical Engineering, Physics, and/or Chemical Engineering, IC manufacturing, semiconductor process technology, and related fields
Experience 5+ years of experience in engineering in semiconductor environment with a strong emphasis on lithography, defect metrology, and/or semiconductor process. Hands on experience with lithography, metrology simulation, and analysis tools required. Script level programming skills (Python / Matlab). Insight into leading-edge chipmakers’ needs in terms of software, data analysis tools and control strategies Knowledge of optical physics and imaging and semiconductor process technology. Must able to work independently and also effectively as a member of a team.
Other Information EEO/AA (W/M/Vets/Disability) Employer
title: Sr. Product Engineer

description:
At GenapSys we are working to change the world of healthcare and diagnostics. Our team brings together an incredibly diverse and multidisciplinary set of backgrounds and skills – from electrical and mechanical engineers, to physicists, chemists, microfluidic engineers, molecular biologists, bioinformaticians, mathematicians and more. Together we will advance scientific and medical knowledge and improve human health through cheaper, faster, and more accurate DNA sequencing technologies. We are working cross functionally to make a great impact in the world – join us on that mission!

We’re looking for a talented and organized team player to work at a fast-paced startup. This individual will be eager and enthusiastic, and someone who wants to take on many responsibilities. In essence, this position requires someone who is willing to roll up their sleeves and work hard to push product development forward. Formal educational background may include: molecular biology, genetics, biomedical engineering, chemical engineering, biophysics.

Responsibilities

  • Design, execute, analyze and document sequencing experiments
  • Develop quantitative methods, metrics, and analutical procedures for evaluating and interpreting Sequencing datasets
  • Improve the sequencing workflow and protocols associated with the GenapSys platform
  • Maintain current awareness of NGS technologies and new and emerging approaches and methods in NGS
  • Data driven - critically analyze and derive insights and make decisions from experimental data, esp. NGS data
  • Make decisions involving designing, performing, troubleshooting, analyzing and reporting results for development and verification and validation studies
  • Help drive productivity increases through new technological insights, exceptional time management skills and a ‘can do’ approach to the challenges at hand
  • Collaborate effectively within a multidisciplinary organization
Required Qualifications

  • Ph.D. in Biomedical engineering, Biology, Genetics, Chemical Engineering, Biochemistry, Biophysics or related fields
  • Ph.D. with 3+ years of experience preferred
  • Strong background in biochemistry, biophysics, genomics and a solid understanding of commercial product development
  • Hands-on experience with molecular biology and biochemistry techniques, e.g. PCR and Isothermal amplification, NGS sample preparation, nucleic acid technologies, microfluidic technologies, microscopy, flow cytometry etc. is highly desirable
  • Proficiency in scientific programming languages, e.g. Matlab, Python, R, or C, is desirable
  • Familiar with bioinformatics tools, sequence analysis algorithms and NCBI programs such as BLAST
Benefits & Perks

  • Competitive compensation and stock options
  • Anthem Blue Cross PPO and Kaiser Medical (including for dependents)
  • Excellent Dental and Vision through Guardian
  • Fully sponsored Life, Short and Long-term Disability insurance
  • FSA, 401(k) retirement plan
  • Stocked kitchen and beverages, daily catered gourmet lunches
  • Weekly Fancy High Tea and Happy Hours
  • Free complex onsite gym membership
  • Learning and growth opportunities
About GenapSys

At GenapSys, we are developing a DNA-sequencing technology that will revolutionize the world of healthcare. Our system will enable fast, accurate, and ultra-low cost genetic tests in order to better understand (and ultimately treat) genetic diseases such as Cancer, Parkinson’s, Diabetes, and Alzheimers, just to name a few. GenapSys was founded by Dr. Hesaam Esfandyarpour. The company was incorporated in early 2010 and is funded by leading firms in both venture and institutional capital. We have built an incredible team of scientists, engineers, and business professionals – join our team and be part of the adventure!

description:

The individual will assign tasks, monitor performance, review results, coordinate efforts, and track hour usage on projects. Leading and participating in start-up assignments will also be required. Must have the ability to travel an average of about 25% of the time; however, travel can flex up to 50% a few times per year.

title: Junior Applications Engineer

description:
Working at the intersection of hardware, software and molecular science, we are committed to delivering on the promise of 3D printing, enabling commercial customers to go beyond basic prototyping to 3D manufacturing.

Our company is built on the idea that diverse fields of study must come together to solve intractable problems. We have grand ambitions to create technology that will influence industry around the world.

You will be joining a diverse team with a vibrant culture, where team success is as important as celebrating individual contributions.

Help us change the world and we will help you change yours.

We are looking for an outstanding polymer scientist to develop novel materials for our 3D printing platform. Materials are at the core of what we do. Our materials are used for applications such as prototyping, dental, biomedical, automotive, aerospace, footwear, investment casting, and many more. You will work as part of a cohesive and energetic team, but also direct individual projects and have freedom to execute as you see fit.

Responsibilities:
    • Develop, formulate and test new polymer formulations to be used in the production of resins for 3D printing
    • Understand structure-property relationship of polyurethane and UV curables, and utilize DOE (Design of Experiments) to find optimal formulations to meet materials requirement
    • Utilize existing and implement new formulation technologies to generate consistent resin batches for both internal and external use
    • Participate in the scale-up and launch of the developed products by transfer of formulation know-how to manufacturing
Requirements:
    • MS with 2+ years of industry experience OR PhD in polymer chemistry, materials science, or chemical engineering focused on polymer research. Outstanding BS level with 2+ years industry experience will also be considered.
    • Fundamental understanding and knowledge of polymerization reaction mechanisms, polymer structure, testing and characterization methodologies.
    • Understand polymer blends, polymer phase separation, compatibility, and how different components affect the mechanical properties including modulus, tensile strength, and ultimate elongation at break.
    • Hands on experience in formulating innovative high performance polymeric products, especially polyurethane and/or acrylic resins or elastomers.
    • Experience with polymer toughening techniques, such as fillers and methods of stabilizing them within liquid formulations, or experience with dynamic vulcanization in elastomer formulations
    • Experience in a broad range of polymer characterization instrumentation including: Instron, DMA, DSC, TGA, GC, GPC, etc. Strong analytical skills with ability to make progress with ambiguous and incomplete information.
    • Familiarity with advanced DOE (design of experiment) techniques and statistical analysis preferred.
    • Safety conscious individual who actively promotes safe behavior in the department and takes responsibility for safe lab operations
Carbon3D team members enjoy working in a newly renovated R&D; facility a short walk from the Redwood City CalTrain station and local restaurants. Our tight-knit team works collaboratively in our open space and in our labs, learns together through our entrepreneurship guest speaker series, and bonds together through weekly-catered meals, offsite events and activities.

We also provide complete benefits and competitive compensation including equity ownership.

About Crane Aerospace & Electronics:
Crane Aerospace & Electronics combines the experience of long-time industry leaders to supply critical systems and components to the aerospace and defense markets. Our products are found in some of the most demanding environments, from engines to landing gears, from satellites to medical implants, and from missiles to unmanned aerial systems.

We are committed to operational excellence and world class processes. We employ Lean manufacturing techniques to optimize manufacturing efficiency and accuracy on all product lines. Our products are known for their technical strength, proven reliability and overall value.

The Aerospace Group designs, manufactures and supports critical aircraft systems and components, offering innovative solutions for Sensing & Utilities, Landing Systems, Fluid Management, and Cabin. Virtually all commercial and military aircraft fly with products manufactured by the Aerospace Group.

We look for flexible professionals who are capable of working with minimal supervision and can adapt to changing environments. We look for people who are challenged by other people, who like being around well-educated, well-versed professionals. For these people, Crane Aerospace & Electronics provides a creative outlet and high level of participation. People in the company build the company.

Crane Aerospace & Electronics offers competitive salaries and outstanding opportunities for career growth and development.

In our efforts to maintain a safe and drug-free workplace, Crane Aerospace & Electronics requires that candidates complete a satisfactory background check and pass a drug screen prior to employment.

This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work being performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

description:

We have an immediate need for a:

Siegfried Irvine has extensive manufacturing capabilities and maintains state of the art micro and analytical laboratories, and the capability to provide stability services meeting all ICH guidelines. Location: Trona, CA
