Job Description:
Provide management and technical guidance to ensure the safe and efficient operation of the analytical laboratory operation.
Provide leadership and training to laboratory operations personnel.
Ensure accurate evaluation, interpretation, and verification of data (samples, calibration, and quality control) for analyses performed in the laboratory.
Be the main customer contact point for resolution of technical issues and quality issues.
Lead budgeting and planning efforts for laboratory function.
Review, recommend and implement new or enhanced laboratory methods, practices and equipment.
Lead lab analytical and research techniques and innovations.
Develop, standardize, and document lab processes to optimize efficiency of analyses and reporting.
Ensure accuracy and statistical rigor of analytical results.
Develop lab asset replacement plan and coordinate acquisition of new equipment.
Provide/ensure preventative maintenance for instrumentation in the laboratory.
Participate in continuous improvement efforts within the lab and company.
Support regulatory compliance and help solve customer and operations quality issues.
Assist the QA department in solving field problems, clarifying customer requirements and issues, and provide technical support to manufacturing.
Maintain expertise on all quality topics including but not limited to document control, training and quality incident reporting for the lab.
Understand application of ISO 9000, quality procedures and audit techniques
Support plant personnel and engineers with analytical data to help maintain and improve plant performance.

Qualifications:
BS chemistry or chemical engineering required.
3+ years of experience with analytical methods, data interpretation and relevant statistical analysis of results.
5+ years of experience in Laboratory Management/Supervision
Must understand efficient laboratory organization, including sample flow through the laboratory, and daily sample output.
Basic knowledge of inorganic chemistry strongly preferred.
Lean Six Sigma or equivalent experience preferred.
Strong working knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite.
Strong analytical, verbal and writing skills are required.
Candidate must be skilled in data analysis, statistical methods and be familiar with scientific instrument software.
Must have a working knowledge of manufacturing and quality operations.
Possess knowledge of lab processes, chemical analyses, analytical practices and techniques, documentation, interpretation and publication of results.
Must be ?hands-on? and willing to ?roll up sleeves? and work at all levels of organization as circumstances require.
Able to support plants which are in continuous operation.
Must be familiar with analytical instrumentation including GC, ICPOES, NMR, IC, UV-VIS spectroscopy, titration and auto-titrator theory and operation, pH testing, specific gravity, particle size testing, and other wet chemistry method sample preparation and analyses.
Ability to plan, prioritize, and manage multiple priorities under tight deadlines.
Ability to coach, manage, change and facilitate team performance.
Strong organizational, analytical, troubleshooting and effective problem identification and solution skills.
Experience with instrumentation calibration methods, development of analyst training/testing programs.
title: Lab Manager

description:
10x is looking for an outstanding individual to be responsible for taking processes from concept feasibility phase to full implementation in a commercial manufacturing facility. The position requires a technical understanding of various chemistries such as organic synthesis, polymerization and surface chemistries. Based upon your understanding of these chemistries develop, characterize and optimize processes required to manage these chemistries at volume in production. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in process development, scale-up, process implementation and validation in a commercial manufacturing facility with deep technical expertise in surfactants, polymers, or analytical chemistry.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop, characterize and optimize a broad range of chemistry based production processes.
  • Integration of these chemistries into various fluidic handling mechanisms.
  • Experimentation to develop a deep understanding of the underlying reaction mechanisms and interactions, cause and effect, failure modes, guard band studies and optimization using DOE methodologies.
  • Identify and optimize any compounding factors, such a temperature, environment, workflow, pressures, reagent concentrations that could impact the resulting product.
  • Scale up and develop alternative production processes to meet demand as 10x Genomics continues to grow.
  • Develop process QC methods to ensure processes are in control.
  • Implement statistical process control tools.
  • Verification that the output manufactured products meet all requirements.
  • Install and verify equipment, document processes and train operators.
Desired Skills and Background

  • PhD in Chemical Engineering, Organic Chemistry, Analytical Chemistry, Process Engineering or related field.
  • 5 years relevant experience developing successful processes in the life science industry.
  • Strong Process Transfer experience demonstrating control of manufacturing processes through appropriate Process Design and QC methods.
  • Ability to integrate a broad range of scientific and engineering disciplines.
  • Ability to design meaningful experiments and in depth analysis of results. Experience using statistical tools, such as JMP, is beneficial.
  • Ability to develop, validate and transfer process to manufacturing or OEM vendors.
  • Strong collaboration and communication skills.
  • Desire to be part of a rapidly evolving organization, with a compelling technology, and taking products and processes to the next level.
title: Senior Process Chemist / Engineer

description:
** This role is available NOW (Jan 2017) for part-time // full-time AND a Summer internship full-time -- > please apply with your availability **

We are looking for a Materials Engineering Intern who is looking for an opportunity to experience the future of manufacturing up close and hands on. This internship will primarily be working side-by-side with our team of robots (and humans), but more specifically ...
  • Build and optimize industrial equipment that makes custom filament for 3D printer
  • Improve and build solutions for making custom material filament for our 3D printers
  • Develop new methods for material filament production with color and type customization options
  • Build and optimize industrial equipment that makes custom filament for 3D printer
  • Test new materials blends to provide business needs (e.g. durability, breathability, ...)
Requirements:
We are seeking people to join our venture backed startup team to create the future of footwear. We want the entrepreneurial game changers, the self-starters, and the team players that want to be part of solving big problems in a fast changing environment. Oh and you have to be mad about shoes !!
  • BS/ MS in Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or similar field
  • Experience with 3D printing flexible materials a plus
  • Must be eligible to work in the USA
Benefits:
A small team means you get access to the whole company and not just one department.
You get to interact with customers, executives, venture capital investors, and of course the amazingly smart team that makes the future of the world happen every single day!

Other important stuff:
  • You get paid whilst you do amazing things
  • You get to see and work with the future of manufacturing
  • Snacks and food provided for free to keep us all happy
  • We play music and have dance parties every single day
  • If hired to employee status (which we aim to do) - we offer medical/dental plans, options in the company, and a quarterly cash bonus structure
  • Did we mention you get a pair of 3D printed custom shoes!!!
title: 3D Printing - Materials Engineering Intern

description:
Essential Duties And Responsibilities

The candidate will be responsible for Food Product Development:

  • Bringing new products with associated new technology to market.
  • Leading and/or supporting feasibility, development, and commercialization aspects of new product projects; managing project plans and timelines for on-time delivery
  • Developing target design for new products and helping to ensure manufactured product on-target quality
  • Designing, planning and executing experiments for bench top, pilot plant and plant trials, gathering and analyzing data, documenting and reporting results, and making recommendations based on findings.
  • Conducting sensory and consumer testing, shelf life and product stability studies, and recommending storage and handling requirements
  • Supporting scale-up and commercialization efforts led by Engineering, Operations and/or Co-Manufacturing teams
  • Leading and/or supporting problem-solving, productivity, and quality improvement projects
  • Writing detailed ingredient, product, and process specifications
  • Supporting labeling, nutritional, regulatory, and food safety efforts
  • Managing relationships with suppliers and business partners in Marketing, Sourcing, Finance, Quality, and R&D.;
Education And/Or Experience

  • BS/MS/PhD in Chemistry, Food Science, Chemical Engineering or related fields, with 6+ years of industrial experience in the food industry
  • Proven track record of successful product launches and experience in product development technology within the Food Industry.
Candidates should posses the following skills:
  • Strong technical and project management skills with results orientation
  • Knowledge and experience with ingredient functionality, product design and formulation, and commercialization
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills; able to effectively communicate to all levels within the organization
  • Ability to effectively influence others and get results through working with a diverse team
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize and manage complexity
  • Executional excellence, personal leadership, time management, organizing, and problem solving competencies
  • Ability to be flexible and adaptable to move with a changing environment
  • Ability to collaborate cross-functionally, building strong relationships across R&D;, Engineering, Marketing, Finance, Sourcing, Quality, Manufacturing, and External Teams
  • Demonstrated ability to work with all levels of the organization
  • Self-Motivation
  • Determination to find the best solution for the needed applications
  • Ability to continuously challenge assumptions to seek innovative solutions
While performing duties of the this job the candidate may:
  • occasionally be required to stand for extended periods of time.
  • occasionally lift or move objects up to 30 lbs.
  • be required to travel (~20%)
  • be asked to participate in taste panels involving meat and dairy.
title: R&D Food Product Development Scientist/Engineer

description:
The Lean Manufacturing Engineer ( Lean Industrial Engineer) has the primary responsibility to ensure that Production Operations is ready to go at the scheduled start of production date utilizing and implementing Lean Methodologies including training all levels of the organization.
Other responsibilities include:
• Preparing standardized work instructions and floor layouts.
• Setting up stations with proper tooling and equipment.
• Leading manufacturing improvements, complex process changes, and technology changes including developing a core team, assigning / reporting to a steering committee, projecting efforts involved with implementation, and identifying impacts to the business.
• Coordinating and communicating technical information to and from all levels of the organization including vendors, project managers, production team members, and operations managers.
• Developing department procedures to improve business and engineering transactions using process flow diagrams and value stream mapping techniques.

Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:
• Required education and focus: High school diploma or GED
• Required experience: At least three years of experience planning vehicle production (e.g. rail, aviation, naval, heavy equipment).
• Required travel: 10%
• Other Requirements:
o Experience reading engineering drawings and gaining an understanding of manufacturing process requirements such as job sequence, workflow, fixture requirements, cell layouts, etc and utilizing Yamazumi charts and Standard Work techniques to ensure a balanced production line and work load.
o Firm project management skills , including developing project plans, timelines / schedules, budgets, proposed layouts, resource requirements, calculating ROI, etc.
o Practical knowledge of the lean tool box and ability to utilize lean principles to systematically eliminate waste including leading and coaching kaizen activities plant wide.
o A history of the “hands-on” approach to problem solving using the 8 step problem solving method and permanently eliminating issues by identifying the root causes / countermeasure plant wide regardless of process or technology type.
o Demonstrated knowledge of the product structure and manufacturing processes for vehicles such as welding, fabrication and assembly, electrical subassembly, finishing and paint, final assembly, and electrical testing.
o Demonstrated understanding of tooling and fixtures for manufacturing and its impact to dimensional accuracy and welding quality including process capability and First pass yield methods.
o Experience using multiple of bills of materials, basic understanding of routings, calculating lead times, inventory turns, and other production planning functions.
o A history of leading and driving improvement projects based on team member feedback / suggestions in very adverse conditions.

Preferred Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:
• Preferred education and focus: Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Mechanical or Industrial Engineering highly preferred; candidates with Chemical Engineering degrees may be preferred if experience includes a strong background in paint and finishing processes.
• Six Sigma Master Black Belt / Six Sigma Black Belt / Lean Expert Certification
• Other Preferences:
o Practical experience in Customer Service / Maintenance / After Market businesses and technologies within the rail industry preferred.
o Practical experience using complex Factory Planning Methods such as defining high level manufacturing plans, identifying / analyzing new technologies required, creating a value stream analysis, performing total space needs analysis, performing total capacity needs analysis, implementation planning, etc. preferred.
o Practical experience developing technology roadmaps for a range of automation options from spot welding, to robot welding, to using new material types such as SST, Aluminum, etc. preferred.
o Practical experience transferring technical knowledge, manufacturing knowledge, and proprietary technologies from lead factories to market factories preferred.
o Practical experience training others on Lean topics, facilitating Lean improvement activities, leading lean improvement activities (KAIZEN) within a welding, finishing, assembly, and electrical sub-assembly environment.
o Practical experience utilizing and implementing lean methods and tools such as 5s, 7 Types of Waste, 8-Step Practical Problem Solving (root cause analysis), Yamazumi Methods, Flow, Total Flow, Kanban, Value Stream Mapping and Design / Process Flow Diagrams, ABC-XYZ Analysis, and Lean Shop Floor Management Model.
o Practical experience coaching and training staff at all levels and functions of the organization including Lean in Production, Lean in Engineering, Lean in Quality, Lean in Procurement / Purchasing / Supply Chain and Lean at the Supplier.
o Knowledge of MRP / ERP systems is highly desired.
o Bi-lingual German and English is a plus.
o Bi-Lingual Spanish and English is a plus.
title: Manufacturing/Industrial Engineer

company: Metropolitan Water District of Southern California
description:
Assistant Engineer I (Electrical, Mechanical or Chemical, Instrumentation and Controls Design Team), Job #5382813 - 1 of a Total of 7 Assistant Engineer I Positions currently available

Including this position, Metropolitans Engineering Services Group currently has seven (7) openings for an Assistant Engineer I of various disciplines. You must apply separately for each position. These entry-level professional engineering positions are either located at Metropolitans Headquarters in downtown Los Angeles, California or its La Verne, California office (for the Construction Management Positions).

This job posting is for the Assistant Engineer I (Electrical, Mechanical or Chemical), Instrumentation and Controls Design Team, job #5382813 only. To be considered for any of the other 6 positions, you must apply separately for each position. You can do so at the links below.

Assistant Engineer I (Mechanical, Equipment Design Team) - 5382803

Assistant Engineer I (Civil/Structural, Facilities Design Team) - 5382811

Assistant Engineer I (Civil, General Design Team)

  • 5374814
Assistant Engineer I (2 positions - Construction Management Unit) - 5391874

Assistant Engineer I (Civil/Structural, Pipeline Design Team) - 5391868

Metropolitan Engineers can expect to work on some of the largest water treatment, conveyance, and distribution projects in the world. We deliver an average of 1.5 billion gallons of water per day to a 5,200-square mile service area in Southern California.

Metropolitan owns and operates: Five water treatment plants, the largest of which can deliver up to 750 million gallons of water per day; the Colorado River Aqueduct, a 242-mile conveyance system designated as a national historic engineering landmark by the American Society of Civil Engineers, which can convey up to 1.7 billion gallons of water per day from Lake Havasu to Southern California; 800 miles of pipelines, ranging up to nearly 20 feet in diameter; and numerous pumping plants (the largest of which has nine 12,500 hp pumps), hydroelectric generating stations, and support facilities.

Engineering staff plan, design, and manage construction of new facilities and modification of existing facilities to ensure delivery of high quality water to approximately 19 million people in Southern California.

Each Assistant Engineer I candidate hired through these recruitments will work with engineers, project managers, construction managers, water system operations staff, and technical specialists under direct supervision in an exciting, challenging environment with broad opportunities for career advancement.

APPLICATION PROCESS AND TIMELINE

Please submit/attach a resume (with your degree/anticipated degree highlighted) in a PDF or Word format when you apply using the Upload button. Only those applicants submitting a PDF or Word format of their resume will be considered. You must submit/attach a PDF or Word format resume for each position you apply for. If you have trouble uploading your resume, please call 213-217-7738 or email

jobs@mwdh2o.com

on the day you submit your application for help.

All applicants will receive an email from SurveyMonkey.com shortly after applying. Please make sure you add the domain to your Safe Senders List so that it is not filtered and sent to your spam folder.

The Survey will need to be completed by noon within 2 days of receipt to be considered for the position

.

Should you be invited to participate in an examination for this position, the exam will consist of a technical/writing exercise. Results from this technical/writing exercise will determine those moving forward in the recruitment process. The technical/writing exercise will be held in the last week of March of 2017.

Those moving further in the recruitment process will interview in mid-April 2017.

The tentative start date for this position is July 3, 2017.

JOB SUMMARY - Assistant Engineer I (Electrical, Mechanical or Chemical, Instrumentation and Controls Design Team), job #5382813

The Design Unit is responsible for the design of water treatment, conveyance and distribution facilities throughout Metropolitans operating system. This position involves entry level Instrumentation and Controls (I&C;) Engineering design duties. This includes learning and assisting with development of Process and Instrumentation Diagrams (P&ID;s), Process Flow Diagrams (PFDs), equipment data sheets, instrumentation specifications, equipment and process control strategies, automation control and design, and preparation of studies and plans for Capital Improvement Program (CIP) projects. This position will also learn and assist with inspection, diagnosis, and troubleshooting of instrumentation and control and automation issues in support of day-to-day water system operations.

JOB DUTIES

GENERAL

1. Learns and assists with planning, coordinating, conducting and monitoring tests, studies, investigations.

2. Learns and assists to prepare technical documents, reports, and presentations.

3. Learns and assists with technical analyses.

4. Learns and assists to prepare cost estimates and budgets.

5. May execute mathematical, statistical, and other models.

6. Learns and assists with site inspections.

7. Learns and assists with maintaining official records, documents, and data.

8. May participate on a project team.

9. Performs other related Engineer job duties as required

DESIGN

1. Learns and assists with preparation of engineering design criteria, calculations, plans, specifications, estimates and reports for water treatment, conveyance and distribution systems.

2. Learns and assists with performing investigations of existing facilities, structures, processes, and equipment to resolve performance, operation, or reliability issues.

Work Schedule:
9/80, Monday - Friday (Alternate Fridays off)

Job Requirements

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Education and Experience:
Bachelors degree from an accredited college or university in a related field by

June 30, 2017.

A related field is defined as electrical, mechanical, or chemical engineering.

Should you receive a job offer with the Metropolitan Water District, it will be contingent upon successful completion of an engineering degree on or before June 30, 2017 in the discipline you have indicated in your application. You must provide proof of a Bachelor's degree.

General Required Knowledge of:
Engineering principles and practices in specific discipline; and current office technology and equipment.

General Required Skills and Abilities to:
Analyze and interpret data; organize; problem solve; prioritize and multi-task; communicate clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing; establish and maintain effective working relationships with those contacted in the course of work; work independently and in a team environment; and operate current office equipment including computers and supporting applications.

License

Valid California Class C Driver License or equivalent that allows you to drive in the course of your employment is required.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS, WORK ENVIRONMENT, AND VISION REQUIREMENTS

The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met or may be encountered by an employee to successfully perform the job duties of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the job duties.

Physical Demands:
The work requires some physical exertion such as long periods of standing; walking over rough, uneven, or rocky surfaces; recurring bending, crouching, stooping, stretching, reaching, or similar activities; recurring lifting of moderately heavy items such as personal computers and record boxes. The work may require specific, but common, physical characteristics and abilities such as above-average agility and dexterity.

Work Environment:
The work involves moderate risks or discomforts that require special safety precautions, e.g., working around moving parts, carts, or machines, or irritant chemicals; etc. Employees may be required to use protective clothing or gear such as masks, gowns, coats, boots, goggles, gloves, or shields.

Job Related Selection Criteria:

20% Analytical Skills

15% Job Preparation (education, experience and training relevant to the position)

10% Written communication skills

10% Teamwork

05%

100% Total

Closing

 Competitive compensation

 Excellent medical, dental, life, vision

 Retirement plans, including pension plan and 401k

 Tuition reimbursement

 Training and advancement opportunities

 Excellent working environment

 Public transportation reimbursements and van pools

 On-site fitness center

 Hub of public transportation: Rail, subway, buses and taxis

It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. description: Boehringer Ingelheim is currently seeking a talented and innovative Intern to join our Process Science department located at our Fremont facility. As an Intern, you will perform projects related to the sciences, biochemical engineering, chemical engineering, or related sciences (with 0-5 years experience) to study various aspects of bioprocessing. The scientists at Boehringer Ingelheim, Fremont California develop manufacturing processes for protein-based drugs. We are seeking scientists and engineers with a biology, protein chemistry, cell culture, fermentation or molecular biology background to join our team for the summer. The intern will also be expected to present analysis and results from experiments orally to a small group of scientists as frequently as a weekly basis and at conclusion of the internship. There are positions in analytical development, purification development, and cell culture development.

description:
Administrative Associate, Grade F, 100% FTE, Non-Exempt

School of Engineering, Chemical Engineering

Founded in 1961, the Department of Chemical Engineering was initially an outgrowth of the university’s Department of Chemistry. Early faculty pioneered or substantially influenced the emerging field of chemical engineering in a number of important areas including catalysis and transport/fluid mechanics. More recently, the department has added bioengineering and soft-material science to its core areas of excellence and has made a growing commitment to technology development that complements its long-held strength in fundamental applied science and molecular engineering.

title: Senior Manufacturing Process Engineer

description:
Job Description
Position Summary:

The manufacturing engineer is responsible for cGMP engineering support of Operations. Process engineering lead for developing cleaning development strategy and perform risk assessment and gap analysis for site cleaning programs.

Develop the cleaning and steaming strategy of stainless steel fixed tanks, portable tanks, polyethylene containers. Qualify lab washer and autoclave. Experience with evaluating detergents and CIP chemicals for proteins on stainless steel, glass or plastics.

Position Responsibilities:
  • Planning and execution of cleaning validation program, including process monitoring, compliant with FDA and ISO requirements.
  • Develop user requirement specifications and operational SOPs for cleaning of process equipment.
  • Act as process engineering lead for developing cleaning development strategy.
  • Perform risk assessment and gap analysis for site cleaning programs with laboratory washers and portable CIP systems.
  • Risk rank cleaning remediations and generate action plan to correct priority items
  • Create cleaning cycle development strategies for a variety of equipment including: fixed tanks, portable tanks, valves, pumps and labware.
  • Perform spray coverage testing, cleaning verification/validation swabbing, and review of QC results.
  • Perform piping design and flow calculations for CIP systems.
  • Perform batch record review, including verifying calibration and in-process data.
  • Perform commissioning and provide automation support for CIP systems, including PLC systems

Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:
  • BS degree or higher in chemical engineering or a related engineering or scientific discipline.
  • A minimum of 5 to 10 years industry (Biotechnology, Medical Device, or Pharmaceutical) experience.
  • Familiarity with cleaning of process equipment, including CIP cycle development and optimization, piping design, and fluid dynamics.
  • Familiarity with sanitization or sterilization of process equipment.
  • Familiarity with plant control software, including PLC..
  • Familiarity with engineering project management.
  • Proven experience with: CIP cycle development, cleaning validation, protocol development, execution, troubleshooting, and summary reports.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Industry experience related to cGMP manufacturing, validation, programming, or chemical process design.
  • Strong computer knowledge including Microsoft Office products.

Non-Negotiable Hiring Criteria
  • This position does not offer Relocation Assistance.
  • Bachelorâs degree with minimum of 5 years of post-degree experience.

*IND-SDG

title: Validation Engineer (Cleaning)

description:
Job Description

SmartFoam is seeking an entrepreneurially minded materials and device design engineer to join their growing team. Under the guidance of senior research management, the materials and device engineer will design and fabricate smart piezoelectric foam materials to be used in a variety of products including athletic footwear, bedding, electronics, automotive, furniture, and packaging. The individual will be involved with the synthesis of piezoelectric micro- and nanoparticles, the infusion of the piezoelectrics into polymeric carriers, characterizing the electrical/mechanical properties of the materials, fabricating prototype devices, and scaling up the fabrication process. This is a full-time position that will be carried-out in an office and laboratory environment. Occasional travel may be required.

Responsibilities

  • Materials synthesis and processing (solution-phase, ball milling, sintering, mixing, polymer composites, surface modification, polymer cross-linking)
  • Materials characterization (XRD, SEM/TEM, FTIR, UV-Vis, DMA)
  • Piezoelectric device testing (electronic probe station, circuit design, impedance)
  • Prototype design and evaluation
  • Scale-up manufacturing
  • Collaborate with scientific partners and consultants

Qualifications

  • BS or MS degree in materials science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, chemical engineering, chemistry, physics, or related field
  • Familiarity with piezoelectric and composite materials
  • Understanding of electrical measurements, electrical circuits, signal processing, and wireless technologies
  • Experience with chemical synthesis and materials characterization
  • Experience with polymers is desirable
  • Familiarity with electronic device engineering including wire bonding, multiplexing, and data acquisition
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
  • Ability to manage multiple scientific tasks and maintain well-documented records of projects
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
  • Work cooperatively and supportively with individuals that have a broad range of backgrounds and educational levels

Our headquarters is located in Carlsbad, CA.

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's
title: Materials and Device Design Engineer

description:
RBC Bearings is a well-known international manufacturer and marketer of highly engineered precision plain, roller and ball bearings. We have been providing bearing solutions to our customers since 1919. We currently have 31 facilities, of which 28 are manufacturing facilities in five countries. Our selling efforts are supported by a global network of sales engineers, distributors and authorized agents.

RBC/Sonic Industries’ products are found on many major aircraft in operation worldwide. RBC/Sonic Industries produces specialty bolts, fuse pins and close-tolerance machined products for commercial and military aircraft. We specialize in hot-forged, high strength threaded products manufactured from both standard and exotic materials.

RBC/Sonic Industries has an immediate opening for a Process Coating/Additive Engineer .

Position Summary : This position is a key technical connection to the customer, and will work closely with the Sales, Product Managers and Operations in preparing quotes in order to create innovative offerings to achieve Sonic’s growth targets.

The Process Coating/ Additive Manufacturing Engineer will apply statistical methods and perform product/process analysis for cost reduction, quality improvement and improved efficiency and safety, lead activities to move towards a problem-solving and execution culture, manage the development, delivery, and continuous process improvement tools to create business stabilization and assist in the development of standardized work into production crews.

This position is expected to monitor execution plan details, working with different functional disciplines (engr., mfg., commercial, scheduling, quality, and design engineering) to ensure the timely completion of the new product schedules, identification and implementation of process excellence activities for the business; recommend and implement improvements to the production process, methods and controls.

This role is also responsible for the Intellectual Property protection as appropriate.

Key Position Responsibilities:

• Performs failure analysis on ferrous and non-ferrous materials to determine causes of problems and develop solutions.
• Writes specifications (material, process and fabrication standards).
• Interacts with customers resolving technical metallurgical issues.
• Designs and optimizes component and system configurations for HVOF spray and additive mfg.
• Works hands on with various manufacturing processes such as cold spray, HVOF, plasma spray, NC machining, heat treat and additive manufacturing for metals.
• Creates and documents spray procedures for new and existing designs on mechanical components in accordance with current and applicable standards.
• Creates and executes component and system level validation and qualification test plans, as well as analysis of test data and results.
• Provides guidance and experienced technical and support to the product engineering and quality teams on critical issues such as quality and productivity improvements to resolution.
• Communicates with customer and/or vendor to resolve particular manufacturing issues.
• Other related duties as required.

Essential Qualifications, Skills and Experience:

- Master’s Degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Materials or Chemical engineering or related engineering field) required.
- At least three years of experience in analysis of components in relation to mechanical systems, including Finite Element Analysis for structural, fatigue, thermal and vibration.
- Materials properties background and experience as it relates to repair technologies.
- Familiarity with properties of metals and their heat treating processes.
- Ability to apply statistical methods and perform product/process analysis for cost reduction, quality improvement and improved efficiency and safety
- Ability to create, read and interpret models, technical drawings, schematics, and computer-generated reports.
- Skilled in using Solid Works and CAD modeling software.
- Knowledgeable in SPC, FMEA and DOE.
- Skilled in MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
- Good communication skills, written and verbal.
- Be able to work on multiple projects at the same time.
- Skilled in project management.

Desirable Qualifications, Skills and Experience:
- Experience in the fastener industry.
- Skilled in Matlab, and other statistical modeling software.

ITAR Requirement:
- Due to ITAR regulations, this position requires that the employee must be a U.S. Person (U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident) or a Foreign Person for whom a license is obtained.

Quality Requirement:

- Employees will participate as required in understanding, implementing and maintaining the Company Quality Policy in accordance with AS-9100C and/or ISO-9001:2008 requirements.

Physical Requirements/Working Conditions:
- The position is expected to interact with suppliers and potential suppliers, including travel to suppliers and/or customers. This is primarily a sedentary office position with employees working in a controlled office environment. The employee answers telephone calls and occasionally bends, reaches, and pushes and pulls file drawers to file records and reports. Employee moves throughout the building to collect, deliver, and copy documents. The position uses a computer terminal to access, input, and retrieve data. Finger dexterity may be required to operate typewriter, computer keyboard, and calculator.

Employer’s Statement:
- This job description does not list all of the duties of the job. You may be asked by supervisors or
managers to perform other duties. You will be evaluated in part based upon your performance of the
tasks listed in this job description.
- The company reserves the right to change, rescind, add or delete the duties and responsibilities of
positions within this job classification at any time. The job description is not a contract for employment, and either you or the employer may terminate employment at any time, for any reason.

We offer competitive compensation and excellent benefits including Medical, Dental, and a company matched 401k plan.

RBC / Sonic Industries, Inc.

title: Process Coating/Additive Engineer

description:
At Bolt Threads, we believe that answers to our most vexing problems can be found in nature. Every day we’re inspired by the amazing materials we work with, and driven by the desire to turn these materials into incredible products. We are a venture backed, idea driven company, led by world-class scientific and engineering talent, as well as experienced executives from the technology and apparel industries.

PROCESS DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATE

Bolt Threads is looking for a hands-on Process Development Associate to support the development, scale-up, and operations of our recombinant silk protein recovery process. The ideal candidate will have strong technical fundamentals, practical experience in the design and execution of experiments, and a general knowledge of different separations processes and equipment. Experience in protein purification and characterization is a plus. This position will play a key role on a multidisciplinary team working to define down stream recovery and purification processes for recombinant silk proteins.

THE POSITION

Support the development, scale-up, and operations of our silk protein recovery process
Conduct bench scale experiments involving separation processes including protein extraction, TFF and precipitation.
Support developmental methods to assess the yield and purity of protein isolates.
Design and execute experiments, analyze data, write technical reports, and present during weekly group meetings
Develop and maintain mass and energy balances
Evaluate and optimize process performance and product quality quantitatively against defined metrics and manufacturing cost targets
Develop, maintain, and follow standard operating procedures (SOP’s).
Support the manufacturing team and pilot plant as necessary in tech transfer, commissioning, start-up, process stabilization, troubleshooting, and optimization
Work safely at all times

REQUIREMENTS

B.S. in Life Science, Chemical Engineering or equivalent with 1-3 years of relevant experience
Experience with standard unit operations including solid-liquid separations, solvent extraction, membrane separation, centrifugation, distillation, etc.
Experience with protein separations and characterization highly desired
Strong analytical and problem solving skills, excellent written and verbal communication
Ability to lift up to 50lbs and work standing for 75% of the work day.
title: Process Development Associate

description:
Brown and Caldwell, a national environmental engineering firm, has a new opportunity for a student intern to provide electrical, and Instrumentation and Controls (I&C;) engineering support to our project managers in our Sacramento, California office. We are seeking motivated and achievement oriented individuals looking to gain practical hands-on experience outside of the classroom.

When you join Brown and Caldwell you will enjoy a unique and welcoming culture. You will find that we offer a non-hierarchical, collaborative, and supportive environment, allowing you to do your best work. You will be trusted to do the right thing by our project managers and external clients. The work we do is interesting, challenging and wide-ranging in nature, and so is our client base.

Job Expectations:

As a student intern, you will perform routine engineering support duties requiring professional training but little or no experience. You may be assigned, under close supervision, to simple engineering data analysis, data assessment, data entry and formatting and organizing information for reports. You may also perform basic AutoCAD or Revit authoring tool input or modifications to existing drawings, and also provide basic project support such as formatting and distributing meeting notes; project filing, field site visits, and other general support of project engineers.

Desired Skills and Experience:

To qualify for an internship, you must be enrolled in a full-time program (nine credit hours per semester) seeking a bachelorâs degree in Electrical, Mechanical, or Chemical Engineering with a design to work in the electrical or instrumentation or controls fields. You also must be in good standing and carry an overall GPA of least 3.0 in your core curriculum, as well as a minimum overall GPA of 3.0. Candidate must be proficient using Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook), and possess good written and verbal communication skills.
title: Electrical/Instrumentation and Controls Student Intern

description: Associate Scientist, Automated Strain Engineering
title: Associate Scientist, Automated Strain Engineering

description:
At GenapSys we are working to change the world of healthcare and diagnostics. Our team brings together an incredibly diverse and multidisciplinary set of backgrounds and skills – from electrical and mechanical engineers, to physicists, chemists, microfluidic engineers, molecular biologists, bioinformaticians, mathematicians and more. Together we will advance scientific and medical knowledge and improve human health through cheaper, faster, and more accurate DNA sequencing technologies. We are working cross functionally to make a great impact in the world – join us on that mission!

We’re looking for a talented and organized team player to work at a fast-paced startup. This individual will be eager and enthusiastic, and someone who wants to take on many responsibilities. In essence, this position requires someone who is willing to roll up his/her sleeves and work hard to push product development forward. Formal educational background may include: molecular biology, organic chemistry, chemical engineering, biophysics, and bioengineering.

Responsibilities

  • Design, execute, document, and analyze molecular biology experiments
Minimum Qualifications

  • Education: BS in molecular biology, biophysics or chemical engineering
  • Experience: One year laboratory experience with molecular biology methods and tools including PCR and electrophoresis
Desired Qualifications

  • Experience with diverse nucleic acid processing enzymes such as DNA polymerase, DNA endo- and exo- nucleases, DNA ligase, etc.
  • Experience with real-time PCR and isothermal DNA amplification
  • Experience with gel electrophoresis, Agilent Bioanalyzer and ABI capillary sequencer
  • A deep understanding of DNA/RNA structure, stability and folding
  • Programming experience with Metlab, Python, Java or Pearl
  • Familiarity with commercial NGS technologies
Benefits & Perks

  • Competitive compensation and stock options
  • Anthem Blue Cross PPO and Kaiser Medical (including for dependents)
  • Excellent Dental and Vision through Guardian
  • Fully sponsored Life, Short and Long-term Disability insurance
  • FSA, 401(k) retirement plan
  • Stocked kitchen and beverages, daily catered gourmet lunches
  • Weekly Fancy High Tea and Happy Hours
  • Free complex onsite gym membership
  • Learning and growth opportunities
About GenapSys

At GenapSys, we are developing a DNA-sequencing technology that will revolutionize the world of healthcare. Our system will enable fast, accurate, and ultra-low cost genetic tests in order to better understand (and ultimately treat) genetic diseases such as Cancer, Parkinson’s, Diabetes, and Alzheimers, just to name a few. GenapSys was founded by Dr. Hesaam Esfandyarpour, and incubated over 6 years (2004-2010) at Stanford University. The company was incorporated in early 2010 and is funded by leading firms in both venture and institutional capital. We have built an incredible team of scientists, engineers, and business professionals – join our team and be part of the adventure!
title: Nucleic Acids Researcher

description:
Interested in joining a fast-paced, dynamic startup with significant growth potential? BioPharmX is a specialty pharmaceutical company focused on smarter drug delivery to benefit dermatology patients worldwide.

Job Description

BioPharmX is a small company with a passion for introducing novel, innovative products. As a BioPharmX employee, the successful candidate will make contributions at multiple points in the product lifecycle. The successful candidate will have two main areas of focus: coordinating CMC activities (primarily with external laboratories) and analytical method/study design, development, execution, transfer, validation, and/or improvement. The position will report to the Director of Manufacturing & Operations. Up to 25% travel is required.

Responsibilities

CMC Coordination
  • Coordinate with CMOs for ongoing and future stability programs.
  • Analyze trends and write summary reports.
  • Create CMC dossier content from source documentation for regulatory submissions.
  • Write protocols and/or reports for process development and manufacturing studies.
  • Draft and/or review CMC documents as needed.
  • Organize data, maintain records, write reports and communicate results
Analytical Development in Manufacturing Group
  • Assist in experimental design and execution of analytical studies related to pharmaceutical formulation
  • Interface with formulation, analytical, and preclinical groups.
  • Help with hands-on development of analytical methods with HPLC, LC-MS, spectroscopy, microscopy, etc.
  • Coordinate with CMOs to enable successful transfer, validation, and improvement of analytical methods.
  • Perform other tasks as directed by management in support of corporate goals and objectives

Qualifications
  • Bachelorâs degree in chemistry, biochemistry, or chemical engineering; advanced degree preferred
  • At least 5 yearsâ experience in the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry in a technical position
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Experience with drafting CMC sections of an IND, NDA, or BLA preferred
  • Meticulous and able to efficiently support concurrent projects
  • Self-starter with the ability to work both independently and in a team environment
  • Previous hands-on chemistry laboratory experience
  • Good problem-solving skills and analytical ability
  • Ability to travel as required
  • Proficient in MS Office applications (i.e., Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Project)
title: Pharmaceutical CMC Specialist

description:
Amgen discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics. A biotechnology pioneer since 1980, Amgen was one of the first companies to realize the new science’s promise by bringing safe, effective medicines from lab, to manufacturing plant, to patient. Amgen therapeutics have changed the practice of medicine, helping millions of people around the world in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis, and other serious illnesses. With a deep and broad pipeline of potential new medicines, Amgen remains committed to advancing science to dramatically improve people’s lives.

Operations is one of the three foundational functions at Amgen with a mission to be consistent and efficient in delivering safe and effective medicines around the world. Operations manufactures and delivers Amgen therapeutics to our patients. Made up of five functions: Global Supply Chain, Operations Technology, Quality, Manufacturing and Engineering, and spread across nine sites, Operations’ aspiration is simple: Ensure patients have access to the Amgen products they need. Every patient, every time. Process Development is the group that bridges between R&D; and commercial; between the identification of a few drug candidates to a specific disease target and the manufacture and release of a commercial molecule.

Amgen’s 10-12 week internship program offers meaningful project experiences that impact patient’s lives. This internship provides the opportunity for executive and social networking events and to participate in community volunteer projects while providing a competitive compensation.

Limited relocation housing and/or transportation allowance may be available for eligible candidates.

The summer internship will be in the Cell Line Development group within Amgen’s Process Development Organization. This group is responsible for developing cell lines used to manufacture biopharmaceuticals in Amgen’s multi-modal pipeline. The project will be focused on new molecular techniques for increasing the speed for development of cell lines and will involve both molecular biology and cell culture lab work. The candidate will have an opportunity to work on state of the art technology and apply that to enable creation of improved cell lines/culture conditions that will have a direct impact on the ability to manufacture the highly innovative medicines in Amgen’s pipeline.

Basic Qualifications

Amgen requires that all individuals applying for a grad internship or a co-op assignment at Amgen must meet the following criteria:

18 years or older

Graduated with a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with a 3.0 minimum GPA or equivalent

Completion as a first year graduate student before internship starts and currently enrolled in a MBA program for a MBA internship OR a Master’s program for a Masters internship OR a PharmD program for a PharmD internship OR PhD for a PhD internship from an accredited college or university

Enrolled in an accredited college or university following the potential internship or co-op assignment

Must not be employed at the time the internship starts

Preferred Qualifications
Degree concentration(s) in Molecular Biology, Chemical Engineering, OR related discipline
Strong laboratory skills
Ability to learn quickly
Experience in aseptic cell culture, cell transfection/characterization, protein purification, and biochemical assays

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Only candidates who apply via http://careers.amgen.com/ will be considered. Please search for Keyword 33629.

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Strong attention to detail

title: Grad Intern - OPS (Cell Line Development - Bioprocessing)

description:
The successful applicant will bridge metabolic engineering and fermentation process development and will

be responsible for constructing, testing, and screening genetically engineered yeast strains in batch

fermentations. Strain characterization, fermentation development, and exploratory research will be

necessary elements of the successful applicant’s duties. Research objectives are milestone driven and require workflows directed toward achieving these milestones. A strong applicant may be an individual with metabolic engineering experience who would like to develop a skill set in fermentation science.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Collaborate with both the metabolic engineering and fermentation teams to conceive, plan, design, and
successfully complete strain engineering projects and transition the engineered strains to fermentation.

  • Prepare technical reports, quantitative analyses, protocols and scientific presentations.
  • Collaboration with all Lygos’ teams, including metabolic engineering, fermentation, and downstream
purification groups to interpret integrated process data and find creative solutions to problems.

  • Maintain an in-depth knowledge of advances in yeast metabolic engineering and bioprocessing.
ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Work with teams to develop strain, enzyme, pathway, and process-related intellectual property.
  • May also be expected to supervise Research Assistants.
  • There will remain significant time and opportunity to also participate in many other aspects of Lygos’
technical efforts, including: bioinformatics, downstream purification, and other areas of technology development. The Lygos team works closely with all employees to support career development and facilitate the learning of new skill sets.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
  • Energetic, creative, team player.
  • Ph.D. or Masters (with >2 years of relevant experience post-Masters) with an emphasis on synthetic
biology or yeast metabolic engineering and a background in chemical engineering or bioengineering.

  • Demonstrated success in technical proficiency, scientific creativity, collaborations with others.
  • Strong organization skills and proven ability to manage details.
SECONDARY KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL CONSIDERATIONS:
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to deliver on projects and assignments within time frames and budgets.
  • Experience developing small molecule production screening assays that are translatable from microtiter
plates to shake flasks to benchtop fermenters a plus.

  • Experience performing research and technology development in an industrial setting a plus.
title: METABOLIC ENGINEERING/FERMENTATION: SCIENTIST I

description:
Our company started 76 years ago as Hewlett Packard. After a number of company splits, we are today a stand alone company headquartered here in the heart of the wine country in Sonoma County. The HP culture of mutual respect and a collaborative work environment are what helps to differentiate the experience here from other high tech opportunities. Located on 191 acres, our Santa Rosa site is often favorably compared to a college campus.

We have an IC manufacturing operation in our Technology Center here which provides leading edge microcircuits to our internal customers. We manufacture these circuits here, then test and inspect prior to package assembly. In this final inspection and assembly production facility, Die Fab, we have a number of opportunities for process improvement and labor content reduction. We would like to have an intern assist us with several projects which should result in labor savings, resulting in improved operational efficiency.

At Keysight, we help companies address their toughest challenges with precision and confidence. We offer the most precise electronic measurement tools in the industry, with advanced software to match. Our employees leverage their insight and passion to revolutionize electronic measurement and make a difference in the world.

Qualifications :
Join some of the brightest minds in the measurement world. Learn more at www.jobs.keysight.com.

The successful candidate will have completed at least the first two years of a four year program at an accredited university, working toward a degree in Mechanical, Industrial, or Chemical Engineering. Other technical science majors will be considered.

In addition, the candidate will have an excellent mechanical aptitude, outstanding written and verbal communication skills, the ability to deal with ambiguity, and be able to demonstrate that they can work seamlessly with our technicians, engineers, and leadership team.

Keysight Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other protected categories under all applicable laws.

description:
If you’re a quick learner, enjoy working in the biotech industry, and share our mission of providing ground-breaking impact to medicine, each other, and our patients, Sorrento Therapeutics is the place for you!

OVERVIEW:
Concortis, Inc, a subsidiary of Sorrento Therapeutics (NASDAQ: SRNE), is a biotechnology company creating next generation of Antibody Drug Conjugates (ADCs) using our proprietary conjugation technologies and novel drug delivery systems. Currently, we have several programs that are in early stages of development.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:
The ideal candidate will e xhibit technical expertise in antibody purification, antibody-drug conjugation, and chromatography separation. You will be developing in process methods to monitor process progress, skillful in antibody and ADC characterizations.

Required Qualifications Include:
PhD degree in Chemical Engineering, Bioengineering, or Biomedical Engineering or relevant discipline with a minimum 3-year experience in pharmaceutical/biologics manufacturing environment

Previous experience in CMC for biologics product development is required. Previous cGMP experience is preferred.

Thorough understanding of the regulatory process (FDA, ICH, etc) and cGXP environment in biologics development, manufacturing, or commercial product support.

Expert knowledge in antibody drug conjugation, and large molecule purification process.

Demonstrated ability to apply advanced level of understanding to project goals and methods.

Ability to troubleshoot, and proactively seek out collaborators to discuss potential solutions to problems.

Demonstrated ability to work as an independent, self-motivated, detail-oriented, result-driven and highly flexible team-player in a fast-paced working environment.

THE DAY-TO-DAY WORK INCLUDES:
Conduct process development, optimization, and scale-up.

Serves as SME of process/production development of DS in CMC team.

Supervises, coordinates, and document process experiments and cGXP production on pilot scale equipment.

Create, revise and approve batch records, work instructions, and other quality system documents.

Supports regulatory submission activities. Serves as the primary technical resource for the submission, including customer and agency audits.

Communicates project status and technical findings to the project team and the customer.

Oversee the training of the cGXP operation personnel.

Maintain current knowledge of relevant cGMP regulation, regulatory guidance’s, and internal SOP requirements for production activities.

Proactively communicate issues to key stakeholders to ensure a timely resolution and escalate as needed to ensure corporate timelines are met.

YOUR REWARD:
Be on the leading edge of immunotherapies for the treatment of cancer.

Earn a competitive salary that allows you to focus your attention on your passion for science.

A comprehensive benefits package including: medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, matching 401k, 10 paid holidays, and three-weeks’ PTO, plus stock options.

If this sounds like the right career to fit your personality and interests, we’re looking forward to meeting you. Please attach your CV or resume and note the following job title in the subject line: S/SSPD_YZ and email to: Jobs@Concortis.com

NO Relocation Available

ONLY LOCAL CANDIDATES NEED APPLY

Sorrento Therapeutics, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Packaging Lead

description:
To be considered for this position, you must apply at www.pfizercareers.com and search for Job ID 1042243.

Please note, any applications submitted through this website will not be reviewed for consideration.

About Pfizer

A career at Pfizer offers opportunity, ownership and impact. All over the world, Pfizer colleagues work together to positively impact health for everyone, everywhere. Our colleagues have the opportunity to grow and develop a career that offers both individual and company success; be part of an ownership culture that values diversity and where all colleagues are energized and engaged; and the ability to impact the health and lives of millions of people. Pfizer, a global leader in the biopharmaceutical industry, is continuously seeking top talent who are inspired by our purpose to innovate to bring therapies to patients that significantly improve their lives.

Department Marketing Statement

Rinat is dedicated to developing new protein-based therapeutics to improve human life. Rinat researchers use the latest scientific knowledge and apply novel approaches to discover new ways of treating disease. Cooperation and support for a high level of scientific freedom is encouraged to find the best answers to biological questions. Rinat was formed in 2001 as an independent, private biotech company. In 2006, it was acquired by Pfizer, and is the biotechnology unit within

Pfizer Worldwide Research & Development, dedicated to doing its part to fulfill Pfizer's mission of working together for a healthier world. Located in South San Francisco, California, Rinat provides the feel of a small company with the resources of a large pharmaceutical company in the heart of the biotech capital of the world.

Responsibilities

The Protein Engineering Department is seeking an outstanding Senior Scientist to lead protein engineering and technology development projects. The candidate will be responsible for working closely with individuals in both protein engineering and immunology/oncology groups to innovate and develop the next generation of protein therapeutics for cancer treatment. The candidate will have access to state of the art protein and antibody engineering technologies and

will be expected to continue our tradition of developing world class methods and technologies that enhance our therapeutic discovery efforts. The primary responsibilities include obtaining in-depth knowledge of the therapeutic targets of interest and using this information to formulate and design creative antibody/protein based therapeutics with high potential and new functionalities. This position requires the candidate to carry out hand-on lab work to apply protein engineering principles to generate novel protein therapeutics to target the immune system. The ideal candidate needs to have a strong understanding on how to engineer and characterize protein therapeutics. This work will also include close collaborations with biologists to design and evaluate different protein therapeutics of interest. The candidate needs to demonstrate strong desire and initiative to understand immunology and tumor biology, and help propose new ideas and techniques to discover nextgeneration therapeutics with unique functionalities.

Qualifications

  • Ph.D. in Biological Science (Molecular Biology, Structural Biology, Protein Biochemistry, Cell Biology) or a related field (Chemical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering and Biological Engineering)
  • At least 2 years of post-graduate experience in either an academic or industrial setting is preferred
  • Strong track record of scientific accomplishments demonstrated through publications in highly regarded journals and/or intellectual property generation.
  • Track record of demonstrating analytical skills, creativity and unique problem solving skills
  • Outstanding pro-active attitude, interpersonal, collaborative and oral communication skills
  • Strong motivation, passion and commitment to science and engineering novel entities
  • Ability and desire to work in an interdisciplinary scientific team and the desire to learn new techniques
  • Ability to analyze and interpret work published in the field and apply it appropriately
  • Technical expertise should include molecular biology and protein biochemistry, screening protein libraries, ELISA, biosensor, and/or other biochemical and cell based assays
  • Prior experience in working with immune system derived proteins like antibody, TCR, cytokine and antibody-like scaffold proteins is preferred
  • Previous experience with protein engineering techniques such as phage display and yeast display is preferred
  • Prior experience in protein modeling and analyzing protein structures would be a plus
  • Knowledge of translational work involving antibody and protein therapeutics in immunology and oncology would be of significant advantage

Equal Employment Opportunity

Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer.

Job Type: Full-time

Required experience:

  • post-graduate: 2 years

description:
10x is seeking an outstanding engineer to join its Microfluidics group. The engineer must be able to learn quickly, efficiently execute complex microfluidic characterization experiments, and perform data analysis.

Individuals applying for this position must be self-starters, strategic thinkers, action driven, flexible in changing direction and methods, thrive in a fast paced environment, excel at managing multiple priorities, succeed in communicating with all levels within the organization and provide immediate contribution.

Key Responsibilities

  • Perform microfluidic characterization experiments and troubleshooting
  • Assist in data analysis and documentation
Desired Skills and Background

  • BS/MS in mechanical engineering, chemical engineering, bioengineering, or a related field. Industry experience a plus
  • Detail oriented experimentalist in microfluidic testing, data analysis, and device characterization
  • Hands-on experience required in executing, optimizing, and troubleshooting microscale assays

title: Research Associate - Microfluidics

description:
Provivi Overview

We are a Santa Monica-based company, founded in 2013 by Caltech scholars: Professor Frances Arnold, Pedro Coelho and Peter Meinhold. Our mission is to provide disruptive solutions for agricultural pest control that are safe, environmentally benign, and have improved performance. We are hiring the very best and brightest people to develop and commercialize our products.

Role Description

As a member of the Provivi’s R&D; team, you will assist with the development of methods for detection and quantification of small molecules found in fermentation processes and formulated products, help establish quality control protocols for Provivi’s commercial products, provide hands-on technical assistance to maintain analytical equipment in good working orders, and analyze samples supporting various projects. Strong technical, organizational, and communication skills, as well as the ability to develop creative solutions to challenging problems, are essential.

Responsibilities Include

  • Development, validatation, and standardization of analytical methods for detection and quantification of small molelcules found in fermentation processes and formulated products.
  • Analysis and evaluation of material and products at all stages of development process under stringent quality and time requirements.
  • Preparation of research reports, invention disclosures, and Standard Operating Procedures for internal and external use.
  • Review of data for technical content and regulatory compliance.
  • Ensuring that analytical equipment is maintained in good working order; troubleshoot and perform minor repairs as needed.
  • Anticipation of additional resources, consumable, and equipment requirements as needed to ensure that work can be completed within the budgeted time.
  • Remains current with the analytical chemistry literature and champions the implementation of new technology.
  • Maintainance of a safe and orderly laboratory and ensurance of compliance with all safety policies and practices.

Qualifications

  • At a minimum, a B.S. or M.S. in chemistry or equivalent.
  • A minimum of 2-4 years of industrial or academic experience with hands-on experience in analytical chemistry.

Skills:

  • A good understanding of analytical chemistry, organic chemistry and chemical engineering principles.
  • Demonstrated practical ability to develop methods for isolation, characteration, and quantification of small molecuels found in fermentation processes and formulated products using conventional chromatography techniques and analytical instruments including GC, HPLC, GCMS, and NMR.
  • Experience with the development of bioanalytical methods for measuring metabolites in fermentation culture medium and cell lysates.
  • Must be skilled in operation of chromatographic data acquisition and processing software packages such as Chromeleon, Agilent ChemStation and other software tools for data reduction and presentation.
  • Excellent written, reporting, and verbal communication skills
  • Proficient in using Microsoft Office suite including Word, Excel, and Power Point.
  • Ability to prioritize responsibilities and multi-task in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities
  • Must be highly-motivated and capable of working independently to deliver results under tight deadlines
  • Able to lift 15 – 40 pounds.

Contact

If interested, please submit a letter of interest, resume and salary requirements to analyticalchemistryATprovivi.com. Please no phone calls or agency submissions.

Disclaimer: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

title: Associate Scientist - Analytical Chemistry

description:
KEY JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

- Develop new assembly processes from earliest concept thru production ramp.

- Develop process and assembly documentation (work instruction).

- Active member of new-product introduction team, collaborating with other design engineers, logistics, and quality engineering to develop process documentation, process control plans, and production control requirements to ensure the effective and efficient shipment of electronic components in high volume to our customers.

- Provide critical feedback to the NPI team on the manufacturability of the new product by providing/coordinating appropriate DFM reviews. Analyze process capability including design-of-experiments to characterize processes and ensure high quality and high yields.

- Evaluate and establish process capability and take responsibility for assembly yield during the development phase.

- Provide the required process and equipment training for operators, technicians and offshore personnel as products transfer to production.

SKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS:

- Familiar with assembly/process related technical documentation generation.

- Process materials characterization and selection.

- Hands-on experiences of DOE, automated assembly and opto-electronics packaging.

- Familiar with epoxy, FPCB, PCBA and optical packaging or assembly process experience preferred.

- BS or higher education degree in chemical engineering, materials science/engineering, mechanical engineering or other engineering is required.

- Strong interpersonal/team skills, able to communicate and effectively interact with other engineers, supervisors, assembly operators, maintenance, etc. Excellent communication, planning, organizational, and interpersonal skills.

- Knowledge with Six Sigma methodology/tools such as Root Cause Analysis, SPC, FMEA, Control Plans, and Design of Experiments.

- Knowledge with assembly and packaging equipment and related processes.

- Excellent analytical, problem-solving and statistic data analysis skills.

- Excellent technical writing skill.

- Expertise in the development/operation of production tooling and fixtures, and in the use of standard lab tools and metrology equipment.

description:
Develop and improve manufacturing methods, systems and processes to produce Class III medical device (bioprosthetic heart valves) products that meet quality and cost requirements; provide emphasis on combination products, within a regulated environment; utilize engineering principles and other tools and techniques to include DOEs, GR&R;, DRM, Six Sigma, Lean Manufacturing, Theory of Constraints (TOC), Process FMEA, IQ/OQ/PQ, SPC, CAPA and Minitab hypothesis testing to develop robust processes; work with engineering principles within an FDA regulated environment and utilize Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP); serve as a bridge between the R&D; team and the commercial manufacturing team and enable smooth facility transfers; utilize CFD (Computation Fluid Dynamics) modeling and simulation; process development and troubleshooting experience in Chemical Solution formulation to enable understanding of, and improving, the manufacturing of complex and proprietary chemical solutions; work with Heat Transfer, reactors, Mixing Equipment and fluid dynamics; and utilize process control systems to include (PLC/DCS), Data historian and Process automation

Masterâs degree in Mechanical, Biomedical or Chemical Engineering and two years of experience in manufacturing engineering. Must possess at least two years of experience in the following: navigating engineering principles within FDA regulated environment and using GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices); process validation experience (IQ/OQ/PQ) and CAPA (corrective and preventative actions); DOE, GR&R;, Six Sigma, Lean Manufacturing, TOC (Theory of Constraints), Process FMEA, SPC, Minitab Hypothesis Testing and Process Capability Studies; c ontinuous improvement in manufacturing process; p rocess development and troubleshooting in chemical formulation; heat Transfer, reactors, Mixing Equipment and fluid dynamics; and process control systems to include (PLC/DCS), Data historian and Process automation
title: Principal Manufacturing Engineer

description:
At GenapSys we are working to change the world of healthcare and diagnostics. Our team brings together an incredibly diverse and multidisciplinary set of backgrounds and skills – from electrical and mechanical engineers, to physicists, chemists, microfluidic engineers, molecular biologists, bioinformaticians, mathematicians and more. Together we will advance scientific and medical knowledge and improve human health through cheaper, faster, and more accurate DNA sequencing technologies. We are working cross functionally to make a great impact in the world – join us on that mission!

We’re looking for a talented and organized team player to work at a fast-paced startup. This individual will be eager and enthusiastic, and someone who wants to take on many responsibilities. In essence, this position requires someone who is willing to roll up his/her sleeves and work hard to push product development forward. Formal educational background may include: molecular biology, organic chemistry, chemical engineering, biophysics, and bioengineering.

Responsibilities

  • Design, execute, document, and analyze molecular biology experiments
  • Data driven - critically evaluate new/optimized reagents for the GenapSys sample prep
  • Optimize the laboratory workflow associated with the GenapSys platform
  • Help drive productivity increases through technological insights, exceptional time management skills and a ‘can do’ approach to the challenges at hand
  • Collaborate well within a multidisciplinary organization
  • Follow and develop well-documented SOPs
Required Qualifications

  • Relevant education background: BS or MS in Biological Sciences
  • 2+ years of hands-on experience in PCR, qPCR, flow cytometry, amplifications and sequencing preferred
  • Experience with basic molecular biology and biochemistry tools and techniques required, more advanced skills desired
  • Proven ability to solve scientific problems
  • Detail oriented, excellent organizational and communication skills and efficiency at getting tasks done
  • Ambitious and looking to take on additional responsibilities
Benefits & Perks

  • Competitive compensation and stock options
  • Anthem Blue Cross PPO and Kaiser Medical (including for dependents)
  • Excellent Dental and Vision through Guardian
  • Fully sponsored Life, Short and Long-term Disability insurance
  • FSA, 401(k) retirement plan
  • Stocked kitchen and beverages, daily catered gourmet lunches
  • Weekly Fancy High Tea and Happy Hours
  • Free complex onsite gym membership
  • Learning and growth opportunities
About GenapSys

At GenapSys, we are developing a DNA-sequencing technology that will revolutionize the world of healthcare. Our system will enable fast, accurate, and ultra-low cost genetic tests in order to better understand (and ultimately treat) genetic diseases such as Cancer, Parkinson’s, Diabetes, and Alzheimers, just to name a few. GenapSys was founded by Dr. Hesaam Esfandyarpour, and incubated over 6 years (2004-2010) at Stanford University. The company was incorporated in early 2010 and is funded by leading firms in both venture and institutional capital. We have built an incredible team of scientists, engineers, and business professionals – join our team and be part of the adventure!
