title: Senior Automation Engineer

description:
OVERVIEW:

The Senior Quality Engineer - Intraocular Lens will set up and manage the Good Manufacturing Practices for the production of the intraocular lens and accessories. Support the development of the intraocular lens and its accessories. Develop, implement and maintain policies and procedures to ensure compliance with Quality System Regulations (QSR’s) for medical devices. Establish documentation control and approval work flows to support manufacturing and testing for processes, test methods, test results, batch records, etc. for manufacturing. Establish material control procedures and policies for material flow in and out of the manufacturing space. Work with Product Development, Manufacturing, and Quality Control departments to ensure product quality and regulatory compliance. Develop inspection techniques for materials and assemblies for incoming, in-process, and final inspection. Support product audits and audits performed by regulatory agencies.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Read, comprehend and follow documents outlining all procedures related to intraocular lens and accessories
  • Establish and maintain document control practices for the manufacturing area including batch records, data systems, and material release
  • Review test results and release material for use
  • Establish and maintain material control practices for the production area
  • Perform audits of manufacturing practices to confirm operations to established processes
  • Maintain and update equipment development, validation, and installation process
  • Maintain and update the non-conformance handling process for chemistry
  • Control materials for use in manufacturing and non-conforming materials
  • Lead review board on non-conformances
  • Train associates on compliant procedures and practices for manufacturing and good documentation practices
  • Support audits as necessary with information from the manufacturing area
  • Perform corrective actions and root cause analysis as required
  • Initiate change requests and approve change requests
  • Create, review, execute, and approve design and process validation protocols and reports
  • Perform complaint investigations
  • Create, review, execute, and approve material test plans and reports
  • Maintain compliance to latest standards for intraocular lenses
  • Create and perform ad hoc reports as required
  • Maintain design history files and device master record for intraocular lens and accessories
  • Ensure compliance to company’s product development standards for new product development.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:

This position will be responsible for leading project teams and team members without direct responsibility for their performance management.

COMPETENCIES: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Additionally possess all/ some of listed attributes –

  • Prior experience with intraocular lenses is a must
  • Prior experience in quality systems in medical device industry
  • Excellent computer skills with Microsoft Word
  • Professional, responsible, energetic and accountable.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Intellectually curious and eager to learn.
  • Individual must be Quality oriented and possess a natural ability to pay attention to details.

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, and TRAINING:

  • Minimum BA or BS in Mechanical, Biomedical, or Chemical Engineering or equivalent with at least 4 years relevant work experience.
  • Preferably prior background/ experience in Quality Engineering in medical device environment
  • Must be US citizen or Permanent Resident of US (Green-card).
  • Must have at least 5-10 years of relevant Quality Engineering experience including molding and experience with intraocular lenses
  • Proficient with Microsoft office tools.

ABOUT THE COMPANY:

Calhoun Vision, Inc. – a privately-funded medical device company headquartered in Aliso Viejo, California – has developed breakthrough intraocular lens technology for use in cataract and lens replacement surgery. Cataract surgery is one of the most commonly practiced surgical procedures with approximately 20 million surgeries performed globally each year.

The company has developed the first adjustable intraocular lens that allows non-invasive visual optimization after lens implantation and healing. Unpredictable refractive error after cataract surgery is common, even with the latest diagnostic and intraocular lens technology. The only options available for addressing the residual error are glasses, contact lenses, or additional invasive surgery.

Using a proprietary photosensitive lens material, the Light Adjustable Lens (LAL) provides a powerful alternative. Instead of prescribing corrective lenses (glasses or contacts), physicians can apply the patient’s personalized prescription directly into the adjustable intraocular lens in an office-based procedure. This approach will enable physicians to prescribe customized solutions for all distances that fit each cataract patient’s individual needs and preferences.

The Premarket Approval (PMA) application for the LAL has been submitted to the United States Food and Drug Administration (FDA). The Company has assembled a world-class executive team of ophthalmic industry veterans, and has the leadership, resources, and technology in place to transform the worldwide cataract surgery market.

Job Type: Full-time

Job Location:

  • Aliso Viejo, CA

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Quality Engineering: 5 years
title: Senior Quality Engineer - Intraocular Lens

description:
OVERVIEW:

The Senior Quality Engineer -Chemistry will set up and manage the Good Laboratory Practices and Good Manufacturing Practices for the production and quality control chemistry labs. Develop, implement and maintain policies and procedures to ensure compliance with Quality System Regulations (QSR’s) for medical devices. Establish documentation control and approval work flows to support manufacturing and testing for processes, test methods, test results, batch records, etc. Establish practices for test method development, validation and transfer. Establish practices, policies, and procedures for out of specification results and non-conformances. Establish material control procedures and policies for material flow in and out of the labs. Implement software control systems for the laboratories and test data that are compliant with FDA regulations. Support outside laboratory studies that are performed to ensure proper test material controls, protocol creation and approval, protocol execution, data control, and report creation and approval. Work with Product Development, Manufacturing, and Quality Control departments to ensure product quality and regulatory compliance.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Read, comprehend and follow documents outlining all procedures related to chemistry
  • Maintain and update chemistry data system for labs that is compliant to Quality System Regulations
  • Establish and maintain document control practices for the labs including batch records, data systems, and material release
  • Review test results and release material for use
  • Establish and maintain material control practices for the lab
  • Perform audits of laboratory practices to confirm operations to established processes
  • Maintain and update test method development, validation, and transfer process
  • Establish and maintain the out of specification test result process for chemistry
  • Maintain and update the non-conformance handling process for chemistry
  • Control materials for use in manufacturing, chemistry, and non-conforming materials
  • Lead review board on out of specifications and non-conformances
  • Train associates on compliant procedures and practices for chemistry
  • Support audits as necessary with information from the chemistry group
  • Perform corrective actions and root cause analysis as required
  • Initiate change requests and approve change requests
  • Create, review, execute, and approve test method and process validation protocols and reports
  • Create, review, execute, and approve material test plans and reports
  • Maintain compliance to latest standards and compendial methods for chemistry lab
  • Create and perform ad hoc reports as required.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:

This position will be responsible for leading project teams and team members without direct responsibility for their performance management.

COMPETENCIES: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Additionally possess all/ some of listed attributes –

  • Prior experience in chemistry labs in a regulated environment
  • Prior experience in quality systems in medical device industry
  • Excellent computer skills with Microsoft Word and a Laboratory Information Management System
  • Experience in chemistry in FDA or ISO environment
  • Professional, responsible, energetic and accountable
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Intellectually curious and eager to learn
  • Individual must be Quality oriented and possess a natural ability to pay attention to details.

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, and TRAINING:

  • Minimum BA or BS in Chemistry, Biology, or Chemical Engineering or equivalent with at least 4 years relevant work experience.
  • Preferably prior background/ experience in Chemistry Lab in medical device environment
  • Must be US citizen or Permanent Resident of US (Green-card).
  • Must have at least 5-10 years of relevant Quality Assurance or Chemistry experience
  • Proficient with Microsoft office tools

description:
BIOVIA, a Dassault Systèmes brand, supports industries and organizations that rely on scientific innovation to differentiate themselves. Our customer base includes the world’s largest pharmaceutical, chemical, oil & gas, agrochemical, consumer packaged goods, medical device, and contract manufacturing/research organizations.

We’re looking for a dynamic scientist or engineer to work closely with customers and the BIOVIA sales team to provide pre-sales support for our applications that integrate powerful ad hoc investigational analytics with a unique data modeling technology. The software provides real-time, on-demand data access, analysis and reporting of data by the end users themselves, reducing costs by making outcomes more predictable. The Field Application Scientist will have the opportunity to work closely with the sales team providing scientific and technical presentations to promote our products and services, both to new and existing customers. Other key responsibilities will include providing marketing input for product development, coordinating the delivery of services by departments within the company, and proactively managing customer accounts in concert with the sales team. Due to the high customer-facing nature of the role, it requires someone with outstanding interpersonal skills and a willingness to travel up to 30% of the time.

•Advanced degree in Chemistry, Physics, Mechanical, Chemical Engineering or related fields.
•Experience in consulting, technology and/or industries like Oil & Gas, CPG or Chemicals.
•Previous experience and/or familiarity with informatics, predictive modelling, scientific data capture tools, and related technologies preferred.
•Current or previous professional experience within a scientifically based software or technology based organization a definite plus
•Experience in the use of informatics software gained in industry a definite plus
•Experience in selling enterprise software following a structured, value-based sales process
•Technical knowledge in one or more of the following; Java, Perl, C++, XML, Unix/Windows/Linux Platform will be a plus.
•Sophisticated customer facing skills; experience of delivering formal technical presentations to scientific audiences.
•Experience in project management, technical consulting, and experience of delivering technical training preferred.
•Highly self-motivated with ability to work on own initiative as well as part of a larger team.
•Ability to travel overnight.

A joint venture with Carrier Corporation, Sigler Commercial is a sales force responsible for taking commercial and industrial HVAC equipment to market. description:
The Associate Director/Director, Process Chemistry will be responsible for the process development and supply of small molecule drug substance (API), primarily oncology, for all phases of clinical development (process research, scale-up, and process validation) and commercial launch activities. All development projects are carried out entirely by outsourcing with various contract research or manufacturing organizations (CRO/CMO). Candidates should possess advanced pharmaceutical organic chemistry skills combined with exceptional project leadership, organization, and communication skills.

Responsibilities:
  • Execute on supply chain strategy for late stage (Phase 2 through NDA stage) clinical supply
  • Lead process improvement and clinical batch manufacturing for a late stage nucleotide-based API project at the CMO
  • Actively manage development activities including scale up and technology transfer at the CMO
  • Develop a control strategy, process acceptance ranges, operating ranges, and documents in preparation of the validation campaign
  • Collaboratively work with multiple groups within the organization to support the development of the API supply chain in preparation for the NDA and commercial launch
  • Select CMOs for project-specific activities
  • Actively work with contract research organizations to optimize the crystallization process for the last synthetic step of the API
  • Identify source for starting materials and intermediates, and develop plans for consistent and continuous supply
  • Identify key process parameters and relevant in-process controls
  • Derive origins of process impurities and steps for their control, mechanistic studies of reactions when needed, and actively work with contract research organizations on synthesis or isolation of process impurities
  • Represent process chemistry at CMC meetings to provide assessments, evaluations, status, issues, and other relevant technical aspects of the corresponding program
  • Support regulatory submissions by writing, reviewing, and approving specific sections
  • Act as the technical subject matter expert (SME) internally for troubleshooting and other internal assessments
  • Review and approve batch documents for drug substance manufacturing
  • Maintain process trend data to understand process changes
  • Travel: Up to 30%

Requirements:
  • MS or PhD, Organic Chemistry or Chemical Engineering
  • Pharma/biotech industry experience in pharmaceutical process development and drug substance manufacturing preferably at a commercial level for small molecules in oncology (minimum 9 years with an MS, 6 years with a PhD)
  • Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment
  • Thorough knowledge of process chemistry and scale-up with a proven track record in developing and implementing robust and efficient drug substance manufacturing processes
  • Experience handling technology transfer and technical support including OOS, deviations, and troubleshooting of drug substance manufacturing processes
  • Extensive experience collaborating with and overseeing CMOs and third-party manufacturers
  • Experience handling process capability studies to support process validation in drug substance manufacturing
  • Ability to validate late-stage or commercial manufacturing drug substance processes and a proven track record in cGMP manufacturing
  • Broad knowledge of regulatory and quality requirements for pharmaceutical products
  • Experience reviewing and/or authoring CMC section for regulatory submissions
  • Exceptional communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills ensuring alignment with other functions

description:
Amazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers high-profile consumer electronics. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have produced groundbreaking devices like Fire tablets, Fire TV and Amazon Echo. What will you help us create?

The Role:

Preferred Qualifications

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Good time management and organizational skills
  • Good mechanical aptitude

  • Expertise in the portable electronic device space in addition to the Minimum Field of Expertise or familiarity with: Mechanical testing including: Adhesion, abrasion, impact Static & dynamic tensile, shear, compression, bending stiffness & strength
  • Scratch, indentation, hardness, roughness
  • Electrical testing including: Conductivity, dielectric constant & loss ESD, EMI, electrolytic corrosion
  • Appearance testing including Color, gloss, texture
  • Haze, optical & IR transmission, birefringence, iridescence
  • Microscopy, rheology, viscometry, & thermal analysis techniques
  • Wet lab procedures, cross-sectioning & sample specimen preparation

description:
BaySpec, Inc., a San Jose, California based instrumentation power house, a small but rapidly growing company is seeking an experienced Sales Manager or Application Engineer. While our customer base already spans from the traditional areas of optical telecommunication and NIR spectroscopy, we are changing and revolutionizing the way of absorption/reflection, Fluorescence, Raman, handheld and OCT spectroscopic instruments are applied. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to deeply explore commercial applications of hermetically sealed, rugged, miniaturized spectral devices. Candidates who have a passion for acquiring, applying and communicating practical knowledge to audiences of widely varying expertise will find plenty of opportunity for the professional growth. We are seeking Sales Manager or Application Engineer to join for marketing and selling company’s advanced photonics and spectroscopy products.

The responsibilities of the position are split between the following major functions:
  • Making sales calls, join sales trips
  • Supporting customers who are purchasing or about to make a purchase
  • Be responsible for direct sales as well as leading and managing the manufacturer representative channels
  • Aid in marketing by qualifying new markets
  • Soliciting customers by phone or emails or face to face visits.
  • Additionally, the successful candidate will be expected to represent BaySpec at trade-shows and exhibitions
  • Qualified candidates will possess a college level degree and 5 years+ of industrial work experience with demonstrated sales and marketing expertise in analytical instrumentations and or photonics related industry. Some experience in analytical spectroscopy is a major plus. Candidates with equivalent experience will also be considered.
Candidates who have current and past experience in serving the semiconductors, biomedical, biotech, pharma, solar and alternative energy, et al, industries and research and development areas are of most interest. The position is for a full time BaySpec employee located in the company’s headquarters in the Silicon Valley.

Requirements:
  • BS or above degree in Chemistry, Spectroscopy, Biology, Physics, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or any other related physical science or engineering fields
  • Exceptionally qualified candidates will demonstrate expertise in the following areas:
  • Understanding of the basic principles of photonics, spectroscopic instruments, examples would be: lasers, analytical chemistry or spectroscopic instrumentation, etc.
  • Sales background and track records in high tech business, preferable analytical equipments, components and analytical systems a plus.
  • Be responsible for direct sales as well as leading and managing the manufacturer representative channel. This is accomplished by closing existing proposals, generating new opportunities, and expanding the representative network, particularly in the US, and North America market.
  • Great interpersonal skills, communication skills in English, both oral and written
  • Charming telephone manners, patience with customers and colleagues; down to the earth working attitude, a problem solver, able to perform sales tasks with a ‘pick-up-and-run’ approach
  • Any familiarity with one or more of the spectroscopic techniques, such as Raman spectroscopy, UV, VIS, near infrared (NIR) spectroscopic applications or other spectroscopic applications
  • Can work well in a small company environment, strong team player.
BaySpec is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Please send resume to:
Human Resources: BaySpec, Inc. Fax: +1(408)512-5929
Email: wyang@bayspec.com

The Manager of Technical Services Process Engineering Services is required to manage the identification, development, verification and success criteria for new process technologies, and to support improvements to existing process systems. This person will coordinate efforts between technical groups, Operations, QA, Engineering, and Senior Management, and other internal and/or customers, and our external customers. Helps to identify, manage, and recommend production processes for new and existing product technologies in the core categories (Shortenings, Oils, Margarines, Mayonnaise, Dressings, and Sauces) for the company as well as adjacent core categories. Working closely with QA, Plant Operations, Engineering, and R&D; teams, develops and expands the capabilities for the company through planned research and testing at the bench, pilot plant, and manufacturing levels. description:
Job Description:
Quality Systems Manager
Our Mission: At STERIS plc, we help our Customers create
a healthier and safer world by providing innovative
healthcare and life science product and service
solutions around the globe.
Who we are: STERIS is a growing provider of infection
prevention and other procedural products and services
through our family of wholly owned subsidiaries,
including: IMS, US Endoscopy, Albert Browne Limited,
Eschmann Holdings Limited and Synergy Health Limited,
among others.
Summary
The Quality Systems Manager (QSM) assumes overall
responsibility in ensuring that the organization
maintains operational and quality systems in a state of
compliance to domestic and international standards. The
QSM is responsible for the organization, documentation
and maintenance of the quality system to be compliant
with FDA regulations, IS09001, EN46001, and ISO 13485,
resolve long term quality and supplier issues, conduct
system compliance audits, interface directly with third
party representatives. The QSM is also responsible for
ensuring that all design control and product
introduction regulations are being followed and that the
organization's products are being put on the market as
efficiently as possible, and that all Post- Market
Requirements are being addressed in a timely manner. The
QSM also takes the lead in bringing the organization to
adopt and maintain state-of-the-art practices in global
business and quality management.
Essential Work Function
1. Lead the plant Quality staff to ensure compliance to
the overall Quality Management System and to drive
Continuous Improvement.
2. Provide coaching, mentoring and leadership to the
plant Quality staff.
3. Lead and own the plant Management Review process.
4. Ensure and drive compliance with the domestic
regulatory and international standards and requirements.
5. Lead the siteâs quality improvement process;
including data analysis, improvement projects and
process capability to improve key metrics as measured by
the product/process quality dashboard.
6. Manage the complaint handling processes to ensure
customer responsiveness and product and process
improvements.
7. Lead the quality plan development and execution for
manufacturing site New Product Development ensuring
successful product design transfer.
8. Lead qualification and monitoring tasks for
manufacturing site key suppliers to ensure effective
supplier performance in the manufacturing process.
10. The position requires a level of authority to
conduct and direct required activities. Examples of this
are: Quality planning, complaint management, production
and process controls, CAPA management, supplier
management and new product design transfer
11. Perform other duties as assigned.

Education/Requirements:
  • The position requires a B.S. in Chemical
Engineering, Microbiology or similar engineering
field, or in other pertinent science or technical
field. Advanced degrees or Quality Certifications
are also desirable: CQE, CQA, CQMgr., Six Sigma or

title: Quality Systems Manager

description:
Headquartered in Newark California, Kaiam is an emerging market leader in the research, development and manufacturing of optoelectronic equipment used within data-communication centers.

Founded by leading technologists from the optical networking industry, the team has a track record of delivering breakthrough approaches that change the rules of the marketplace. Kaiam are presently implementing a significant ramp plan in terms of people, production and new product introduction. We are now looking to make the key hire of a Senior Quality Engineer, reporting to the Director of Quality.

This role will play a crucial part in overseeing our supplier approval system, conducting audits and improving Supplier Quality Performance, perform quality and failure analysis of customer complaints or returns, while ensuring adherence to Quality Management System requirements. Leveraging your extensive background in Quality Assurance, you will improve the RCCA process and support development of suppliers to meet process requirements at best cost.

Key Responsibilities will include but are not limited to:
  • Responsibility for conducting audits and improving Supplier Quality Performance and ensuring adherence to Quality Management System requirements
  • Drive effective root cause, corrective and preventive actions with the ongoing development of increased supplier capability
  • Receive, log, and track all FA, RMA requests
  • Test and debug failure symptoms of Opto-electrical Transceivers, ICs and PCB boards
  • Publish high quality reports with clear root cause, status, and actions
  • Follow up and close loop corrective actions
  • Interface with sub-contractors and contract manufacturers to identify root cause
  • Work with outside analysis labs for failure analysis and negotiate most competitive price quote for services
  • Improve supplier quality metrics by driving improvement plans with suppliers
  • Drive systematic Supplier Performance Reviews
  • Ensure accurate flow-down of quality requirements to suppliers throughout product life cycle
  • Engage with suppliers to develop a professional and responsive relationship
  • Develop supplier inspection documentation and ensure best practice is adopted within the supply chain
  • Work with the Incoming Inspection Team to drive improved Inspection standards and performance
  • Participates in Continuous Improvement projects
Ideal candidate will have:
  • Bachelors or Masters of Material Science/Chemical Engineering/Mechanical Engineering/Electrical Engineering required
  • Fiber-optics experience required
  • Experience working in a manufacturing organization, preferably as a supplier or failure analysis quality engineer
  • Proficiency in the use of MS packages and display strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Proven experience of root cause analysis with suppliers
  • Proven background in Quality Assurance and thorough understanding of quality tools and techniques
  • Familiarity with FA process and tools
  • Familiar with Jedec, IPC standards
  • Understanding of key quality standard ISO9001
  • Good technical engineering knowledge and ability to read engineering drawings and understand processes
  • Auditing experience / qualifications
  • Supplier relationship management skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Experience within a fast paced manufacturing environment would be considered advantageous
It is essential that the successful candidate has worked within a similar role and is experienced in quality management as you will be expected to:

  • Determine root cause of failures, quality issues and identify and implement corrective or preventive actions of opto-electronics devices
  • Document and track all FA and RMA requests, write formal reports for customers
  • Work with Marketing and Sales, Design and Software groups
  • Drive internal and external manufacturers (fab, assembly, test) to implement improvements and actions as needed
  • Meet the FA or RMA response time goals committed to customers
Our suppliers are based globally and therefore travel is expected for the successful candidate (estimated up to 15%).

Kaiam always strives for excellence so if you can bring us relevant qualifications and experience to help us achieve this then we would like to hear from you. We are looking for employees with talent and potential, so if youâre upbeat and motivated why not join us and be part of something exceptional?

description:
Job Description:DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Perform fundamental research in multi-phase solid
propellant modeling and simulation for Air Force
relevant problems. Work will involve the research,
development, application and validation of physics-based
three-dimensional computational codes to predict the
burning rate of solid propellants as a function of
particle morphology/distribution and propellant strain.
In addition, the models will combine a nonplanar
propellant surface with a multi-phase turbulent
combustion field using both Level Set Methods (LSM) and
Volume of Fluids (VOF) techniques. The computational
codes will be exercised on modern high performance
computing (HPC) platforms.

REQUISITE SKILLS:
*
Fundamental knowledge of combustion and multi-phase
flows
*
Knowledge of solid rocket propellants is preferred
*
Expertise with using HPC-based computational codes
*
Experience with meshing tools, data analysis,
post-processing and parallel computing
*
Proven ability to use C, C++, MATLAB and/or FORTRAN
languages to solve engineering problems
*
A good knowledge of the English language is required
*
The candidate shall be able to operate in a team
environment, and shall have good interpersonal,
reporting and communication skills (written and
verbal)

QUALIFICATIONS:
*
Candidates must have a PhD degree in Mechanical,
Aerospace or Chemical Engineering or in a related
applied science field
*
Early to mid-career level, 1 â 10 yearsâ experience
*
The candidate shall be able to obtain a US security
clearance
*
Must be a US Citizen

description:
The Sr. Scientist, Small Molecule Product Development plans, directs, and executes drug product formulation & manufacturing process development activities in support of development of new products intended for clinical trials and commercialization with focus on sterile liquid dosage forms including emulsions, solutions, gels and suspensions. Conducts research in the area of formulation and process sciences in support of innovative product development both for new chemical entities and life-cycle management of marketed products.

Main Areas of Responsibilities
  • Provides scientific and technical leadership for product formulation development projects and in general, Pharmaceutical Development function. Applies the principles of quality by design (QbD) and statistical process design/analysis to formulation and process development.

  • Demonstrates scientific excellence through scientific reports, published articles in peer-reviewed journals, society participation, regulatory filings, and/ or patents.

  • Represents department at CMC/Project Team meetings and works closely with other Pharmaceutical Sciences departments, Process Chemistry, Toxicology, Regulatory Affairs, Quality, Clinical Development and Marketing to meet project timelines and objectives.

  • Applies current CMC regulatory requirements and guidance to support global registration of new products.

  • Exhibits leadership skills that result in good performance and career development of junior staff.

  • Keeps abreast of current developments in pharmaceutical technology, leading edge technologies and regulatory affairs to contribute to the technical base at Allergan



Requirements

The following listed requirements need to be met at a minimum level to be considered for the job:
  • In-depth understanding of pharmaceutical formulation principles, manufacturing process unit operations, global CMC regulatory requirements
  • Strong organizational skills to develop formulations intended for clinical trials and commercialization
  • Must be able to operate as a functional area leader and utilize knowledge of pharmaceutical science, chemical engineering, literature and experience to guide decisions in complex situations.

Preferred Skills/Qualifications

The below skills are attributes that may not be mandatory, but are definitely desired in the ideal candidate.

Education
  • Ph.D, preferably in pharmaceutical sciences with 4+ years of applicable experience.

title: Operations Manager

description:
UCLA’s Energy Innovation Lab invites Mechanical and Chemical Engineers to join our team to improve the world’s sustainable energy technologies. Our team is developing a new approach to thermal energy storage that can provide high efficiency and performance at low cost using sulfur-based storage media. Our research, supported by federal (DOE/ARPA-E), state (CEC), and industry (SoCalGas), has shown that sulfur provides highly favorable thermal storage and heat transfer capabilities.

We are now preparing to demonstrate the real-world advantages of sulfur as an effective storage fluid for high temperature thermal energy storage systems. Research & Engineering project needs include: development of laboratory and demonstration/industrial scale thermal energy storage systems, thermal systems analysis, heat transfer performance analysis, and storage and containment material interactions. Before this project, sulfur’s properties in this regard have not been extensively explored; therefore, the project offers many exciting engineering and research topics and challenges.

Project Links:

UCLA site: www.WirzResearchGroup.com/ThermalEnergyStorage

CEC site: http://innovation.energy.ca.gov/SearchResultProject.aspx?p=29959&tks;=636154229071904385

Candidate Requirements: We seek qualified candidates with excellent academic or industry record in the fields of mechanical and chemical engineering. Candidates with experience in thermal system design, fabrication, and operation are preferred. Candidates must have strong communication and writing skills, good time-management skills, and the ability to work in an enthusiastic and collaborative environment.

Positions/Appointments: Positions are available for Project Engineers and Postdoctoral Researchers. Highly motivated Graduate Students are also of interest. This is a multi-year project with continued funding from multiple sources.

Applications: Please submit your application at http://www.wirz.seas.ucla.edu/content/join-the-group. Please include: CV, cover letter, contact information for references (at least one) and relevant publications (if any). Deadline for applications is February 15, 2017 ; however, interviews will begin immediately, so applications provided well before the deadline are encouraged.

Job Type: Full-time
title: Project Engineer/Postdoctoral Researcher: Thermal Energy Storage

As a project engineer you will participate in or lead projects related to air dispersion modeling, calculate annual industry emissions (Includes RECLAIM, NOx and SOx), database tracking of chemical usage, equipment permitting, wastewater quality and control, storm water compliance and OSHA compliance.

A Bachelor's Degree or Masters Degree in Chemical Engineering with one to three years experience in air quality/compliance and engineering. Familiar with the South Coast Air Quality Management District's rules and regulations and EPA projects such as NSR, RECLAIM, Title V, GHG, Air Toxics, etc. Experienced in writing technical reports. US Citizen.

title: Chemical Engineer

description:
Join Ecolab as our Reliability Supervisor where you will lead the maintenance department in Ecolab’s largest and fastest growing (by volume) manufacturing plant in western North America.

In this role, you will manage a manufacturing maintenance team for the daily maintenance and alteration of chemical manufacturing equipment, machinery and building structures for the plant and champion proactive versus reactive manufacturing maintenance practices and develop preventative maintenance practices, ensure effective utilization of the CMMS system, and use continuous improvement concepts to promote overall plant safety, product quality and environmental and sustainability initiatives.

Gain recognition for supporting a successful implementation Autonomous Maintenance while helping your team drive OEE in its TPM journey. Enjoy training and learn Ecolab Production System principles and tools.

Expect to advance with opportunities in engineering and production -- relocation will allow you to complete for more senior roles.

Main Responsibilities
Oversee the daily execution of all manufacturing maintenance activities in this chemical manufacturing plant, working with another maintenance supervisor to manage a team of 6 skilled workers to ensure the plant assets are maintained at their designed operating performance utilizing the most cost effective, safe and quality conscious methods possible.
Drive an autonomous maintenance culture and long range maintenance plans, as well as manage some capital projects and installation of equipment in this batch and continuous chemical processing plant.
Prescribe a regular preventative & predictive maintenance program, develop productivity measures and provide team training and support to ensure that manufacturing and facility equipment function as planned to avoid downtime.
Generate and implement ideas that improve OEE indicators.
Location Information: The Maintenance / Reliability Supervisor will work in our chemical manufacturing plant: 18383 E. Railroad St., City of Industry, CA 91748. This a three shift, Monday through Friday operation. The Maintenance / Reliability Supervisor will work during the day with responsibility of a team of 6 mechanical technicians across shifts.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Science or Technology
3+ years’ manufacturing experience in a chemical, food & beverage, consumer products, and/or related manufacturing industry.
3+ years of manufacturing supervisory experience.
1+ years of experience in cross functional project or program management.
No immigration sponsorship available for this opportunity.
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical or Chemical Engineering.
Experience with Total Productive Maintenance (TPM) and implementing Autonomous Maintenance.
1+ years’ maintenance / reliability supervisor experience.
1+ years’ experience applying Lean / Toyota Production System Principles in a Lean environment.
Some experience with Computerized Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS)
A trusted partner at more than one million customer locations, Ecolab (ECL) is the global leader in water, hygiene and energy technologies and services that protect people and vital resources. With 2015 sales of $13.5 billion and 47,000 associates, Ecolab delivers comprehensive solutions and on-site service to promote safe food, maintain clean environments, optimize water and energy use and improve operational efficiencies for customers in the food, healthcare, energy, hospitality and industrial markets in more than 170 countries around the world. For more Ecolab news and information, visit www.ecolab.com .
Follow us on Twitter @ecolab , Facebook at facebook.com/ecolab or LinkedIn at linkedin.com/company/ecolab .

description:
About Us:
BAS Research Center (BAS) is California’s first licensed medical cannabis manufacturing and research group, dedicated to developing breakthrough pharmaceutical grade marijuana products. Our goal is to replace the negative social stigma associated with cannabis, with an all-natural, bio-nutraceutical approach. BAS provides a variety of services to clients, including extraction and contract processing, private label manufacturing, packaging, and labeling. With a focus on standardized dosing, products produced at BAS provide all of the potential medicinal benefits of cannabis, without the risks associated with the variations in the current marketplace. Standardized dosing and research is the first step to confirming the effectiveness of medical marijuana.

Visit Us: www.basresearch.com and BAS Research Featured on Dr Oz.

Responsibilities:
  • Preparing equipment and plant materials for extraction
  • Operating highly sophisticated extraction equipment
  • Processing concentrates and extracts
  • Cleaning and maintenance of extraction equipment and laboratory facility.
  • Maintaining strict inventory records of all plant materials, chemicals and equipment used in the laboratory.
  • Operating, maintaining, and making adjustments and repairs to laboratory equipment such as liquid chromatography systems, pumps, microscopes, balances, centrifuges, and other laboratory equipment
  • Maintaining inventory records of supplies, materials, and equipment, and preparing requisitions as needed.
  • Storing supplies and equipment, disposal of waste according to guidelines, and keeping laboratory, storerooms and working areas immaculate.
  • Washing and sterilizing laboratory glassware.
  • Performing clerical work related to laboratory activities such as word processing, record keeping, filing, and answering telephone inquiries.
  • Maintaining material safety data sheets for all department chemicals and products.
  • Other duties as assign.
Requirements:
The qualified individual will have experience as an Extraction Technician with a background in either Cannabis or Organic and Inorganic Chemistry for medical purposes. Previous experience with oil extraction techniques and familiarity with CO2 extraction processes.

  • 1+ years of experience with Supercritical Fluid Extraction in a Lab that adheres to strict health and safety policies and procedures, preferably a regulated field producing cannabis-infused, pharmaceutical or nutraceutical products.
  • Experience with Extraction Purification and Analysis preferred, but not required.
  • Knowledge of medical marijuana law and medicinal benefits.
  • Effective time-management skills and ability to multi-task.

  • Bachelor’s or Associate’s degree or its equivalent, from a recognized college or university, with a major in chemistry or a related field.

description:
Kite Pharma is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company focused on the development and commercialization of novel cancer immunotherapy products designed to harness the power of a patientâs own immune system to selectively target and kill cancer cells. Our core technology involves the genetic engineering of T cells, or white blood cells, to express either chimeric antigen receptors (CARs) or T cell receptors (TCRs) for the treatment of advanced solid and hematological malignancies. We are on a rapid growth trajectory and have a highly energized and accomplished team. Kite is publicly traded (NASDAQ: KITE) with a current market well over $2 Billion.

We are seeking a Manufacturing Technical Specialist or Senior Technical Specialist to support our new 39,000 square foot biotechnology facility in El Segundo, that includes general laboratories for bio-processing.

Under minimal supervision, this positionâs main accountabilities are focused on the front line technical support of manufacturing operations while closely collaborating with the Quality and Product Sciences Unit.

  • Provide front line technical support for manufacturing of cell therapy products
  • Ensure successful manufacturing production runs by assessing risk, implementing preventative measures, investigating, and troubleshooting equipment and process issues
  • Partner with Product Sciences Team to execute process development studies within commercial facility to further develop a thorough understanding of operating and performance parameters
  • In conjunction with various internal and external stakeholders, investigates and coordinates the resolution of deviations through comprehensive use of Root Cause Analysis tools

  • Cell culture and/or aseptic processing experience
  • Broad technical knowledge of cGMP compliance and experience with leading investigations, writing, deviation reports, change controls, and corrective actions

  • Skilled at creating and delivering presentations

Kite Pharma, an equal opportunity employer, is located in beautiful Santa Monica, CA just steps from Santa Monica Blvd and right off the 10. Role Summary:

They act as internal champion and quarterback, coordinating the cross functional approach required for sustained customer success and growth. Key focus areas will include outcome attainment, retention, expansion, and customer advocacy.

In this role, you will:

  • Own ultimate responsibility for the customer's renewal and for expansion of the platform. Promote maximum value from their investment in Oil and Gas Predix solution, aiming for full utilization of their licenses, identify new opportunities, and collaborate with sales teams to ensure growth attainment and increased footprint.
  • Lead the development and execution of action plans to achieve identified customer outcomes for named accounts by establishing critical goals or other key performance indicators.

  • Manage and coordinate post-sales customer lifecycle activities including training, professional services, technical support, renewals, expansion, and advocacy.
  • Manage customer interactions in a manner that establishes credibility and trust as a business advisor.
  • Lead the development and measurement of key performance indicators for identified accounts to establish a baseline as well as continued reporting capabilities on outcomes achievement.
  • Work with customer advocacy team to develop customer specific case studies and references to share covered account’s success.
  • Achieve customer success outcomes including reduced customer churn, revenue expansion opportunity identification, higher customer product adoption, customer satisfaction, and overall customer health scores.
  • Advocate customer needs/issues cross-departmentally and program manage account escalations.
  • Provide timely updates to sales team about potential commercial opportunities at customer site.

description:
Mechanical Engineer with Manufacturing Maintenance experience needed ASAP!

Growing manufacturing client is looking for a strong Mechanical Engineer with manufacturing operations experience for both new project work and existing process sustainability. Responsibilities will include but are not limited to reduce process and product variability, improve quality, and reduce cost. Mechanical Engineer will have a variety of technical assignments as needed and to create innovative solutions to technological problems. A broad skill set is desired in the areas of mechanical, electrical, instrumentation and process control.

Duties:
Continuously evaluate the process/equipment to improve cycle time, reduce scrap, and improve efficiencies
Assist in the layout and installation of molding equipment, ancillary equipment, system hookups i.e. water, air, power, as well as material handling equipment
Startup and debug new equipment installations in cooperation with Maintenance
Develop and record operating parameters for products on all lines
Analyze and troubleshoot process problems above and beyond the operator's ability
Work without supervision to solve normal production process problems
Manage capital and expense projects
Maintain safety, product quality, and manufacturing effectiveness through daily troubleshooting and resolution of process variation, across all production and process areas
Work with internal and external customers/vendors to resolve technical/quality issues and provide special expertise
Participate in cross-functional work teams (plant staff, operators, electricians, and mechanics, Process Owner, R&D;, Marketing, Vendor and Customer) to resolve problems and develop new products and processes, Start-ups, new products and equipment (supervises installation, troubleshoots initial production, ensures new process stability and products meet requirements, documents and transfers to Production)
Incorporate Continuous Improvement, Six Sigma and Lean Manufacturing principles into projects and operations.
Develop detailed project scopes, draft project Gantt charts, write CEPs and manage projects to completion and in budget

Requirements:
BS Degree in Engineering; Chemical Engineering or Mechanical
5+ years engineering experience in manufacturing environment
Paper background preferred
Project and equipment design experience
Process control, loop tuning, process optimization skills
Strong inter-personal and communications skills
Continuous Improvement principles, Design of Experiments and Six Sigma are highly desirable

Experis is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE/AA)
