title: QC Technical Specialist

description:
We are looking for driven, talented Process Engineers to join our growing Life Cycle Management (LCM) group. The LCM group works as an integral part of our Consumables Development and Manufacturing process and is tasked with increasing quality and yield within our high volume production environments. The individual will provide technical leadership to new product introduction, and production process development. Additionally, s/he will partner cross-functionally with R & D, Quality, Production, Supply Chain, and other engineering groups to develop and sustain processes for new products.

All About You

Responsibilities:

• Participate in consumables development, process development, definition and improvement, and other activities in the making of consumable products or support of processes/equipment used to sequence genomes.
• Troubleshoot new product process issues related to yield, quality and throughput.
• Construct and execute controlled experiments (including DOE's) to optimize processes, address yield and quality issues and drive implementation of solutions into a production environment to meet project goals.
• Analyze process test results, issue reports and make technical recommendations.
• Work cross functionally with R&D;, Manufacturing and Quality to design and develop a robust high volume processes for new products based on CPM (Critical Parameter Management).
• Represent Operations needs on development teams.
• Work cross functionally with Supply Chain, and Manufacturing to enable operations of volume manufacturing.
• Design and develop or source production equipment, and work cross functionally with EHS and Facilities to establish safe production processes.
• Define technical requirements and write procedures to process product.
• Work on teams to develop and transfer new processes/products to production and enhance their robustness.

Requirements:

• Work experience in the biotech, pharmaceutical or semiconductor industries is desirable.
• High level problem solving and reasoning skills required.
• Experience with chemical processes (preferably organic) preferred.
• Experience with statistics, Statistical Process Control and DOE techniques is a plus.
• Experience with high volume production in a high tech, high volume consumables industry is a plus.
• High level computer skills are required. Intermediate level programming knowledge is a plus.
• Experience with product development processes and project management is a plus.
• Good interdepartmental communication skills and documentation skills are required.
• Demonstrated ability to accomplish goals while working across departments is required.

Education and Experience:

• B.S./M.S. in Chemical Engineering, Biochemical Engineering, Bioengineering, Biomedical Engineering, Biotechnical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, or Material Science with 5+ years of relevant experience in production support/sustaining and/or process definition and development, design, scale-up, improvement and validation.
• PhD in Chemical Engineering, Biochemical Engineering, Bioengineering, Biomedical Engineering, Biotechnical Engineering, Bioinformatics, Manufacturing Engineering, Materials Science or Physical Chemistry with 2-4 years of relevant experience in production support/sustaining and/or process definition and development, design, scale-up, improvement and validation.

Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.
title: Sr Engineer - Process Development, Substrates NPI

description:
The University of California is creating a dynamic new university campus and campus community in Merced, California, which opened in September 2005 as the tenth campus of the University of California and the first American research university built in the 21st century. In keeping with the mission of the University to provide teaching, research and public service of the highest quality, UC Merced will be providing new educational opportunities at the undergraduate, masters and doctoral levels through three academic schools Engineering; Natural Sciences; and, Social Sciences, Humanities and the Arts.

The Functional Materials Laboratory directed by Dr. Jennifer Lu is recruiting a highly motivated and qualified researcher specialist to synthesize 3D hierarchical porous carbon-based structures for energy storage and conversion and to train and supervise the undergraduate and graduate students in the group. The successful candidates should have:
• Advanced understanding of electrochemistry, and be well versed in the use of spectroscopic and microscopic material characterization methods to understand relationships between structure and properties.
• Extensive experience in nanomaterial synthesis.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills.
• Strong laboratory managerial and report/paper preparation skills as well as experience in direct supervision of undergraduate and graduate students.

The candidate is expected to become proficient in the experimental and analytical procedures carried out in the laboratory, stay on top of current developments and opportunities in the field of electrocatalysis and electrochemical storage, train and supervise the students in the group in the safe and proper use of laboratory instruments and write scientific reports/papers. Additionally, appointees will participate in planning and execution of research. Travels to NASA-Ames and National Lab User Facilities are required occasionally.

Highly self-motivated individuals who have demonstrated the ability to successfully conduct scientific research independently and have accredited mentoring and leadership skills are highly desirable.

Qualifications: A degree in Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics, Chemistry or a related field prior to starting the position is required. Specialists appointed at the Associate rank should possess a master’s degree (or equivalent degree) with five to ten years of experience demonstrating expertise in relevant specialty. A Ph.D. degree is highly desirable. An appointee at the Associate level should have a record of academic accomplishment including published or in-press research in the field, and a demonstrated record of University and/or public service.

Interested applicants are required to submit 1) a cover letter 2) curriculum vitae and 3) a list of three references with contact information including mailing address, phone number and e-mail address.

Salary is based on the University of California Academic Salary Scales. Review of applications will begin immediately. Position is open until filled with a final closing date of June 30, 2017. Starting dates are negotiable. Please contact Jennifer Lu at jennifer.lu@ucmerced.edu for additional information.

The University of California, Merced is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer with a strong institutional commitment to the achievement of diversity among its faculty, staff, and students. The University is supportive of dual career couples. Salary is commensurate with education, experience, and UC academic salary scales.

Job location Merced, CA
Requirements Documents
  • Curriculum Vitae - Your most recently updated C.V.



  • Cover Letter



  • Reference Contact Information - Please provide name, email address, mailing address, and phone number of three references.



How to apply

title: Associate Specialist Position In Mesoporous Materials

description:
The Senior Engineer job responsibilities encompass developing and conducting a portfolio of R&D; projects on the general topic of energy saving innovations in residential and commercial buildings. The candidate will propose new projects, write and submit proposals, gather building and equipment energy data from laboratory experiments and field sites, analyze the data, prepare reports and technical papers and communicate results with the sponsor. The position includes use of spreadsheet analysis and software tools and gathering data and information on building energy efficiency products and markets from industry and other sources. The candidate needs to understand codes and standards and interpret laboratory and field test data to determine compliance. Supervision of other engineering staff may be required. The Senior Engineer will work very closely with other engineering and technical staff in a team environment.

This is a full time (exempt) position in an office and lab environment in Davis, California. Some overnight travel is required.

You must have legal authorization to work for GTI on your date of hire with no further action required by GTI. Gas Technology Institute is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer, minority/female/disability/veteran.

The candidate must have a good understanding of engineering physics and good oral and written communication skills. Microsoft Office skills are required, especially strong analytical skills using Excel spreadsheets. The candidate must be able to develop and submit written proposals in response to RFPs from funding agencies. Experience with building energy modeling tools (EnergyPlus, EnergyPro) is required. The ability to understand and communicate complex technical concepts is highly desired. The candidate must be able to manage several projects simultaneously and produce deliverables according to a schedule. Prior supervisory experience is desirable. Field work may require driving a vehicle and installing instruments in residential and commercial buildings.

A B.S. degree in mechanical or chemical engineering plus 10-15 years of relevant experience is required. An M.S. plus 10 years of relevant experience is desired. Degrees in other technical fields will be considered.

description:
Engineer

To provide engineering services to Sacramento Operations for both new project work and existing process sustainability. Reduce process and product variability, improve quality, and reduce cost. Responsible for a variety of technical assignments as needed and to create innovative solutions to technological problems. A broad skill set is desired in the areas of mechanical, electrical, instrumentation and process control.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following:
• Continuously evaluates the process/equipment to improve cycle time, reduce scrap, and improve efficiencies.
• Assist in the layout and installation of molding equipment, ancillary equipment, system hookups i.e. water, air, power, as well as material handling equipment.
• Startup and debug new equipment installations in cooperation with Maintenance.
• Develop and record operating parameters for products on all lines.
• Analyzes and troubleshoots process problems above and beyond the operator’s ability.
• Works without supervision to solve normal production process problems.
• Manage capital and expense projects.
• Maintain safety, product quality, and manufacturing effectiveness through daily troubleshooting and resolution of process variation, across all production and process areas.
• Works with internal and external customers/vendors to resolve technical/quality issues and provide special expertise.
• Participates in cross-functional work teams (plant staff, operators, electricians, and mechanics, Process Owner, R&D;, Marketing, Vendor and Customer) to resolve problems and develop new products and processes.
• Start-ups, new products and equipment (supervises installation, troubleshoots initial production, ensures new process stability and products meet requirements, documents and transfers to Production).
• Incorporates Continuous Improvement, Six Sigma and Lean Manufacturing principles into projects and operations.
• Develops detailed project scopes, drafts project Gantt charts, writes CEPs and manages projects to completion and in budget.

Requirements:
BS Degree in Engineering; Chemical Engineering, Pulp and Paper Science or Mechanical preferred.
5+ years engineering experience in manufacturing environment. Paper background preferred.
Project and equipment design experience.
Process control, loop tuning, process optimization skills.
Strong inter-personal and communications skills.
Continuous Improvement principles, Design of Experiments and Six Sigma are highly desirable.

Language / Communication Skills
Ability to communicate effectively with subordinates, peers and upper level management.
Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating manuals, procedure manuals, blueprints, and maintenance manuals.
Ability to prepare presentations and speak effectively before employees of the organization.
Ability to teach and coach employees on processing and troubleshooting.
Ability to communicate in a timely and efficient manner.
Ability to compile and complete reports in a timely and efficient manner.

Reasoning Ability
Strong problem solving skills with the ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions in a disciplined manner and effectively propose and carry out effective solutions to a range of complex problems is mandatory. Ability to manage multiple priorities, have good interpersonal and leadership skills; planning and organizing skills; problem solving and reasoning skills using quantitative and qualitative information

Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by the employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the position.
- a great amount of standing and walking.
- occasionally lift up to 50 pounds with no assistance.
- rarely, lift 50 pounds above shoulder height.
- stand, walk, bend, kneel, stoop, squat, and crouch.
- reach above, at, below, and to the side, while twisting body and twisting at waist.
- climb stairs and ladders.
- wear PPE (ear plugs, safety glasses, gloves, etc)

Work Environment
While performing the duties of this job the employee will work in an environment with:
- above normal heat conditions - flashing lights
- noise levels exceeding 90 decibels - sirens and horns
- light dust in the air - powered moving equipment passing nearby
- moving machine parts - cool temperatures

Expected Hours of Work
This is a full-time position with additional hours as workload requires.
Employee must be able to work various hours and various shifts.
The facility is a 24/7 operation which includes weekdays and weekends.
Position requires an “on call” status 24 hours a day – 7 days a week.
Travel may be required.
Maintaining good attendance is required.
title: Engineer

description:
BioMarin is the world leader in delivering therapeutics that provide meaningful advances to patients who live with serious and life-threatening rare genetic diseases. We target diseases that lack effective therapies and affect relatively small numbers of patients, many of whom are children. These conditions are often inherited, difficult to diagnose, progressively debilitating and have few, if any, treatment options. BioMarin will continue to focus on advancing therapies that are the first or best of their kind.

BioMarin’s Technical Operations group is responsible for creating our drugs for use in clinical trials and for scaling production of those drugs for the commercial market. These engineers, technicians, scientists and support staff build and maintain BioMarin’s cutting-edge manufacturing processes and sites, provide quality assurance and quality control to ensure we meet regulatory standards, and procure the needed goods and services to support manufacturing and coordinating the worldwide movement of our drugs to patients. Come join our team and make a meaningful impact on patients’ lives.

SUMMARY

This role provides support to Manufacturing for a variety of Compliance functions. This is primarily a service related function to maintain optimal continuity and quality of operations in four Manufacturing plants. A key job function includes development and publishing of performance metrics from various sources to management levels. This role also includes ownership of unexpected material incidents, such as container leaks or integrity failures. This includes ownership of change control records in Trackwise for Supplier Change Notifications as well as CAPAs. Training of multiple staff or departments is occasionally required for this role. Additional responsibilities include contributory roles in regulatory inspections and audits.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Contribute to performance metrics for Quality/Compliance related topics, such as Deviations, CAPAs, Effectiveness Checks, etc.
  • Contributes to audit/regulatory agency observation responses, including tracking of timelines, status, and completion
  • Supports communication of GxP initiatives
  • TrackWise deviation processing, including global/multi-plant issues
  • Trackwise change control processing, including cross functional changes
  • Works with Quality to facilitate, coordinate, or participate in MFG support for inspections (e.g. serve as scribe, doc runner, or similar)
  • Participates in investigations, including determination of root cause and evaluation, initiation, and ownership of CAPA’s, possibly across campus
  • Maintain and report out metrics for regulatory inspections and audit commitments
  • Participate in impact assessment for SCN (supplier change notifications)
  • Prepare, contribute to, and present quality related trainings including those related to deviation/CAPA
  • Processing of Material Incidents, including those effecting multiple facilities
  • 2-6 years of relevant experience in Pharmaceutical Manufacturing or Quality Control or Quality Assurance
EXPERIENCE

Required Skills:
  • General understanding of cGMP requirements as it pertains to therapeutic manufacturing processes and equipment.
  • Good interpersonal skills which promote cross-functional collaboration.
  • Technical writing and experience writing technical reports.
  • Understands Quality Control and regulatory aspects of cGMP production of therapeutic enzymes.
  • Good knowledge of GXP regulatory requirements and is able to effectively transfer the required principles to manufacturing front line as well as management personnel.
Desired Skills:
  • Preferred - hands-on experience in mammalian cell culture, bacterial fermentation, and/or therapeutic protein purification techniques at lab, pilot, and manufacturing scales.
  • Experience in Trackwise, Compliance Wire, advanced Excel skills.
  • Project Management experience.
EDUCATION
  • B.S. in Biology, Chemical Engineering, Biochemistry, Microbiology
CONTACTS

Collaboration with multiple other departments on behalf of Manufacturing is required, including Facilities, Purchasing, QA Lot Release, QA Technical Services.

SUPERVISOR RESPONSIBILITY

No direct reports. Indirect supervision and accountability management of some Manufacturing staff related to projects.

title: Senior Scientist

description:
G.S. Cosmeceutical, a leading Bay Area anti-aging skincare contract manufacturer located in Livermore, California, has an immediate need for a Senior Scientist and Formulation Chemist

Summary:

  • Thorough knowledge of formulation of personal care products including OTC and drug products.
  • Passion to explore and innovate with new raw materials and processing techniques.
  • Work as a hands-on formulator and applications scientist.
  • Develop new formulations, optimize/reformulate existing products and support technical transfer for scale-up
  • Maintain accurate record of all applicable data and testing in the laboratory software, including a detailed manufacturing procedure
  • Prepare stability protocols and conduct physical stability testing (at controlled temperatures) necessary to evaluate robustness of formulas under development and report results
  • Work with outside laboratories and vendors as necessary to test and source raw materials and formulations.
  • Develop product specifications (viscosity, specific gravity, pH, etc.)
  • Provide technical assistance related to product formula to various departments as required (i.e. bulk production, quality and regulatory, marketing, QA, customer inquiry)
  • Create, review and approve technical documents to support developmental projects (i.e. ingredient statements, manufacturing batch tickets, formula costs, etc.)
  • Prepare clear and concise status and summary reports on projects.
  • Must be a detail-oriented individual able to manage and prioritize a number of projects.
  • Able to multi-task and problem-solve, while maintaining a clear sense of focus.
  • Able to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Works well with minimum supervision in the development of a variety of skin care products in a timely manner.
  • Works well in a team environment to track project developments and create new formulations to support customer expectations.
  • Train new team members as necessary.

Qualifications

  • Minimum of BA or BS in chemistry, chemical engineering or equivalent science degree
  • +5 years of previous formulation and product development experience
  • Knowledge of chemistry, skin biology, raw materials and emulsion technology
  • Strong problem solving, interpersonal, teamwork, project management and communication skills (oral & written)
  • Must be a self-starter with a high level of initiative
  • Must be flexible, able to handle multiple projects simultaneously and work well under pressure

  • Chemist: 5 years

description:
Summary

World Oil Refining has an exciting opportunity for a Petroleum Chemical / Process Engineer at its South Gate, CA facility. The successful candidate must have qualifications in Chemical Engineering, Process Engineering or Petroleum Engineering (Downstream), and have a minimum work experience of 3-5 years, preferably with exposure to oil refineries, process plants and other downstream operations. The ideal candidate is team-oriented, self-starter responsible for providing support to Operations and assisting on the quality assurance and refining economics functions to achieve maximum refinery safety, efficiency and economy. While a strong operational background is preferred, additional experience in consulting or professional services is favorable.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Optimization and troubleshooting of daily refinery operations based on review of process data and evaluation of laboratory results.
  • Identify, monitor, and report on key performance indicators for process units.
  • Provide technical support needed to ensure facility compliance with environmental operating limits, participation in HAZOP studies, inspection and verification of process equipment during large scale unit maintenance events (includes work at heights and confined spaces), and participation & leadership of incident investigations.
  • Developing refinery improvement projects, from conception through start-up, to ensure viability of the refinery.
  • Support process control and compliance data systems from field device level to distributed control system and hardware components.
  • Utilize computer programs, such as HYSIS and heat exchang rating programs, to identify inefficiencies, design new projects, and optimize unit operations.
  • Management of catalyst operating process conditions, selection and yield optimization.

Key Accountability:

  • Assess any recommendations with the Director of Operations to reduce product quality give-away and optimize energy performance.
  • Monitoring and compiling process and analyzer data packages for process improvements and required environmental reporting.
  • Follow up with the Director of Operations to ensure recommendations are made to optimize product volume, yield and quality, minimize operating costs and maximize unit reliability at planned throughput.
  • Participate in daily operations review and follow upon the operations targets when/ as required by type of feed stock; chemical additives type/doses, water treatments, operations troubleshooting, etc.
  • Identify unit and equipment operating limits (short and long term), assess equipment performance capabilities together with the Operations and Process managers.
  • Utilize, maintain and develop monitoring tools of refinery process and equipment to aid process monitoring, troubleshooting and design.
  • Seek opportunities to increase unit performance by developing engineering projects as required, develop field changes.
  • Document plant tests and define optimum operation parameters based on results.
  • Point of contact between process and laboratory needs.
  • Review the design of the refinery upgrade projects and provide recommendations for improvements/ compliance.
  • Monitor unitâs efficiency and performance and recommend means of improvements.

Basic Qualifications:

  • B.S. Chemical Engineering or equivalent.
  • 3-5 years of experience in a chemical process environment (refinery, chemical process plant, etc.).
  • Excellent communication, time management and interpersonal skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to interact well within a multidisciplinary team.
  • Willingness to spend time in the field is expected.
  • Demonstrated experience with engineering software applications.
  • Proficiency required with data acquisition systems, process control design and algorithms, and CEMS units.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Refinery experience with direct experience in refinery unit operations.
  • Basic understanding of refining processes and economics.
  • Working knowledge with HYSIS, Pro2, PI or other software programs

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

description:
In this role, you will build and manage a team at the forefront of NGS assay R&D; to create the assay platforms to meet GRAIL’s research and product goals. Working cross-functionally with computational, software, clinical and operational groups you will execute critical R&D; projects. You will be an author and champion of GRAIL’s R&D; processes and advocate of GRAIL’s scientific culture of rigor.

TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Build GRAIL’s deep bench of knowledge in assay technology and assay development processes

Apply knowledge of biochemistry and molecular biology to develop robust assays with streamlined workflows

Establishes operational objectives and work plans, delegating and empowering team members

Establish modern best practices and processes for assay research and development

Monitor the NGS space and related fields to identify emerging technologies and niches offering new sequencing opportunities that can be leveraged

Build and develop a team of assay scientists with the diverse scientific and technical skills required to execute projects

Motivate and mentor employees both within and outside their teams

Collaborate closely with GRAIL’s teams, including our clinical, software, computational, operations, and statistics

Promulgate a culture of scientific curiosity and rigor

REQUIRED BACKGROUND

Ph.D. in Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Bioengineering, Chemical Engineering, or relevant discipline

7+ years of industry experience in the Life Sciences or Diagnostics industry

Proven track record creating successful NGS assays used in major research projects and products, demonstrated by publications and products

Proven track record building and leading assay development teams

Expert knowledge and contribution to the field of NGS-based genetic assays and molecular biology methods for nucleic acids analysis, demonstrated by publications and patents

Demonstrated ability to optimize processes and protocols, particularly for complex workflows

Experience with assay automation

Experience transferring a product to a clinical and/or production laboratory

Experience with design, execution and interpretation of DOEs, stability and analytical studies

Excellent oral and written communication skills

PREFERRED BACKGROUND

10 years of industry experience preferred

Experience working in a regulated environment

description:
KNF Neuberger is an international engineering and manufacturing organization, specializing in high quality pumps and compressors, with an excellent reputation in the medical device, research and environmental industries.

We are looking to hire a Regional Sales Manager for our Western Territory. This territory includes: California, Washington, Oregon, Idaho, Montana, Wyoming, Nevada, Utah, Colorado, Arizona, and New Mexico.

As part of our Laboratory Sales team, this position will be responsible for managing sales within the Laboratory Market. Our product line includes Liquid Pumps, Vacuum Pumps, Vacuum Pump Systems, Rotary Evaporators and their associated parts and accessories. This will include direct sales as well as management of distributor and independent representative sales partners.

Specific responsibilities include:

  • Establish KNF as the premier supplier of all KNF Lab Market products including Liquid Pumps, Vacuum Pumps, Vacuum Pump Systems, and Rotary Evaporators. This includes selling the KNF equipment as well as providing system in-service, operational training and after-sale support.
  • Utilize existing industry/market knowledge to fully develop the business potential in the region.
  • Conducting regular meetings and co-travel with distributor and independent representatives in support of their KNF sales activities.

  • Attend relevant trade shows and regional industry meetings.
  • Utilize existing industry/market knowledge to fully develop the business potential in the region.
  • Assist the KNF Sr. Manager, Laboratory Products in devising and implementing sales, service and distribution strategies for the region in order to achieve significant and sustainable sales growth.
  • 75% travel within the designated region, typically not exceeding 50% overnight travel.

To qualify for this position, the ideal candidate should possess:

  • Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents

KNF offers competitive compensation and an exceptional benefits package, including medical/dental coverage, paid time off, a generous incentive bonus and 401(k) plan.

To learn more about KNF, please visit our Careers page: www.knfusa.com/careers

title: 4858 - CONFIDENTIAL - Sales Representative - San Deigo

description:
Introduction:

Design Group is a leading engineering, systems integration, and technology consulting firm, capable of providing complete operating solutions for consumer products, life sciences, and other industrial sectors. Design Group provides engineering, project management, regulatory compliance, and other technology services to the world’s leading companies.

Our organization is staffed by over 1,000 engineering and technical specialists, operating from over 35 offices in the U.S. and Puerto Rico. Design Group provides professional engineering, architectural and construction management services through our wholly-owned and professionally licensed subsidiary, Design Group Facility Solutions, Inc.

We are focused on providing our professionals with opportunities for leadership and career advancement within a thriving work environment and a unique “people-centric" culture. We offer a robust, centralized learning and development program to improve the career experience for every professional.

Responsibilities:

  • This position will be responsible for managing all aspects of process system installations including design development, engineering, equipment procurement, installation and construction bid packages, OEM/Vendor and Contractor management, process electrical, control & instrumentation integration, installation/start-up/commissioning support, and document control. The position will also involve business development, office management and significant customer interaction.
  • This position requires strong process engineering and project management skills with a working knowledge of process flow diagrams, piping & instrument diagrams, equipment arrangements, piping system design, material handling, equipment & installation specifications, functional specifications, as well as process instrumentation & control principles. A practical understanding of sanitary design and construction methods is preferred.
  • This position requires strong analytical skills, a sound understanding of project management fundamentals as well as strong computer skills (Microsoft Office, Microsoft Project, & AutoCAD).
  • This position will lead a multi-discipline cross-functional project team and therefore requires an individual who is task/results oriented with strong leadership skills and a commitment to deliver against project business, technical, schedule and budget goals.
  • This position must communicate effectively with Clients, Vendors, Contractors and other Design Group employees at all levels of responsibility.

Education:

  • B.S. in Mechanical or Chemical Engineering is preferred but consideration will be given to other engineering degrees based on actual project experience

Experience

  • Minimum 7 – 15 years of industrial project engineering and project management experience involving automated processing systems as well as related facility and infrastructure improvements, preferably in the food & beverage industry.
  • Experienced in developing and installing large-scale industrial chemical blenders and purifiers.
  • Advanced working knowledge of electromechanical equipment, and chemical engineering
  • Provide project leadership to drive sustaining operations supporting chemical delivery group
  • Lead the Bulk Chemical Delivery design group.
  • Manage multiple professionals in the operations and sustaining of chemical delivery area.
  • Provide concept, design, sourcing and project management for the bulk solvent purification systems.

Travel:

20% regional travel will be required on a sporadic basis to support installation and start-up activities, and attend meetings.

Benefits:

Design Group offers a team focused work environment with a competitive salary, performance based incentive pay, and benefits including medical, dental, life insurance, and 401(k) with matching contributions.

Other:

Design Group is an equal opportunity employer. M/F/D/V

All applicants must be authorized to work in the US.

Hair Sample Drug Screening is part of our employment process.

This organization uses E-Verify.

Design Group operates as an independent and autonomous unit of Barry-Wehmiller Companies, a leading supplier of engineering consulting and manufacturing technology across a broad spectrum of industries. With more than 11,000 team members spread among 100-plus locations around the globe, we remain united by a common belief: we can use the power of business to build a better world. For more information, visit our CEO’s blog at www.trulyhumanleadership.com.

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Process Engineering: 10 years
  • Food & Beverage Industry: 7 years
title: Sr Process Engineer

description:
KEY JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

The ideal candidate will have demonstrated ability in the following areas:

• Develop new assembly processes from earliest concept thru production ramp. Lead the process development including identification of materials as well as specification of automation and assembly equipment
• Active member of new-product introduction team, collaborating with other design engineers, logistics, and quality engineering to develop process documentation, process control plans, and production control requirements to ensure the effective and efficient shipment of electronic components in high volume to our customers
• Provide critical feedback to the NPI team on the manufacturability of the new product by providing/coordinating appropriate DFM reviews. Analyze process capability including design-of-experiments to characterize processes and ensure high quality and high yields
• Evaluate and establish process capability and take responsibility for assembly yield during the development phase
• Provide the required process and equipment training for operators, technicians and offshore personnel as products transfer to production
• Coordinate design and fabrication of process tooling fixtures
• Work with sub-contractors to ensure their processes meet our design requirements, committing to development schedules, and meeting project milestones
• Travel to interact with overseas production facilities (Malaysia and China)

SKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS:

The ideal candidate will have demonstrated ability in the following areas:

• Minimum five years of relevant experience in assembly process development for microelectronic, optoelectronic and fiber-optics components and assemblies
• Proven success with hands-on experiences of automated assembly and opto-electronics packaging
• Expertise on epoxy, FPCB, PCBA and optical packaging or assembly process experience preferred
• Proven track record of successfully transferring products into high volume manufacturing, including frequent interaction with manufacturing teams both as part of transfer activities and ongoing cost/yield improvement projects
• MS or higher education degree in chemical engineering, materials science/engineering, or other engineering is required.

Skills
• Strong interpersonal/team skills, able to communicate and effectively interact with other engineers, supervisors, assembly operators, maintenance, etc. Excellent communication, planning, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
• Proficient with Six Sigma methodology/tools such as Root Cause Analysis, SPC, FMEA, Control Plans, and Design of Experiments
• Familiar with passive and active components alignment, Knowledge of opto-electronic packaging design and assembly
• Hands-on experience and knowledge with various SMT and Flip Chip assembly equipment and processes such as auto epoxy dispensing, auto high accuracy die bonding and active alignment, etc.
• Excellent analytical & problem-solving skills.
• Knowledge of SolidWorks mechanical design and DOE software is preferred.
• Expertise in the development/operation of production tooling and fixtures, and in the use of standard lab tools and metrology equipment.
title: Sr. OSA Process Engineer

description:
Why E & J Gallo Winery

E. & J. Gallo Winery was founded by two entrepreneurs—Ernest and Julio Gallo with a vision to democratize wine in the United States becoming the largest winery in the world. This spirit continues today, where Gallo offers opportunities where we value innovation, collaboration, and creative thinking.

The Winemaker, New Products supports new wine development projects and wine related research projects which result in the creation of new or improved wine products. Uses wine profiles designed by the new product development project teams; applies knowledge and expertise and executes the production of new wines for the portfolio.

What You Will Do
  • Work with winemaking colleagues and management team to develop new wines in support of branded business requirements.
  • Partner with production winemaking and wine & grape supply teams to ensure the feasibility of scaling-up wines as part of the development process.
  • Screens and selects wines; develops, formulates and tests new wine products.
  • Collaborate with winemaking teams, C&PI;, and brand teams to develop new wine styles
  • Create prototypes for evaluation by stakeholders
  • Participate in the development of appropriate methodology and timeframes needed to develop products, along with consumer insights, marketing and product development, process technology, research and winemaking partners.
  • Identifies aromas and flavors in wines; recommends treatments to capture the desired end profile.
  • Organizes and participates in wine tasting process; attains wine flavor profiles which meet marketing needs.
  • Evaluates the development and the execution practices of new wine products; implements production of new approved wines.
  • Conducts and monitors wine stability and long term stability evaluations.
  • Maintains confidentiality to proprietary information, processes, and wine/product formulations.
  • Applies TTB regulatory standards as it pertains to developing new wines.
  • Participates in department and interdepartmental planning and management teams; works cross -functionally to develop and implement new wine products on schedule and within prescribed budget.
  • Monitors and helps ensure goal achievements, objectives, and the successful completion of project timelines.
  • Assesses the product portfolio for diversification and performance, recommends opportunities for growth and improvement and assists in guidance of the development of the individual wine style targets for new brands and products.
  • Responsible for understanding and complying with applicable quality, environmental and safety regulatory considerations. If accountable for the work of others, responsible for ensuring their SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Develops, coaches and mentors direct reports and others on the winemaking team
  • Conducts performance evaluations, recommends salary adjustments, rewards employees and takes disciplinary action as necessary, understanding and compliance
What You Need
  • High school diploma or GED from an accredited institution.
  • Master’s degree or Bachelor's degree in Enology, Winemaking, Viticulture or Fermentation Science, plus 7 years of enology or winemaking experience OR Masters or Bachelor’s degree in Food Science, Biology, Chemistry, Microbiology, Biological Engineering or Chemical Engineering, plus 8 years Enology or Winemaking experience with increasing levels of responsibility.
  • Experience crafting wines from multiple grape varietals to achieve a variety of styles at many different price points.
  • Required to lift and move product and equipment weighing up to 45 pounds.
  • Required to possess the vision necessary to judge wine color.
  • Skilled in the use of MS Word and Excel at a basic level.
  • Skilled in reading, analyzing and interpreting common scientific and technical journals, financial reports and legal documents.
  • Skilled in writing presentations, speeches and articles for publication that conform to prescribed style and format.
  • Experience executing complex project work with organizational agility in a highly diverse team environment.
What Will Set You Apart
  • Master’s degree or Bachelor's degree in Enology, Winemaking, Viticulture or Fermentation Science, plus 9 years of Enology or winemaking experience OR Masters or Bachelor’s degree in Food Science, Biology, Chemistry, Microbiology, Biological Engineering or Chemical Engineering, plus 10 years Enology or winemaking experience with increasing levels of responsibility.
  • Computer skill requirements include: intermediate MS Word, Excel, Access and PowerPoint.
  • Skilled in applying advanced mathematical concepts such as exponents, logarithms, quadratic equations and permutations.
  • Experience with defining problems, collecting data, establishing facts, and drawing valid conclusions.
  • Experience with interpreting an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and dealing with several abstract and concrete variables.
  • Experience with working under different climatic conditions.
  • Experience with carrying out assignments that are broad and difficult in nature, requiring originality and ingenuity.
  • Strong working knowledge of all-winemaking equipment, processes and procedures at assigned location(s).
.Gallo does not sponsor for employment based visas for this position now or in the future.

The Plant Manager is responsible to plan, direct, and coordinate all efforts at the facility. The Plant Manager has ultimate responsibility for all operations within facility including safety, health, environmental, quality, production, analytical, distribution, material management, and maintenance performance including compliance with all Airgas Policies, DOT, OSHA, EPA, and other State and Federal regulations.

• Prepare the facility budget and manage expenditures to ensure costs are adequately controlled.
• Recruit and train as needed to ensure adequate levels of staffing exist.

description:
Mendel Biological Solutions, LLC invites applicants for the position of Senior Engineer – Fermentation Leader. The successful individual will lead a team responsible for optimizing and scaling-up the fermentation of microorganisms identified as bio-fertility agents or biostimulants. The position requires a deep understanding of, and experience with scaling-up fermentation processes, technology transfer to and from pilot plants, and general microbiology.

A Day In The Life Typically Includes:

Responsibilities will include close collaboration across a team of scientists, formulators and commercial fermentation vendors to scale the production of biological products to meet cost and volume targets. The successful candidate will have demonstrated experience managing projects and people focused on culturing a diverse array of microbes, including fungi and bacteria isolated from the environment – and bringing those products into commercial production.

What You Will Need:
  • Experience in Research & Development-scale fermentation
  • Excellent analytical, written and oral communication skills and ability to report program results to the management, sales and marketing teams
  • Experience supervising other team members
  • Experience analyzing large data sets and simplified presentation of results
  • Master’s degree in Chemical Engineering, Microbiology (or closely-related field) with 5+ years of commercial fermentation experience OR a Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering, Microbiology (or closely-related field) with 3+ years’ experience in commercial fermentation

What Will Put You Ahead?
  • Demonstrated success in managing projects, including sourcing, budgeting and timelines

  • Expertise in both pilot and commercial-scale fermentation

Why Work For Koch Companies?
  • A culture that places top priority on integrity and compliance
  • Opportunity for career growth at one of the largest, financially stable companies in the world
  • Encouragement to challenge the status quo and share knowledge
  • Responsibilities and rewards based on contributions
  • Continued company growth due to reinvesting 90% of our earnings
  • Competitive pay and benefits that help you manage your personal and financial wellness

Want to learn more about KAES?

Koch Ag & Energy Solutions, LLC and its subsidiaries, including Koch Fertilizer, LLC, Koch Agronomic Services, LLC, Koch Energy Services, LLC and Koch Methanol, LLC, are global providers of value-added solutions for the agriculture, turf and ornamental, energy and chemical markets.

Salary and benefits commensurate with experience.

description:
This position will be responsible providing oversight to and managing all the technical functions at the Ontario plant. This will include: New Initiatives, Process Engineering, Capital Project Management, Maintenance, Facilities and Utilities systems at the site. This position will also be the key interface for the engineering function to the site and will be responsible for developing and managing the site asset strategy and infrastructure plans. The individual in this position will have in-depth understanding of Maintenance Systems and continuous improvement methodologies and will have had a track record of implementing a LEAN/TPM/WCM culture in a plant technical organization. Additionally, the person in this position will have a good working knowledge of ammonia refrigeration, PSM Programs, Autonomous Maintenance, Early Equipment Management, HVAC and utilities systems in order to properly structure and coach teams to effectively manage and maintain the infrastructure from both a performance and regulatory standpoint.
  • Lead and develop plant facilities and processing engineering, maintenance and waste water team within including objective setting, development planning, coaching and feedback.

  • Supervise, coordinate, evaluate changes and act as SME within facility relating to troubleshooting equipment, machinery, line improvements, etc.
  • Act as a member of the leadership team, providing technical expertise and opinion to drive production, quality, safety and customer focus.
  • Set up and check measurement system (Key performance indicators).

  • Evaluate, develop and execute engineering projects for the facility; prioritize plant needs, develop and oversee implementation of Capital Plan; originate capital appropriation requests, develop project schedules and work teams; write contracts, coordinate project activities, control project funds, and implement startup/training procedures as necessary.
  • Recommend equipment/processing system modifications and/or replacement as needed to improve plant performance.
  • Remain up-to-date on technology related to plant operation.
  • Examines equipment, processes, operations, to determine efficiency or quality revisions, and suggests improvements.
  • Evaluates vendor and supplier proposals for new equipment purchases.
  • Oversees the development, evaluation or review of plans and criteria for a variety of activities such as downtime reduction projects, change analysis and procedure development.
  • Evaluates internal controls and makes recommendations for improvement.
  • Manages the capital budget and develops the technical talent in the group.
  • Works with plant technical and operations resources to identify capital deployment opportunities.
  • BS Degree in Mechanical, Electrical or Chemical Engineering.
  • 8-10 years of experience in the Manufacturing Process industry dealing with project work, preventative maintenance administration, maintenance workforce management, budget responsibility, federal regulations and requirements and project proposal and justification.
  • 5+ yearsâ experience in a TPM-LEAN / World Class Manufacturing (WCM) environment
  • Working knowledge of ammonia systems

Desired Qualifications
  • Must be able to effectively interface and collaborate with different levels of management and other departments to plan, schedule work and communicate and influence across all levels of the organization
  • Ability to interact with associates on the shop floor and being able to develop and mentor talent across the organization.
  • Excellent project management skills and structured approach to resolving problems
  • Familiar with Lean and Continuous Improvements and Methodologies
  • Requires advanced technical and working knowledge of computerized maintenance programs such as SAP-PM or JDE-EAM, PLCs, photo sensors, and automation technology.
  • Ability to develop and manage budgets with a keen eye on driving best value for the company
  • Good working knowledge of ammonia systems and PSM programs.
  • Knowledge of regulatory codes and standards such as GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices), OSHA (Occupational Safety and Health Act), and NEC (National Electric Code), and NFPA (National Fire Protection Act).
  • Ability to read, write, analyze and interpret product specifications, production schedules, quality documentation, and other process/ performance documentation in English.
  • Flexibility in work schedule hours to overlap with all three shifts as needed for direct management of the department.

description:

Responsible for managing the dosage form manufacturing process development activities leading to technology transfer/scale-up of drug products. Responsible for the management, troubleshooting/ manufacturing investigations and validation activities at the Contract Service Providers (CSPs). Contributes both internally and externally in resolution of complex technical issues and implementation of new manufacturing process technology.   • Manages development, scale-up to manufacturing of clinical formulations and finished dosage forms at CSPs.

Advanced degree in Pharmaceutical Sciences, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Materials Science, or related field. Ph.D. desirable. An equivalent combination of relevant education and applicable industry experience may be considered. A minimum of 7 yearsâ experience in progressively responsible roles with a focus on oral dosage form formulation and manufacturing process development with 4 years in a leadership role. title: Associate Director, Formulation Development

description:
We launched Atara Biotherapeutics in August 2012 to help patients with serious diseases and few therapeutic options combat cancer and other serious illnesses. Our research is based on groundbreaking discoveries regarding the ability to harness and augment the immune system to stem disease as well as the ability of activin, myostatin and other growth factors to change the course of disease progression. Our goal is to help patients such as Atara Ciechanover, our company’s namesake, who suffered from cancer before passing away. We aim to empower patients to fight their illnesses with better treatment options.

Position Summary
The Technical Manager, External Manufacturing works as part of the Manufacturing team to deliver on the team goals to generate high quality materials that will contribute to the successful delivery of released product in support of clinical trials and commercial requirements. The Technical Manager will work with outside collaborators who produce materials that can either be used in the process of manufacturing clinical or commercial material or reagents that are produced under GMP that would be used in the manufacture of the cell therapy product. These products will be used both domestically as well as internationally and therefore, may have regional requirements for their production. The technical Manager will work closely with the different external organizations to fulfill requirements for clinical and commercial needs. The candidate will have an understanding of the requirements needed to meet quality and regulatory compliance in the manufacturing environment both domestically and internationally.

Work Location: Westlake Village (northwest Los Angeles), CA
Reports to: Sr. Director, CMC Manufacturing

Primary Responsibilities
Work with external organizations to produce materials of high quality that can be used in the manufacturing process for Atara’s cell therapy products or for final product production, testing and or distribution. Specifically:
Manage external projects and produce timely updates
Assist in troubleshooting of issues as needed
Assist in deviations and CAPA. Be company contact for issues
Maintain timelines established by external organization
Write documents as needed in support of the manufacturing of the materials at external organizations.
Work with the quality group and contract manufacturing organization to support regulatory filings for the various clinical programs.
Develop and monitor metrics for all external manufacturing.
Monitor the progress of projects and produce timely updates on progress.
Support development and technology transfer into the manufacturing department of the organizations as needed and be the subject matter expert or convey issues to subject matter expert.
Investigate problems and root cause analysis and implement solutions

Travel Requirements: up to 45% (scheduled travel to collaborators)

Physical Requirements:
Subject to extended periods of sitting and/or standing in a clean room environment (ISO 5). Work is generally performed in the manufacturing clean room or development environment.

Position Requirements:
Strong communication skills (e.g., clear and concise), both written and verbal and a team player.
Specific experience in cell therapy manufacturing is a plus.
Previous experience in manufacturing environment.
Experience with computer and documentation systems.
Good decision making with strong judgment through collaboration and consideration of others point-of-view.
Ability to understand manufacturing process and equipment related engineering tools, such as process flow diagrams, and/or engineering specifications/requirements.
Understanding of cGMP for cell therapy manufacturing.
Flexibility to travel both domestically and international as required to accommodate the business needs.
Must be able to work in controlled environments requiring special gowning. (Will be required to follow gowning requirements and wear protective clothing over the head, face, hands, feet, and body.)

Education and Professional Experience:
BS degree in field of biochemical/chemical engineering or life science and 6-10 years related work experience in a manufacturing environment.
Must be knowledgeable and worked in biotech manufacturing related industry.
Demonstrated understanding of cGMP execution.
Work with personnel in a manufacturing environment from other organizations.

More About Atara Bio

We are a four-year-old approximately 100-person clinical stage publicly traded ( NASDAQ exchange symbol ATRA ) biopharmaceutical company focused on meaningful therapies for patients with severe and life-threatening diseases that have been underserved by scientific innovation. We are co-located by design in Westlake Village, CA (northwest LA) and South San Francisco, CA, with a process development lab in the Denver, CO area at the Fitzsimons Innovation Center and offices in New York City.
We have two groups of product candidates: (a) allogeneic, or third-party derived, antigen-specific T-cells, and (b) molecularly targeted biologics.
Our initial T-cell product candidates are CTLs that target viral- or cancer-specific antigens and are designed to harness the body’s immune system to counteract specific viral infections and cancers. Our most advanced T-cell product candidate, EBV-CTL, is entering into Phase 3 trials for Epstein-Barr virus, or EBV-associated post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorders, or EBV-PTLD
Our molecularly targeted product candidate is STM 434. Atara Bio commenced a Phase 1 clinical study of STM 434 for ovarian cancer and other solid tumors in 2014.
We have agreement with the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) on the designs of two Phase 3 trials for ATA 129 intended to support approval in the treatment of rituximab-refractory EBV-Associated Post Transplant Lymphoproliferative Disorder (EBV-PTLD) after hematopoietic cell transplant (HCT) or solid organ transplant (SOT). These two Phase 3 trials will support potential approvals in two separate indications.
We have also announced in parallel to scientific advice from the European Medicines Agency's (EMA's) Scientific Advice Working Group and several national Health Technology Assessment (HTA) Agencies in the EU, the plan to submit in 2018 an application for Conditional Marketing Authorization Approval (Conditional MAA) of ATA 129 in the treatment of patients with rituximab refractory EBV-PTLD following hematopoietic cell transplant (HCT). The Conditional MAA will be based on clinical data from Phase 1 and 2 trials conducted at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (MSK) and supported by available data from the Company's Phase 3 studies in rituximab refractory EBV-PTLD after HCT and solid organ transplantation (SOT), which will be ongoing at the time of filing.
The FDA has granted breakthrough therapy designation for EBV-CTL in the treatment of rituximab-refractory EBV-PTLD after HCT and FDA has granted orphan drug designation for EBV-CTL for the treatment of patients with EBV-PTLD after HCT or SOT.
The EMA has granted orphan drug designation for EBV-CTL for the treatment of patients with EBV-PTLD. EBV-CTL was accepted into the EMA’s Adaptive Licensing Program and in June 2016, the EMA classified our EBV-CTL product candidate as an Advanced Therapy Medicinal Product, or ATMP EMA granted access to its newly established Priorities Medicines, or PRIME, regulatory initiative for EBV-CTL in the treatment of patients with rituximab refractory EBV-PTLD after HCT. Access to the PRIME initiative is granted by the EMA to support the development and accelerate the review of new therapies to treat patients with unmet medical need. The criteria for the PRIME initiative require early clinical evidence that the therapy offers a therapeutic advantage over existing treatments or benefits patients with limited treatment options.

Working at Atara Bio

People at Atara Bio are high integrity, get-it-done, roll-up-your-sleeves types who are keenly committed to putting patients first, advancing medical care and doing so with demonstrated urgency. With many accomplished people at Atara Bio, we expect humility, flexibility, respect, teamwork, good judgment and getting the most out of any dollar we spend. We also expect to enjoy the journey (and each other) as we move forward with a responsibility to teach and to learn from each other.
Atara Bio is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and other lawful factors. In accordance with applicable law, the Company prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, creed, sex, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical condition related to pregnancy or childbirth), gender identity, expression or dysphoria, marital status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, caregiver status, sexual orientation, transgender status or any other classification protected by federal, state or local laws or because of the individual’s association with a member of a protected group or connection to an organization or group related to a protected group.
We comply with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act. All applicants must have authorization to work for Atara Bio in the United States.

description:
Job Title: Project Service Technician
Location: Placentia, CA

Nalco, an Ecolab Company, a global water treatment leader, has an immediate need for an Project Service Technician based in the California area. The Application Engineer is responsible for the day-to-day progress and efficiency of any assigned jobsite(s). In concert with the Service Manager, the Senior Service Technician shall maintain accurate documentation, jobsite decorum, and executes system service, installation, repair, adjustment, and instrument calibration to the high standard of workmanship and excellence demanded by the company

Job Overview
Under the direction of the Service Manager, the Service Technician shall be responsible for executing all aspects of assigned service, installation, repair, adjustment, and instrument calibration including general construction, documentation, and customer relations.

Key Responsibilities

Assist the Service Manager and supervise assigned projects
Communicate with customer, customer’s agents, general contractor, and/or other trade contractors to ensure that all necessary information is communicated to the Service Manager to support favorable project completion
Check drawings, specifications, and documents, for accuracy
Participate in pre-installation Job Walk with Service Manager. Communicate installation layout specifics to Installation and Service Technicians
Maintain communication with the Service Manager to assure he is up-to-date on the project and involved with any system design related changes and/or client requests for changes

Complete his installation work in the time prescribed by the Service Manager
Perform control setup on automated systems, control adjustment and repair, instrument calibration, instrument and control wiring
Perform complex troubleshooting, adjustment, and repair of automated and semi-automated systems, sub-systems, controls and instrumentation.
Manage jobsite cleanliness, use of company materials, and be responsible for minimizing material waste during installation (wire, brackets, fittings, misc. materials)

years of successful technical service or field sales support experience

description:
Series B generously funded by top VC firms company is looking for a Process Engineering Manager to join their fast-growing team in Campbell, CA, and to work on a disruptive 3D metal printing technology .

The team is looking for a self-starter that enjoys working in a highly dynamic startup environment. You will enjoy small company atmosphere and excellent benefits including healthcare coverage and 401(K) matching.

Responsibilities:
  • Lead a group of process engineers to solve key technical problems related to a new, highly sophisticated metal 3D printer.
  • Be responsible for a portfolio of research, development, and continuous improvement projects that translate the company's unique processing capabilities into a revolutionary volume production solution for aerospace, automotive, and other industries.
  • Interface with technical leads on other teams to translate process learnings into specific improvements in printer functionality and reliability.
  • Work with senior technologists and managers to generate a long-term process roadmap and resource allocation to meet company goals.

Qualifications:
  • Strong desire to work for an early stage startup company on disruptive technologies and make it a success.
  • Proven track record of invention of new processes, developing them into robust solutions, and solving complex technical problems.
  • Broad knowledge across multiple fields and ability to apply this knowledge and ideas to solve complex technical and engineering problems.
  • Demonstrated track record of simultaneously leading multiple technical projects and achieving high impact results through others.
  • Experience providing effective technical leadership to develop and mentor team members.
  • 5+ years of hands-on experience as process engineer / technologist.
  • Current hands-on data and statistical analysis experience.
  • 2+ years direct management experience of process engineers, technologists, or equivalent.
  • Post-graduate degree in materials science, chemical engineering, physics or related field.
  • Experience using structured problem solving approaches to solve complex technical problems in multiple disciplines.

Pluses:
  • Prior start-up experience is strongly preferred
  • Experience with statistical design of experiments and statistical analysis using JMP or equivalent software.
  • Experience or familiarity with programming languages such as Matlab.
  • Demonstrated track record of changing scientific disciplines or fields

To apply:
  • Please send your resume in PDF or WORD format to lilia@eltisolutions.com
  • Place the text "Process Engineering Manager" in the subject line.
  • Please provide the date you are available to start work.
title: Process Engineering Manager, 3D metal printing startup

description:
Job Description
About Thermo Fisher Scientific

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with revenues of $17 billion and 50,000 employees in 50 countries. Our mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We help our customers accelerate life sciences research, solve complex analytical challenges, improve patient diagnostics and increase laboratory productivity. Our five premier brands â Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific and Unity Lab Services â offer an unmatched combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and comprehensive support. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com

Thermo Fisher Scientific has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Patent Agent to join its Life Sciences Solutions Group at a site in the San Francisco Bay Area. This position will support the next-generation sequencing business, including its sample preparation instruments and its sequencing chips, instruments, and systems. Working closely with a diverse and talented group of researchers and engineers as well as a dynamic legal group, this position will help drive IP tactics and strategy for cutting-edge next-generation sequencing for research and clinical applications. Many different challenges and opportunities await the right candidate.

The Patent Agent will support a variety of IP initiatives, including: invention harvesting, patent preparation and prosecution, portfolio development and management, IP searching and/or landscaping, and support for freedom-to-operate analyses. Our Patent Agents are expected to develop an understanding of the business strategy for the groups they support to both inform the various IP initiatives as well as the underlying business decision-making processes. Further, agents actively participate in engaging and representing to the business the IP legal position on various opportunities that arise from this important work.

Technical areas of focus for this position include: automated sample preparation instruments, semiconductor designs and chips for sequencing, and more generally next-generation sequencing instruments, systems, and workflows.

Essential Qualifications:
  • Experience in invention harvesting, patent preparation and prosecution, portfolio development, and patent searching;
  • Excellent scientific and technical expertise;
  • An advanced degree in electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, physics, materials science, chemical engineering, or a closely related field;
  • Exceptional communication skills, both written and interpersonal, a collaborative instinct, and a high level of initiative; and
  • Registration to practice before the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Six or more years of experience preparing and prosecuting U.S. and international patent applications (writing samples will be requested);
  • A track record of success as a patent agent (ideally also including industry experience); and
  • Experience with next-generation sequencing technologies and related instrument platforms.
*LI-KP1 *IND-CORP

Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

description:
Development Scientist-Newport Beach, CA Area

DESCRIPTION:
This position is responsible for developing novel optical adhesives and films involving functional nanoparticles, such as quantum dots and nano-crystals. Responsibilities may include design, formulation, testing, processing, and scale-up of proprietary electronic materials. Products must be developed in a timely manner that will permit their evaluation, qualification, and implementation by customers.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Additional responsibilities include determining development strategy and direction, valuing projects, leveraging technology across different projects, interacting with Research Platforms, and supervising technicians and junior chemists.

Lead complex, long and short term product development projects with focus on the use of functional nanoparticles in display applications; determine technology approach and conceive innovative routes in the formulation, processing, and testing of materials; employ sound experimental designs to effectively develop new materials for electronic applications.

Prepare and deliver presentations on research projects for customers, management and technical audiences; provide technical support services to manufacturing and quality as required.

Actively promote technology across various groups and development teams; seek new technology directions from other groups and from the Research Platforms; support intellectual property activities and provide guidance and recommendations on patents, trademarks and proprietary agreements; contribute to the development of IP strategies for area of responsibility.

Assure all PD laboratory work is carried out in a safe manner including employees wearing personal protective equipment, trained on safety practices, 5s, etc; and that products and processes comply with all deferral and state regulatory agencies; assure all new products meet international chemical health and safety requirements.

Supervise and coach technicians and associate chemists on chemistry and processes and on day to day activities; able to work in a chemical lab environment and with lab equipment and computers; able to carry out laboratory activities.

REQUIREMENTS:
Ph.D. degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Materials Science, or other relevant discipline plus 3+ years of experience in the areas of optical/display materials, surface chemistry/physics, adhesive or film.

Film processing or optical film expertise highly desirable; alternatively, a Masters or Bachelor?s degree plus 7+ years of experience may be considered.

Full understanding and extensive knowledge in the relationship between chemical structures and physical/mechanical/optical properties is a must; experience in the analysis and application of chemical, physical, mechanical and optical data to problem solving and product development; demonstrated ability to partner with customers in product development programs.

May be required to reach, squat, bend and lift up to 25 lbs.
title: Development Scientist

description:
About NICE America Research: NICE America Research, Inc. is a newly established R&D; Center in Silicon Valley, and is a branch of the National Institute of Clean-and-Low-Carbon Energy (NICE) in Beijing, China. NICE is the corporate research arm of Shenhua Group which is an integrated energy company and a Global Fortune 500. We are building teams to develop cutting-edge sustainable and affordable technologies to improve energy efficiency, protect the environment, and mitigate climate change. Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, skill, imagination, passion, and teamwork of people like you. Currently we have an opening for a chemical technician or an entry-level bench chemist in catalysis area. We offer competitive compensation packages and excellent benefits. Relocation will be considered.
Job Responsibilities: The Catalysis Focus Area aims to develop technologies for shale gas downstream applications such as production of hydrogen, olefins, aromatics, fuels, and fine chemicals. We look for people with hands-on experience in heterogeneous catalyst preparation, characterization, and evaluation at all levels. In particular, the successful candidate at the technician or entry-level chemist level is expected to: 1. Construct, operate, and maintain catalytic reactor systems. 2. With the guidance of senior team members, synthesize and characterize catalysts. 3. Perform online and offline analytic instrument such as gas chromatography. 4. Summarize data on a daily base. 5. Communicate ideas and solutions in both internal and external presentations. 6. Conduct activities in a safe and healthy manner and work in accordance with established EHS requirements to ensure the protection of associates, the public and the environment.

Qualifications: 1. BS in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, or a relevant field with extensive training and experience in catalysis. 2. Hands-on experience in designing and/or operating custom laboratory equipment such as high pressure micro-reactors. 3. Hands-on experience with multiple characterization techniques that are related to catalyst discovery and development. 4. Applied knowledge of standard office software. Experience in programming is a plus. 5. An innovative and independent thinker. Demonstrated ability to quickly and creatively solve complex technical problems. 6. Excellent communication skill and a good team player. Energetic and self-motivated. Willing to work with flexible schedule in a fast-paced, start-up environment.

description:
To be considered for this position, you must apply at www.pfizercareers.com and search for Job ID 1039904.

Please note, any applications submitted through this website will not be reviewed for consideration.

About Pfizer

A career at Pfizer offers opportunity, ownership and impact. All over the world, Pfizer colleagues work together to positively impact health for everyone, everywhere. Our colleagues have the opportunity to grow and develop a career that offers both individual and company success; be part of an ownership culture that values diversity and where all colleagues are energized and engaged; and the ability to impact the health and lives of millions of people. Pfizer, a global leader in the biopharmaceutical industry, is continuously seeking top talent who are inspired by our purpose to innovate to bring therapies to patients that significantly improve their lives.

Role Description

The Protein Engineering Department is seeking an outstanding Senior Scientist to lead antibody discovery, engineering and technology development projects. They will be responsible for working closely with individuals in both protein engineering and biology to develop the next generation of antibody based cancer therapeutics. They will have access to state of the art antibody generation technologies and will be expected to continue our tradition of developing world class methods and technologies that enhance our therapeutic antibody discovery efforts.

Responsibilities

The primary responsibilities include obtaining in-depth knowledge of the therapeutic targets of interest and using this information to implement antibody generation campaigns and when necessary technology development. This includes protein expression and purification and subsequent antibody generation using phage and yeast displayed libraries of human antibodies. They will need to work closely with the biologists to test these antibodies in a variety of in vitro and in vivo models and use these results to further engineer the antibodies to maximize their therapeutic potential.

Qualifications

  • Ph.D. in Biological Science (Molecular Biology, Structural Biology, Protein Chemistry) or a related field (Chemical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering)
  • At least 2 years of post-graduate experience in either an academic or industrial setting is preferred
  • Strong track record of success demonstrated through publications in highly regarded journals and/or intellectual property generation
  • Previous experience with antibody discovery and engineering technologies such as B-cell cloning, phage display and yeast display

PHYSICAL/MENTAL REQUIREMENTS :

Laboratory work: Lifting, sitting, standing, walking, ability to travel

Equal Employment Opportunity

Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer.
