description:
DiCon has an immediate opening for a Compound Semiconductor Process Engineer, to develop manufacturing processes for III-V optical devices. This work is focused on the development and manufacture of solid-state nano-devices, especially highly-integrated optical amplifiers, for advanced optical networking applications. The primary responsibility of this position is to develop processes for novel solid-state materials, devices, and nano-structures, including chemical vapor deposition, etching, optical lithography, and other processes for III-V materials. The positions require working collaboratively with top epitaxy and device engineers to develop and optimize the performance of these advanced optical devices.

Qualifications & Requirements

  • Strong background in semiconductor processes and solid-state physics. Preferably with an M.S. or Ph.D. in Materials Science, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Physics, or related field (such as Electrical Engineering, with a focus on semiconductor processing).
  • Minimum 2 years of industry experience required.
  • Hands-on experience in chemical vapor deposition, dry and wet etching, metallization processes, and lithography.
  • Direct experience in process characterization and optimization.
  • Ability to work effectively in multi-disciplinary teams.
  • Comfortable with a fast-moving high-tech industrial environment.

Play a key role in the photonics revolution that is driving the development of leading-edge optical devices for communications networks! For information on DiCon Fiberoptics and our products, please visit www.diconfiberoptics.com.

description:
California State Polytechnic University, Pomona (Cal Poly Pomona) invites nominations and applications for the position of Dean for the College of Engineering.

Cal Poly Pomona is one of two polytechnic universities in the 23-campus California State University system, and one of only seven such institutions nationally. Located 30 miles east of Los Angeles, the university is in one of the most dynamic economic and cultural regions of the country. The University is noted for its scenic and historic 1,400-acre campus, once the winter ranch of cereal magnate W.K. Kellogg, located within an hour’s drive of beaches, mountains, and desert. The University’s almost 24,000 ethnically diverse students are enrolled in 51 baccalaureate and 30 master’s degree programs, 11 credential and certificate programs, and a doctorate in Educational Leadership with approximately 1,200 faculty.

The College of Engineering is the largest College at Cal Poly Pomona, serving 5,300 undergraduate and 300 graduate students. Its mission is to educate engineers and technologists to meet increasingly complex technical & socioeconomic challenges. The College offers degrees in 7 departments, with 11 ABET accredited programs leading to B.S. degrees in Aerospace Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electronics and Computer Technology, General Engineering Technology, Industrial Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, and Mechanical Engineering, plus M.S. degrees in Engineering (with emphasis in Aerospace Engineering), Civil Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Engineering Management, Mechanical Engineering, and Systems Engineering. Additional information about the college may be found here .

The Dean reports to the Provost and Vice President for Academic Affairs, serves as a member of the Provost's Council, and works closely with others across campus to advance the goals and priorities of the College and University. The Dean is the academic leader and responsible for supervising the College leadership team consisting of two Associate Deans, Department Chairs, and staff. The Dean fosters an environment conducive to academic quality, collegiality, innovation, transparency, and fosters an appreciation for diversity and inclusion. The Dean is expected to promote collaboration, team building and the active engagement of faculty, staff, students, alumni and community partners.

The new Dean of the College of Engineering will provide thoughtful leadership as s/he continues to identify future areas of growth. The Dean will build strong interdisciplinary connections across its departments, the University, and externally with industry partners. In particular, s/he will address the following set of key opportunities and challenges:
  • Shape and implement a vision of educational and scholarly innovation and excellence;
  • Foster a collaborative, innovative, and inclusive culture in the College;
  • Embrace and strengthen the culture of student success and further improve student outcomes;
  • Elevate the profile of the College externally;
  • Advocate for the College of Engineering and collaborate across the Cal Poly Pomona campus;
  • Secure resources to ensure the continued growth and success of the College.

David Bellshaw is leading this search with Emily Chiswick-Patterson and Sheila Bharucha.
title: Dean, College of Engineering

description: Huntsman currently has an immediate opening for a dynamic individual with proven capability as a Site Manager for our Pigments & Additives Division at our facility located in Los Angeles, California. Ensure all EHS Improvement Plans, regulatory, external and internal, requirements are met. Oversees the management of production (including: scheduling, raw material requisition, and warehousing), Engineering and Maintenance, EHS, Quality Assurance, and the Transform Program personnel directly and through subordinate managers and/or supervisors in a continuous improvement environment. Supports an aggressive Quality program which instills personal accountability for accuracy, consistency, and completeness for all operations and departments. Establish and maintain relationships with plant labor force as well as Union workforce. Strong communicator who can quickly establish rapport and build a network with internal customers. Must demonstrate a high level of business acumen. Must have the ability to be creative, analytical, and persuasive at the same time. Ability to build collaboration skills, both written and oral. Ability to communicate with all functions and levels within the company, as well as customers, suppliers, and the community. Demonstrated problem solving skills with many issues, developing situations, and successfully implement corrective action plans through subordinates. Strong interpersonal, influencing, and facilitation skills. Benefits: The successful candidate will receive a competitive salary and will be eligible to participate in a comprehensive benefits package which includes: medical, vision and dental, basic life insurance, AD&D; insurance, and 401k. *LI-GF-1 ~IND123

description:
The Manufacturing Manager is responsible for all performance in the Manufacturing Department and will ensure that production occurs in a safe environment, in accordance with cGMP quality standards, on-schedule and within cost objectives. The Manufacturing Manager is responsible for supporting an environment of continuous improvement focused on meeting or exceeding operational Key Performance Indicators.

Specific Job Duties:

  • Ensure a safe environment is maintained for all areas:
  • Required training is completed on time
  • Establish accountability metrics for supervisory staff ensuring safety follow-ups, investigations, inspections and continuous improvements are completed on time
  • All safety guidelines and procedures are followed
  • Must be an active member in the Plant Safety Committee
  • Work areas are maintained, hazards identified and corrected, to ensure a safe workplace for all employees
  • Maintain cGMP compliance
  • Ensure a timely response to the closure of cGMP operational matters defined by QA: Master Manufacturing Records, CAPAs, Deviations, Good Documentation Practices, etc.
  • Ensure all cGMP, SOP and SSOP training is carried out in compliance with regulations and company policy
  • Directs the production employees, processes and systems to ensure the optimal operation of the various production lines in a manner that promotes a safe working environment, minimizes waste, optimizes efficiency, minimizes downtime, promotes employee involvement, complies with food safety programs, keeps areas under 5âs conditions, helps implement a lean culture and reduces cost.
  • Establishes production standards, measurements, and monitoring to ensure production processes and systems are optimized as designed and are continuously improved when opportunities are present.
  • Collaborates with Human Resources to implement staffing for the plant with attention to labor cost containment, educate and hold employees accountable to Company policies, to resolve performance or conduct related issues with employees, and to ensure compliance with employment laws and regulations
  • Communicate with managers and supervisors to ensure open, two-way dialogue to ensure that Company information is disseminated to all employees and that employeeâ ideas, issues or concerns are being listened to and handled in an effective and efficient manner. Maintain a good working atmosphere
  • Professionally develop shift managers, supervisors, and leads through objective setting, project and work assignment, performance assessment, coaching and feedback in collaboration with human resources.
  • Establish and maintain productivity standards.
  • Ensure Departmental Budgets are developed and met.
  • Develop and implement cost reduction/methods improvement projects
  • Coordinate with Planning to ensure that equipment and process utilization are aligned maximizing schedule attainment.
  • Drive continuous improvement within Manufacturing to meet or exceed all operational KPIs.
  • Participate in establishing plans for implementation of new projects, equipment, programs, and execute plans once approved by Management while ensuring change management tasks are followed.
  • Perform all other tasks as assigned by Threshold management


    • Qualifications
    Minimum Qualifications Required:

    1. Five years of production management experience in food, dietary supplement or pharmaceutical manufacturing.

    2. Leadership experience in a cGMP manufacturing environment.

    3. Five years of directly supervising or managing employees.

    4. Experience with a variety of computer software applications in word processing, spreadsheets, and database software. Experience with Microsoft Navision preferred

    5. Knowledge of FDA and OSHA regulations and experience with cGMPs, SOPs, HACCP.

    Skills and/or Training Desired:

    1. B.S. or M.S. degree in Industrial Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Food Science or relevant field.

    2. Experience in Botanical, nutraceutical, food or pharmaceutical manufacturing.

    3. Experience with document control processes, ERP, TQM, Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma, Root Cause/Corrective Action Analysis

    4. Proven Project Management experience

    5. Experience with managing interpersonal issues, negotiation and employee relations

    6. Willing to work occasional off shifts and weekends.

description:
We have a great career role for a Chemical Process Engineer with Global Chemical Client. The company provides customers worldwide with chemical and minerals which are used in their manufacturing processes. You be responsible for optimizing quality, process, productivity and documenting production process improvements. Ensuring compliance with State and Federal Regulations related to safety and the environment is a key component of this exciting role.

Lots of pluses to this great role, including: Great location for outdoors activities. You have great weather, you have mountains, desert, biking, hiking, snowboarding / skiing, boating, desert motorsports and golfing! Joining an Global Leader with 14,000 employees worldwide An extensive corporate relocation program provided. Career growth in a very stable manufacturing environment Great affordability with lower than average housing cost and higher than average appreciation with Cost of Living below US average.

Strong career stability / growth and development opportunity This key role has a strong compensation and benefits program that include medical/ dental insurance, FSA account, 401k match, Life / ADD insurance, disability, paid vacation, disability and education reimbursement. Please forward resume to: bsweedar@mriomega.com It will open a profile that will allow you to upload a current resume and provide needed insight into your experience and expectations. We will use this information to create a client presentation and as a basis for our follow up conversation. This position is a high priority so don't delay if you are interested.

I look forward to talking with you! Duties: Responsible for heat and material balance, development and use of process simulation. Develop of process flow diagrams, block flow diagrams, system design parameters, and design or rating of equipment and apparatus such as heat exchangers, vessels, reactors, etc. Creates documentation including SOPâs, training, validation of equipment, and reports.

Directs activities to ensure the project progresses on schedule and within budget. Create project specifications including drawings, data sheets, etc. compliant with industry / safety standards and to client specifications. Optimize current processes including performance consistency and cost effectiveness.

Provide accurate and timely project reporting to internal and external customers Manage relationships with preferred equipment manufacturers, specialists, and technical support consultants. Provide engineering to improve existing manufacturing processes and capabilities. Liaison with manufacturing team at all levels to resolve technical issues, applying your skills to design, optimize and troubleshoot equipment. Identify emerging technologies for future implementation Ensure each process plant is set up to provide maximum output levels and efficiency; Implementation of upgrades and modifications, including reviewing and preparing documentation.

Assess options for plant expansion or reconfiguration by developing and testing process simulation models Implement new manufacturing processes for existing and new products. Maintains knowledge of all processes and equipment and acts as engineering resource. Provide technical advice and to resolve problems. Develop expertise on current and emerging technologies.

Uses situation, potential problem, and decision analyses, risk assessments, DMAIC, LEAN methodologies. Implement corrective actions to solve problems based on root cause analysis Design and evaluate sampling and measurement procedures. Lead problem solving teams. Qualifications: BS in chemical engineering 7 years related experience in manufacturing and/or chemical process industry Knowledge of crystallization and inorganic chemistry preferred.

Six Sigma experience required / Green/Black Belt preferred. Knowledgeable in process, mechanical and electrical engineering practices and processes, including mass and energy transfer and fluid flow. Skilled with process equipment operation and troubleshooting. Able to support plants which are in continuous operation Candidate must be skilled in data analysis and statistical methods.

Must be skilled with computer modeling tools. Advanced education is a plus Professional certifications are a plus.
title: Chemical Process Engineer 1627

description:
We launched Atara Biotherapeutics in August 2012 to help patients with serious diseases and few therapeutic options combat cancer and other serious illnesses. Our research is based on groundbreaking discoveries regarding the ability to harness and augment the immune system to stem disease as well as the ability of activin, myostatin and other growth factors to change the course of disease progression. Our goal is to help patients such as Atara Ciechanover, our company’s namesake, who suffered from cancer before passing away. We aim to empower patients to fight their illnesses with better treatment options.

Position Summary
The Senior Manager, Process Automation, provides strategic and technical direction for the design and implementation of all Atara’s control systems. This role will support all engineering, start-up, commissioning and qualification activities to support Atara manufacturing. Atara’s control systems support manufacturing, laboratories, inventory and materials management, distribution, facilities maintenance, and building automation to facilitate a paperless manufacturing and review process. This position will also require the day-to-day management of the manufacturing process automation systems.

Reports to: Senior Director, Cell Therapy Manufacturing and Science
Location: Westlake Village (Los Angeles area), CA

Primary Responsibilities
Lead projects in the design, development, and qualification of process control, building automation, and lab equipment; including managing the work of external vendors.
Collaborates closely with IT in the efforts for configuration, administration, integration, and maintenance activities of computer systems, including ERP, MES, LIMS, and QMS.
Collaborates closely with the Quality and Regulatory teams to provide compliant programs and support for worldwide product submissions and cGMP interactions.
Supports with colleagues the technical guidance and direction into the development of automation in support manufacturing processes for the development of cell therapy products.
Works closely with the Manufacturing leadership team to ensure alignment and established priorities to meet and exceed site and corporate goals.

Travel: Travel required (up to 10%).

Physical Requirements:
Subject to extended periods of sitting and/or standing, vision to monitor and moderate noise levels. Work is generally performed in an office, manufacturing plant or clinical environment.

Position Requirements:
Strong communication skills (e.g., clear and concise), team player, and proven negotiation skills.
Specific experience with ERP, MES, QMS, LIMS.
Demonstrated experience managing multiple simultaneous projects.
Previous experience in manufacturing or operations environment.
Experience with computer systems validation practices.
Good decision making with strong judgment through collaboration and consideration of others point-of-view.
Strong understanding of pharmaceutical development, clinical research, cell therapy manufacturing, and project management.
Self-motivated, flexible and creative leader, able to prioritize, multi-task, and work in a fast-paced & demanding environment.
Effective interpersonal skills; a leader AND a team player.
Ability to organize, structure and staff the organization in a changing environment.
Strong personal presence with ability to command respect through exercise of sound business judgment and clear decision-making.
Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to lead, interact with, influence, resolve conflict and drive consensus among individuals from a variety of cultures, and disciplines.
Role model for Atara’s values.

Education and Professional Experience:
BS degree in field of biochemical/chemical engineering, computer science or information systems and 10 years related work experience.
Experience as subject matter expert in manufacturing automation with management leadership experience.
Must be knowledgeable and worked in biotech manufacturing related industry.
Demonstrated excellent understanding of cGMP execution.
Process Improvement experience with respect to manufacturing execution systems is a bonus.

More About Atara Bio

We are a four-year-old approximately 100-person clinical stage publicly traded ( NASDAQ exchange symbol ATRA ) biopharmaceutical company focused on meaningful therapies for patients with severe and life-threatening diseases that have been underserved by scientific innovation. We are co-located by design in Westlake Village, CA (northwest LA) and South San Francisco, CA, with a process development lab in the Denver, CO area at the Fitzsimons Innovation Center and offices in New York City.
We have two groups of product candidates: (a) allogeneic, or third-party derived, antigen-specific T-cells, and (b) molecularly targeted biologics.
Our initial T-cell product candidates are CTLs that target viral- or cancer-specific antigens and are designed to harness the body’s immune system to counteract specific viral infections and cancers. Our most advanced T-cell product candidate, EBV-CTL, is entering into Phase 3 trials for Epstein-Barr virus, or EBV-associated post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorders, or EBV-PTLD
Our molecularly targeted product candidate is STM 434. Atara Bio commenced a Phase 1 clinical study of STM 434 for ovarian cancer and other solid tumors in 2014.
We have agreement with the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) on the designs of two Phase 3 trials for ATA 129 intended to support approval in the treatment of rituximab-refractory EBV-Associated Post Transplant Lymphoproliferative Disorder (EBV-PTLD) after hematopoietic cell transplant (HCT) or solid organ transplant (SOT). These two Phase 3 trials will support potential approvals in two separate indications.
We have also announced in parallel to scientific advice from the European Medicines Agency's (EMA's) Scientific Advice Working Group and several national Health Technology Assessment (HTA) Agencies in the EU, the plan to submit in 2018 an application for Conditional Marketing Authorization Approval (Conditional MAA) of ATA 129 in the treatment of patients with rituximab refractory EBV-PTLD following hematopoietic cell transplant (HCT). The Conditional MAA will be based on clinical data from Phase 1 and 2 trials conducted at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (MSK) and supported by available data from the Company's Phase 3 studies in rituximab refractory EBV-PTLD after HCT and solid organ transplantation (SOT), which will be ongoing at the time of filing.
The FDA has granted breakthrough therapy designation for EBV-CTL in the treatment of rituximab-refractory EBV-PTLD after HCT and FDA has granted orphan drug designation for EBV-CTL for the treatment of patients with EBV-PTLD after HCT or SOT.
The EMA has granted orphan drug designation for EBV-CTL for the treatment of patients with EBV-PTLD. EBV-CTL was accepted into the EMA’s Adaptive Licensing Program and in June 2016, the EMA classified our EBV-CTL product candidate as an Advanced Therapy Medicinal Product, or ATMP EMA granted access to its newly established Priorities Medicines, or PRIME, regulatory initiative for EBV-CTL in the treatment of patients with rituximab refractory EBV-PTLD after HCT. Access to the PRIME initiative is granted by the EMA to support the development and accelerate the review of new therapies to treat patients with unmet medical need. The criteria for the PRIME initiative require early clinical evidence that the therapy offers a therapeutic advantage over existing treatments or benefits patients with limited treatment options.

Working at Atara Bio

People at Atara Bio are high integrity, get-it-done, roll-up-your-sleeves types who are keenly committed to putting patients first, advancing medical care and doing so with demonstrated urgency. With many accomplished people at Atara Bio, we expect humility, flexibility, respect, teamwork, good judgment and getting the most out of any dollar we spend. We also expect to enjoy the journey (and each other) as we move forward with a responsibility to teach and to learn from each other.
Atara Bio is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and other lawful factors. In accordance with applicable law, the Company prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, creed, sex, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical condition related to pregnancy or childbirth), gender identity, expression or dysphoria, marital status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, caregiver status, sexual orientation, transgender status or any other classification protected by federal, state or local laws or because of the individual’s association with a member of a protected group or connection to an organization or group related to a protected group.
We comply with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act. All applicants must have authorization to work for Atara Bio in the United States.

description:
B.S or A.A. with background in physics, materials science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, chemical engineering or equivalent with experience processing and characterizing new devices and materials in research environments.

We seek technicians to support research for various projects, primarily in the areas of thin film processing and printing. Positions are initially for a fixed term and have the potential to become regular hires.

Applicants are requested to submit a resume and a cover letter that describes examples of past project achievements.

Requirements:
  • B.S or A.A. with background in physics, materials science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, chemical engineering or equivalent.
  • Experience processing and characterizing new devices and materials in research environments.
  • Strong communication and teamwork skills.
Benefits

We offer a very competitive salary package and full benefits (medical, dental, vision, life & disability insurance, 401K). PARC employees enjoy the use of onsite health & fitness center and collegial dining at our onsite cafeteria. The PARC campus is in a spacious modern building in close proximity to the resources and opportunities of Silicon Valley and benefits from nearby leading universities such as Stanford and Berkeley. It is also close to many amenities, top schools, and outdoor activities (see http://www.parc.com/about/culture.html). PARC provides a highly diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer (see http://www.parc.com/about/careers/).

About PARC

PARC, a Xerox company, is in the Business of Breakthroughs®. Practicing open innovation, we provide custom R&D; services, technology, expertise, best practices, and intellectual property to Fortune 500 and Global 1000 companies, startups, and government agencies and partners. We create new business options, accelerate time to market, augment internal capabilities, and reduce risk for our clients.

Since its inception, PARC has pioneered many technology platforms – from the Ethernet and laser printing to the GUI and ubiquitous computing – and has enabled the creation of many industries. Incorporated as an independent, wholly owned subsidiary of Xerox in 2002, PARC today continues the research that enables breakthroughs for our clients' businesses.

PARC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. People with disabilities who need a reasonable accommodation to apply or compete for employment with PARC should contact PARC Human Resources.

The Electronic Materials & Devices Laboratory (EMDL) and the Hardware Systems Laboratory (HSL) are a group of physical scientists and engineers with a passion for identifying future hardware needs and a history of innovation in creating new technologies to meet those needs. Our current research areas include printed electronics, novel printing systems, 3D printing, energy devices and systems, hierarchical structural materials, RF and IR metamaterials, MEMS, displays, amorphous and polycrystalline silicon systems, x-ray imaging, acoustic imaging, optoelectronic semiconductors, visible and UV lasers and LEDs, compact optical sensing systems, drug delivery, biosensors and bio-medical instrumentation.
title: Technicians: Electronic Materials/Devices & Hardware Systems

description:

The Electronic Materials & Devices Laboratory (EMDL) and the Hardware Systems Laboratory (HSL) are a group of physical scientists and engineers with a passion for identifying future hardware needs and a history of innovation in creating new technologies to meet those needs.   • Strong publication record. Please include 3 representative publications in application.
  • Strong communication, teamwork and leadership skills.
  • Experience with commercialization, manufacturing, entrepreneurship and fundraising are highly desired.

description:
Bakersfield College is seeking dedicated, experienced, and motivated individuals to provide leadership, engagement, and discipline expertise in continuing to move the program forward in innovative ways. As a full time faculty member at Bakersfield College, successful candidates will demonstrate commitment to student success through teaching and learning excellence.

This assignment may include teaching courses at various locations, different times, and with different modalities. Bakersfield College offers college courses in the greater Bakersfield area, rural communities, correctional facilities and high schools using the following modalities: traditional, face-to-face, online and interactive broadcasts.

Other duties include: participation in student recruitment and articulation, transfer programs; maintaining subject matter currency; developing and revising curriculum; using computer and technology; assessment of program learning outcomes; collegial participation in departmental, college and discipline-specific professional activities.

Education and Experience
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS : Master’s degree in chemistry;

OR - Bachelor’s in chemistry or biochemistry AND Master’s in biochemistry, chemical engineering, chemical physics, physics, molecular biology, or giochemistry;

OR - The equivalent. Certain combinations of education, experience, and other accomplishments in the field may be judged as equal to the stated minimum qualifications for these positions. Candidates who feel they possess such equivalent qualifications must request and submit an APPLICATION FOR EQUIVALENCE form. Supporting documents must be included with the completed form

AND - A demonstrated sensitivity to students with diverse academic, socio-economic, cultural and ethnic backgrounds and students with disabilities.

Note: Degrees and credits must be from accredited institutions (Title V Section 53406). Any degree from a country other than the United States, including Canada and Great Britain, must be evaluated by an evaluation service. Note: The screening of candidates will be conducted by a screening committee. The screening committee reserves the right to limit the number of interviews granted. Meeting the minimum qualifications for a position does not assure the applicant of an interview.

Knowledge and Abilities
KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES :
  • Ability to work effectively and harmoniously with colleagues in an environment that promotes innovation, teaching, learning and service to diverse student population;
  • Ability to effectively work with students with a wide range of skills, motivations, academic and vocational goals;
  • Ability to develop curriculum, including curriculum delivered via different modalities;
  • Ability to participate in recruitment and articulation activities with local schools, colleges and universities;
  • Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing;
  • Ability to maintain subject matter currency;
  • Ability to assess student learning outcomes;
  • Knowledge of computers and willingness to adopt new technologies that support student success;
  • Knowledge of and commitment to the California Community College mission.
DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS :
  • Ability to provide leadership in program and college initiatives.
  • Ability and willingness to participate effectively in college committee work and in co-curricular and extra-curricular activities that support students and the college.

Salary Grade

Special Instructions to Applicants
First Review of Applications:
Complete application packets will be accepted until the position is filled; but those received by 5:00 p.m. (Pacific Standard Time) on January 5, 2017 are assured consideration. The College reserves the right to extend time limits or reinitiate the recruitment/selection process at any point.

Completed application packet must include:
  • Completed Online Application for Employment form
  • Current resume
  • Letter of interest (Cover Letter)
  • Statement of personal philosophy of teaching
  • Copies of legible transcripts
  • List of six (6) professional references – Listed on application form
  • Copy of sample syllabi
Applicants who require reasonable accommodation to participate in the selection process should contact Human Resources to make the necessary arrangements.

Recruitment Status (tentative):
  • Application Screening: TBD
  • Interviews: TBD
The District does not provide sponsorship for authorization to work in the United States. Work authorization should be established at the time of application submission.
title: Chemistry Instructor (Delano Campus)

description:
Reporting to the Director of Winery Operations, this role has direct responsibility for the day to day operations of the facility. Key areas of responsibility include planning and directing the South Valley winery cellar operation, ensuring priorities and protocols are achieved, while managing people, cost effectiveness, quality, accuracy, and safety to all performance standards and schedule

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
  • The Cellar Supervisor must exhibit strong managerial and leadership skills. Also the ability to interact with the employees while continuing to build a cohesive team and develop individual potential within the team members.
  • Coordinates, prioritizes, and implements daily cellar activities including, but not limited to: supervision, training, and cross-training, job assignments, learning assistance, individual employee development, counseling, safety awareness, and discipline of employees to help them reach the overall objective of creating a great product for minimal cost.
  • Key driver of all Safety policies and procedures for the site. This includes overseeing safety audits, incident investigations, implementation of Company-wide safety policies and relevant safety training. Must lead by example.
  • Ensures compliance with all safety, personnel procedures, policies and is responsible for keeping all SOPâs current.
  • Work closely with the Maintenance Manager to ensure all equipment, cooperage, and systems assigned to the cellar and manufacturing departments are maintained in good, sanitary, safe, and cost effective working order to ensure quality of wine produced and safe maintenance of the bulk inventory.
OTHER FUNCTIONS
  • Prepare and implement training programs to continually upgrade the skills of personnel in areas of responsibilities. Responsible for the development and training of personnel to include scheduling training sessions
  • Must have a complete understanding of the enological process or related fields of process.
  • Develop the production supervision staff (including Foremen/Leads, and Refrigeration Ops), establishing key performance indicators, and other measurable metrics to gauge the efficiency of the staff.
  • Participate in the creation and management of annual operating budget for the cellar operation and manufacturing.
  • Prepare monthly reports to Plant Manager regarding plant activities which include processing activities, safety, problem areas and/or areas requiring decisions. Report on layoffs and/or recalls, disciplinary actions issue, scheduled meetings, and safety incidents.
  • Responsible to see that inventories of plant equipment are updated on an annual basis and presented to the Plant Manager for review (pumps, hoses, fittings, spare motors, etc).
  • Must have competent understanding of high volumetric process flows, as it relates to fluid process movement and wet handling.
  • Must be capable of setting cost recovery initiatives through process improvements.
  • Develop sanitation best practices while taking environmental impacts into consideration.
  • Lead the daily shift change-over meetings with Winemaking, Cellar, and Maintenance.
  • Must embrace and demonstrate The Wine Group's Vision, Mission, and Values of Long-Term Sustainable Value Creation, while being Relentlessly Entrepreneurial, with Empowered People who are Responsible and Trustworthy and keep them in mind when making all decisions
  • This job description reflects managementâs assignment of general functions; it does not restrict the tasks that may be assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS
  • Must demonstrate leadership abilities. Proven track record of high integrity.
  • BS/BA in Chemical Engineering, Food Science, Microbiology, or Business Administration or equivalent education/work experience.
  • Minimum 5-7 years in staff management.
  • Strong project management skills.
  • Comfortable in bargaining unit environments.
  • Adaptive and stable in changing environments.
  • Must get the big picture issues, without losing the eye for details.
  • Proven analytical thinker, complemented by subjectivity for proper decision making.
  • Proven resolution management skills.
  • Seasoned crisis management expertise.
  • Powerful oral and written communicator.
  • Keen listening skills.
  • Capable of managing multiple cross functional professionals.
  • Must possess a strong understanding of ISO 9001-2000, HACCP, BRC, & IFS protocols.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS
  • Ability to work at heights up to 45 feet.
  • Ability to operate various types of machinery to include, lift trucks, pallet jacks, etc. May include the operations of any or all processing equipment including refrigeration compressors, chillers, and condensers.
  • Must be able to lift and carry weights of up to 50 pounds at varying frequencies.
  • Possess the ability to work in a fast pace environment under pressure.
  • Working environment is both indoors and outdoors, with exposure to related equipment and noise levels
  • Ability to perform tasks requiring bending, stooping, standing, and twisting in the performance of various task in the production environment
The Wine Group is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.
title: Cellar Supervisor

description:
We are recruiting for an Environmental, Health and Safety Professional in Fontana, CA, job 921 at consentiumsearch.com

Relocation assistance possible within the US

This is just ONE of the over 30 current EHS positions we are recruiting for nationwide, many of which are confidential and not listed on our website.

There is never any fee or contract for a candidate. All fees are paid by our corporate clients who have hired us to find you!

Job Purpose:
The incumbent will be responsible to support the EHS Manager in aligning site Environmental, Health, and Safety processes with business goals and to engage employees to promote behaviors that will achieve the highest levels of productivity in the safest possible manner. The incumbent will establish, implement and oversee all EHS programs at the facility.

Minimum Requirements:
All potential candidates must be authorized to work for any employer in the United States, employer sponsorship is not available.

Bachelor's Degree from an accredited College / University in Environmental Health & Safety, Chemical Engineering or related discipline

Two (2) or more years of EHS experience in manufacturing facilities including two or more years in a role responsible for staff management

Demonstrated success supporting efficient and effective compliance programs regarding Federal, State and local Safety and Multi-Media Environmental regulations

Demonstrated success driving safety metrics downward

Additional Preferred Competencies:
Professional Certification (GSP, ASP, CSP, CEP, CHMM, REM etc.) from a nationally recognized organization

MBA or Masterâs degree in Occupational Health and Safety, Engineering or related discipline

ISO / OHSAS experience

Major Responsibilities:
Partner with plant and operations serve as Subject Matter Expert (SME) regarding interpretation of federal, state and local EHS regulations

Align corporate and local EHS goals and strategies

Participate in EHS audits and inspections developing remediation plans as needed

Particpate in managing multi-media environmental compliance including, but not limited to: Water (waste, storm); Waste (hazardous and non-hazardous); Air (internal respiratory and external emissions)

Build and maintain positive relationships with federal, state and local regulators

Support Continuous Improvement initiatives regarding EHS policies and programs

Maintain and ensure compliance with all relevant federal, state and local EHS regulations

Lead employee training programs regarding EHS behaviors and compliance

The information listed above is a brief summary of the position and not a complete job description. Other competencies, skill sets and experiences are needed.

Consideration for this position and full job description details will be shared with those who meet or exceed the complete job description.

Response Instructions: Qualified candidates can apply via our website consentiumsearch.com

Due to candidate volume, we ask, no phone calls please.

Reminder: All potential candidates must already be authorized to work for any employer in the United States, employer sponsorship is not available.

description:
Job Description & Qualifications

Summary Objective : To set and pursue practical strategies in chemical reaction engineering relevant to our advanced biomass processing concepts. The pursuit of these and additional novel process concepts must skillfully integrate mechanical aspects (e.g., biomass pretreatment), engineering fundamentals (e.g., heat and mass transfer; kinetics) and biochemical operations into both the experimental investigation and the resultant process concept specifications.

Education Requirements : BS (minimum) in Chemical Engineering; M.S. preferred. Bio-processing focus in education and experience components is strongly preferred.

Work Experience Requirements : 3+ years related industrial development experience (with MS); primary component in pilot- or demonstration-scale operations. Initial responsibilities and compensation will be commensurate with combined education and experience.

Core competencies :

reactor design and scale-up, including heat/mass transfer and material addition

applied biochemistry; bioprocessing operations

applied chemical reaction kinetics

complex experimental design, assessment, and scale-up

statistically-informed data analysis

complex bioprocessing equipment design and specification

separations technologies

R&D; planning, documentation, and presentation

process simulation model development and testing

process de-bottlenecking analysis

technology and knowledge transfer

effectiveness within complex, multidisciplinary teamwork dynamics

Responsibilities :

Development and experimental investigation of advanced reactor design process concepts involving biochemical kinetics, reaction engineering, and heat and mass transfer elements

Design, execution, and interpretation of pilot-scale experiments in integrated biomass pretreatment and conversion processes

Quantification of process potentials in terms of heat and mass balances, conversions in scale-up, process economics implications, and environmental impact benefits.

Engineering the scale-up of key biochemistry steps: strain optimization, propagation protocols, and targeted enzyme expression and/or metabolic pathways

Optimization of process performance in terms of RTL (rate, titer, and yield) and energy integration

Development of process capabilities in protein harvesting, separations, and purification to levels needed for commercial deployment

Specification of bioreactor conditions to optimize performance, scaling from liters to 100s-liters

Development and deployment of control strategies and systems around key operational parameters

Development of strategic intellectual property holdings

Specification of basic data packages for manufacturers; collaborate with these partners to drive deployment of products
title: R/D Engineer

description:
FormFactor Inc.

Livermore, CA

FormFactor serves the top names in the semi-conductor industry. Our customers are producing cutting edge microchips to meet the demands of a fast-paced mobile driven world. These leaders need an expert to test their breakthrough technology, ensure it performs and get it to market fast. That's where FormFactor's revolutionary test equipment probe cards come in. These devices are created, designed and manufactured using complex, electrochemical processes in our growing Livermore fab.

We have an opportunity for a Process Engineer with electroplating expertise to develop and oversee electroplating processes to take our technology from R&D; into production. This role is responsible for the development, implementation, ramp, and continuous improvement of various advanced electrochemical processes used to manufacture our proprietary advanced MEMS probe cards. This engineer will also own and oversee the equipment used to run our electrochemical processes. Successful candidates must demonstrate a balanced and in-depth understanding of both the process physics and chemistry required to achieve a highly stable and predictive process.

KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Unit process development, new design and technology setup.

Troubleshoot and manage overall process sustaining activities for MEMS electrochemical processes and equipment.

Partner with process technicians to provide training, gather information and improve processes.

Analyze data from production and engineering process runs, qualifying changes or additions to manufacturing toolsets and process flows.

Design and execute engineering experiments to either resolve process excursions or to drive process performance improvements.

Demonstrate a disciplined use of statistical methods to establish robust process controls and healthy process capabilities, analyze process yield, and perform experimental design and analysis.

Lead cross-functional projects to successfully solve complex unit process and integration challenges.

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED

Ph.D. in Electrochemistry, Chemical Engineering, Materials Science, or related field required.

Minimum of one year of related experience in process manufacturing or as Process Development Engineer in a MEMS, semiconductor, or other relevant production fab environment.

Ability to demonstrate a balanced and in-depth understanding of both the process physics and chemistry required to achieve a highly stable and predictive process.

Demonstrated experience setting up and sustaining electrochemistry equipment, processes, and various metrology methods associated with the control and monitor of such processes.

Hands-on experience with process, chemistry, and hardware development required for advanced electrochemical processes.

Proven track-record of developing and deploying creative and practical process solutions for high-volume manufacturing is a plus.

General familiarity with other standard MEMS unit processes and/or materials associated with thin films, photolithography, chemical-mechanical polishing and micro-assembly.

Proven ability to analyze and make meaningful inferences from large and sometimes incomplete data.

Experience working with a wide variety of different functions including R&D;, Process Integration, and Operations to effectively accomplish tasks in a timely manner.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Capability to adapt to the companyâs changing needs and priorities and be a self-motivated team player.

Willingness to take responsibility and ownership to aggressively focus on problems either individually or part of a larger team.

FormFactor is committed to providing a work environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect. We are an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and are committed to compliance with all Federal, State, and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, sex (including breastfeeding and related conditions), gender (including gender identity and gender expression), national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, religion, physical or mental disability, marital status, registered domestic partner status, medical condition, military or veteran status, genetic characteristics or information, or any other legally protected characteristic. These protections extend to all employment and management decisions including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotions, pay practices, benefits, disciplinary actions and terminations, and all other terms and conditions of employment.
title: Process Engineer, Electroplating

description:
UTC Aerospace Systems – Aerostructures, one of the world’s largest suppliers of technologically advanced aerospace and defense products for commercial, regional, business and military aircraft, helicopters and other platforms, has an immediate opening for an Environmental Health & Safety Generalist with a strong Environmental background, at our Riverside, CA facility.

The primary focus of this position will be to assist the Environmental, Health and Safety (EH&S;) Manager to ensure compliance with federal, state and local requirements, UTC Aerospace Systems (UTAS) standards and the implementation and oversight for high risk control programs; to oversee, review, update and implement the facility environmental programs, reports, training and procedures. The successful candidate will support in a moderately complex manufacturing environment.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Write, review, update and implement environmental programs, procedures, reports and training as required by UTAS Policy and all Federal, State, and Local regulatory agencies.

Inspect, audit, assess and sample all facility activities related to ensuring safe work practices for compliance as required by law and directed by the Plant Manager and UTAS policy.

Follow the EH&S; Management System and work in a team environment to drive corporate initiatives, analyze and assess trend data, and facilitate relevant Environmental training.

Update and maintain site chemical and hazardous material inventory. Update waste profiles and help oversee hazardous waste removal in accordance with all regulatory requirements.

Help oversee site’s Stormwater Pollution Prevention Plan. May perform inspections, collect samples, and analyze data.

Assist in the development of environmental policies and procedures to ensure the continuous improvement of Environmental programs in the plant, including management systems. Train, coach and mentor others to improve their Environmental awareness and effectiveness.

Investigate accidents and near misses to determine root cause and provides corrective action that eliminates repeat occurrences.

Recognizes and evaluates conditions that are potentially hazardous to health, facilities, equipment and product to determine root cause and provides corrective action that eliminates repeat occurrences.

Develop, coordinate and present training programs for environmental related subjects required by federal, state, local and company requirements.

May act as the facility liaison with regulatory agencies.

Provides advice, consultation, and technical expertise on healthful work environments. Helps site achieve UTAS goals for reduction in water usage, GHG emissions, industrial process wastes, etc. Participate on site’s Green Team to help reduce our environmental footprint.

Uses the Lean tools to make improvements to the EHS management systems.

Interacts with employees on a daily bases to promote relationships, learn the task employees perform and be known as a resource to the employees at the facility.
Qualifications Experience : 2 years experience preferred in environmental, health and safety support in a manufacturing environment. Education Education AA/As required and BA/BS highly preferred in EH&S; or related field, p referred in Environmental Engineering, Environmental Management, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering or related science field.
Typical Educational Requirements:  AA/AS degree w/1–3+ years experience
 BA/BS degree w/0–2+ years experience

description:
D-Wave is seeking to expand its Fabrication team with a full time Senior Process Integration Engineer to support our superconductor IC fabrication process development. Though an asset, existing knowledge of superconductivity is not a requirement. Based in Palo Alto, CA, you will conduct various process development projects, and oversee and maintain the process of record (POR) fab technology in production. You will have the capability to lead the development effort at our foundries; travel anticipated to be approximately 20% of the time.

We have established a unique, proprietary, state-of-the-art superconducting electronics fabrication capability that includes a broad range of Jc targeting, 6 wiring layers, planarized dielectrics, 0.25µm features, and 0.6µm diameter Josephson junctions. Comprising over 128,000 Josephson junctions, the D-Wave 2000Q processors are the largest and most complex superconducting circuit in the world ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Josephson_junction_count ). You will face the challenge of designing fabrication processes in uncharted territory as we develop and implement novel superconducting devices at unprecedented levels of integration.

Responsibilities:
  • Lead new process developments at foundry
  • Design, execute, and analyze experiments
  • Responsible for critical or complex steps or layers in the wafer fabrication process
  • Communicate and present technical information to stakeholder and senior leadership across the organization

Required Qualifications:
  • Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Physics, Chemistry, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or Materials Science ( Master's or Ph.D. is preferred)
  • Preferably 10+ years’ experience in process integration
  • Working knowledge of module processes including thin films deposition, lithography, etch, diffusion, wet process, and CMP
  • Experience with LSI manufacturing or R&D; is strongly preferred
  • Demonstrated understanding the interactions between process and yield, product performance and reliability
  • Must be legally able to work in the US. Ability to obtain US Federal security clearance is preferred
  • Ability to travel within the US (potential for future overseas travel) approximately 20% of the time
  • Strong organizational and decision making skills
  • Excellent written & verbal communication
  • Ability to work well in a fast-paced team environment that is focused on priorities and end results
  • A track record of high productivity and a proven ability to meet deadlines

Interested applicants should apply on our website at http://www.dwavesys.com/careers . We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those who are selected for interviews will be contacted.

It is D-Wave Systems Inc. policy to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status , or any other characteristic protected by federal, state/provincial, local law.

This business uses E-Verify in its U.S. hiring practices to achieve a lawful workforce. E-Verify® is a registered trademark of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security.

Working on projects spanning the entire pharmaceutical development spectrum from discovery through commercial product supply, this role will be key in a corporate environment that is committed to developing and delivering novel, high quality pharmaceutical products to patients in need of safe and effective treatment options in a wide range of clinical indications.

What we expect  MS degree or Ph.D. in chemistry, chemical engineering or related field  15+ years of proven experience in pharmaceutical small molecule synthesis, process development, scale-up and commercial scale manufacturing.  Experience working in a virtual pharmaceutical development environment managing CMO activities  Hands-on, collaborative and cross-functional leader  Exceptional personal management and organization skills  Working knowledge of CFR/ICH/GMP etc.  Ability for occasional travel to CMO sites

description:
This position reports to the Santa Barbara Focalplane facility in Goleta, CA. Understanding the technical details of the Integrated Detector Cooler Assembly (IDCA) product and processes is critical to delivering results that improve the process performance. Works in a team environment to develop, qualify, and implement IDCA process improvements working with design engineering and quality engineering. Supports the daily production needs for rework, training and revised process documentation. Methodical troubleshooting of process issues to drive resolution and understanding of root cause. Also responsible for the coordination with production for performing engineering experiments and implementing process changes and introducing new equipment.

Relocation: Relocation assistance is possible for this exciting position.
The Locale: Goleta is a city in southern Santa Barbara County, California. Goleta is part of the central coast region of California and offers lots of great scenery and is a great place to live and to raise a family. The region is known primarily for agriculture and tourism. Major crops include wine grapes, lettuce, strawberries, and artichokes. Goleta is known for being near the University of California, Santa Barbara campus, although the CDP of Isla Vista is closer. Much of Goleta is considered to be a quiet suburban community while Santa Barbara tends to attract most of the tourists and the area's residents. Goleta is about 8 miles west of the city of Santa Barbara, along the coast (the coast runs east to west in this portion of southern California). Where can you drive to from Goleta? Goleta is 2 hours northwest of Los Angeles. San Francisco is about 5 hours to the north of Goleta. Las Vegas, NV is about 5 hours to the northeast.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelors degree. The position requires working knowledge in automated assembly processes including wire bonding and die attach. Experience in semiconductor packaging and/or processing, either in industry or a university environment. Must be proficient in MS Office (Word, Powerpoint, Excel), familiar with DOE analysis, SPC, and have excellent engineering documentation skills and communication skills. Must have the ability to obtain a security clearance and therefore must be a U.S. Citizen.

Desired skills
Masters degree in Materials Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or Physics. Experience with high volume semiconductor packaging processes. IR industry experience is beneficial. Knowledge of common IR manufacturing processes such as: laser welding, adhesive component attach, wirebonding, vacuum ovens, and plasma processes. Experience with MATLAB and JMP or other data analysis software. Demonstrated ability to manage and lead teams on projects of moderate complexity. Ability to interface effectively from the technician level to senior management.

description:
If you’re a quick learner, enjoy working in the biotech industry, and share our mission of providing ground-breaking impact to medicine, each other, and our patients, Sorrento Therapeutics is the place for you!

OVERVIEW

Sorrento Therapeutics Inc. is a fast growing, clinical stage biopharmaceutical company engaged in the discovery, acquisition, development and commercialization of proprietary drug therapeutics for addressing significant unmet medical needs in the U.S., Europe and international markets. Our primary therapeutic focus is oncology, including the treatment of chronic cancer pain, but we are also developing therapeutic products for other indications, including immunology and infectious diseases.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

We are in need of a Sr. Manufacturing Associate responsible for performing upstream manufacturing tasks including:

1) tracking and control of raw material inventory,

2) maintenance and operation of equipment in cGMP facilities,

3) media and buffer preparation,

4) operation of single use bioreactors for production of clinical and commercial products.

We are looking for someone with:
Bachelor’s degree in a Life Sciences or Chemical Engineering and,

3 to 5 years in GMP environment with experience in GMP production including aseptic processing.

Require 2+ years of experience working with large-scale Single-Use Bioreactors.

Experience with operation of purification skids is a plus.

Experience with cGMP, manufacturing, and data entry.

Demonstrated ability to follow detailed directions in a manufacturing GMP environment.

Must be proficient in Word and Excel.

THE DAY-TO-DAY WORK INCLUDES

Control and track raw material inventory.

Maintain and clean cleanroom facility and equipment.

Perform daily monitoring of equipment and assist Facilities and Engineering personnel as necessary on equipment maintenance and calibration.

Prepare media and buffer solutions.

Maintain cell culture flasks using aseptic technique.

Setup and operate Single-Use Bioreactors, including the Wave Cellbag bioreactors and HyPerforma 100L and 500L systems.

Initiate, review, and revise cGMP Batch Production Records, SOP’s, protocols and reports.

Provide support to cross-functional teams to meet production or timeline demands.

Demonstrate understanding in technical operations, safety, and Good Manufacturing Practice.

Ensure the completeness and accuracy of manufacturing documentation per approved procedures.

YOUR REWARD

Be on the leading edge of immunotherapies for the treatment of cancer.

Earn a competitive salary that allows you to focus your attention on your passion for science.

A comprehensive benefits package including: medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, matching 401k, 10-paid holidays, and three-weeks’ PTO, plus stock options.

If this sounds like the right career to fit your personality and interests, we’re looking forward to meeting you. Please attach your CV or resume, note the following job title: SMA_UPS_KK in the subject line, and email to: Biologics@SorrentoTherapeutics.com

Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster.

Sorrento Therapeutics, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer
title: Senior Manufacturing Associate, Upstream

description:
Eurofins is the world leader in the food, bio/pharmaceutical product testing. It is also number one in the field of environmental laboratory services and one of the global market leaders in agroscience, genomics, discovery pharmacology, and central laboratory services. With over $2 billion in annual revenues and 23,000 employees across 225 sites in 39 countries, Eurofins is a leading international group of laboratories providing an unparalleled range of testing and support services to the pharmaceutical, biopharmaceutical, food, environmental, and consumer products industries and to governments.

Eurofins Lancaster Laboratories, a nationally recognized laboratory, is searching for Analytical Validation Group Leader to support our Professional Scientific Staffing group in South San Francisco, CA.

Analytical Validation Group Leader responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following :
  • Manage group participating in analytical method validations in support of IND and BLA filings under GMP requirements.
  • Ensure that the client receives quality data by reviewing laboratory data for accuracy, clarity, and adherence to GMP and/or GLP regulations and evaluate problems
· Lead team, schedule, and train employees in client environment

· Ensure adherence to highest quality and efficiency standards in laboratory operations

· Ensure coverage and performance

· Foster morale and teamwork
  • Perform validations and equipment validation of samples with a variety of biochemical and biophysical assays including HPLC (SEC, RP, IEC, HIC), capillary electrophoresis sodium dodecyl sulfate (CE-SDS), particle analysis by HIAC, UV spectroscopy, and other compendial methods
  • Coordinate data review process to ensure validation studies meet all quality requirements before final submittal.
  • Prepare data for presentation and write technical reports, and interact with other groups within and outside the department
The ideal candidate would possess :
  • Strong scientific and organizational skills
  • Strong computer skills in MS Word and MS Excel, scientific, and organizational skills
  • Working knowledge of Empower or similar Chromatographic Data System
  • Strong experience in GMP Analytical Method Validation
  • Excellent communication (oral and written) and attention to detail
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team, self-motivation, adaptability, and a positive attitude
  • Ability to learn new techniques, perform multiple tasks simultaneously, keep accurate records, follow instructions, and comply with company policies
  • Experience in generating and reporting metrics to monitor compliance and efficiency.
  • Analytical experience in LC, CE, Wet chemical assays.
  • Analytical Experience with Proteins
  • Strong leadership, initiative, and teambuilding skills
Basic Minimum Qualifications :

· Bachelor’s degree in biochemistry, chemistry, analytical chemistry, chemical engineering, or other related degree concentration, with 6 or more years of relevant industrial experience

· Authorization to work in the United States indefinitely without restriction or sponsorship

Position is full-time, Monday-Friday, 8 a.m.- 5 p.m., with overtime as needed. Candidates currently living within a commutable distance of South San Francisco, California are encouraged to apply.

As a Eurofins Lancaster Labs employee, you will become part of a company that has received national recognition as a great place to work. We offer excellent full-time benefits including comprehensive medical coverage, life and disability insurance, 401(k) with company match, paid holidays and time-off, and dental and vision options.

To learn more about Eurofins Lancaster Laboratories, please explore our website www.eurofinsus.com.

Eurofins is a M/F, Disabled, and Veteran Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.
title: Analytical Validation Leader

description:
At NantKwest, our Senior Manager, Manufacturing Technical Services will provide technical leadership to develop solutions in support of manufacturing and technology transfers for internal and external clinical organizations.

Essential Functions:
Provide technical support for manufacturing process changes, process validation, discrepancy and investigation evaluations, change control, and regulatory submissions. Lab work may be required in order to resolve investigations and/or demonstrate proof-of-concept for proposed process changes.

Facilitate technology transfer to external manufacturing organizations, as well as technology transfer between NantKwest Drug Substance manufacturing sites.

Responsible for authoring technical reports, manufacturing instructions, process validation documents, and portions of regulatory submissions to support licensing processes at new manufacturing sites or process changes.

Responsible for providing ongoing technical support for processes that are currently being manufactured at contract and partner sites. Includes support of discrepancies, investigations, and change control; process data review; implementation of process improvements; and representation of external sites on Product Technical Teams.

Participate in global initiatives and cross-functional teams comprised of subject matter experts in the areas of manufacturing, best practice development, troubleshooting and manufacturing innovation.

Work collaboratively across the NantKwest network to identify and communicate standards and best practices for process design and manufacturing to ensure consistency across the biologics cell culture manufacturing facilities.

Education/Experience Requirements:
MS/PhD in Chemical Engineering/ Biochemical Engineering or Life Sciences with at least 7 years relevant industrial or academic experience (including advanced studies) in cell culture and/or E. coli bioprocess development or in supporting manufacturing operations.

Demonstrated experience with technology transfer and/or process validation.

Sound background in large-scale processing and engineering fundamentals as applied to cell culture processes.

Motivated and able to work independently as well as in teams. Excellent organization and communication skills (both written and verbal).

Experience with statistics in the areas of statistical process control, modeling, and data management is a plus.
